title: Bridge: Sure Trick Problems Give The Feeling of Actual Play
description: Few practical players are willing to devote any time to doubledummy problems, in which the solver sees all four hands. They hear little relation to practical play, and require the adherent to thread his way through a series of complex variations, often involving squeezes and end plays.

title: The Energy Recession
description: Before the Middle East war and the Arab oil embargo, most economists were forecasting nothing worse than slowdown in the growth of the United States economy, with real output expected to advance at a rate of about 3 per cent in 1974. But the energy crisis has markedly worsened the outlook.

title: McCORD SEES TERM AS FAIR AND JUST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30James W. McCord Jr., sentenced to onetofive years in prison for his part in the breakin all the Democratic National Cornmittee office, on June 17, 1972, says that the penalties meted out to him and the other Watergate conspirators were fair and just.

title: White House Finds Jaworski No Easier Than Cox
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Word is quietly spreading from the special Watergate prosecutor's office that if the White House hated Archibald Cox, it will detest Leon Jaworski.

title: Another Kind of Hegemony
description: LONDONThe foreign policy of People's China is deliberately oriented toward the third world of developing nations among which the Chinese include themselves. It is a mistake to think that, simply because relations with Moscow have soured, Peking now looks upon the U.S.A. as an amiable big brother.

title: Japanese, in U.N., Increase Aid to Palestine Refugees
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. V., Nov. 30The Japanese, who have been under pressure to adhere to a proArab policy or face an oil embargo, announced an increase today in their contribution to United Nations aid to Palestine refugees.

title: St. John's Five Wins In Opener
description: CLEMSON, S.C., Nov. 30 (UP)St. John's built a 16point halftime lead and held on to defeat Jacksonville, 69.61, tonight in the opening college basketball game for both teams.;Young Hofstra Trounced Special to The New York Times

title: ALEX METZLER
description: FRESNO, Calif., Nov. 30 (AP)Alex Metzler, who batted 11.285 during six major league baseball seasons, died here today at the age of 70.

title: Questions on Energy
description: Questions and answers designed to clear up confusion about the energy situation arc on Page 19.

title: Computer Finds Suspects
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Nov. 30 (AP)A computer check showed that three young men who were stopped for speeding were wanted for the $16,000 robbery of the Dollar Savings and Loan at Youngstown, Ohio, Nov. 20, the Missouri Highway Patrol said yesterday. The suspects are Benny J. Tillman, 20 years old, of Somerset, N.J.; Andrew Duncan, 25, and John Ralph Thomas, 23, both of Youngstown.

title: People in Sports: Howe, at 45, Calls Comeback Hard Work
description: How does a 45yearold rookie feel after playing hockey games on consecutive nights in Texas and Massachusetts?

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: Two winning numbers were picked yesterday in a special New York lottery:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Bronx Zoo Expects to Raise Fees

title: North Brunswick School Will Get Black Students
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The state ordered the transfer today of the predominantly black 10thgrade class of New Brunswick High School to a virtually allwhite school in neighboring suburban North Brunswick.

title: U.C.L.A. Opener Is Success No. 76
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30 (AP)The University of California, Los Angeles opened its quest for an eighth consecutive National Collegiate championship tonight with its 70th consecutive college basketball victory, an easy 10179 decision over Arkansas.

title: ASSETS RISE BY 18% FOR PENSION FUNDS
description: Assets of private pension funds in 1972 rose about 18 per cent above the 1971 level, it was indicated yesterday in the annual summary of the pensionfund management survey conducted by Standard & Poor's/InterCapital, Inc.

title: Sports Today
description: C.C.N.Y. at Columbia, 8 P.M. (RadioWKCR, 7:45 P.M.) Princeton at Fordham, 8 P.M. (RadioWFUV, 7:30 P.M.) Merrimack at L.I.U., 8 P.M.; St. Francis at Pace, 8 P.M.

title: A Rare Lunar Graze Tomorrow at 5: 28 P.M.
description: At 5:28 P.M. tomorrow anyone looking at the sky through a telescope on a particular stretch of land between Fort Dix, N.J. and Stony Brook, LI. will be able to watch the moon pass in front of a sta rand see the star twinkle as it appears and disappears past the valleys and behind the mountains of the southern edge of the moon.

title: FOOTBALL TODAY
description: AlabamaAuburn.

title: Army (09) vs. Navy (37), But 93,000 Will Be There
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 Desperation may be the strongest motivation for the Army and Navy football teams tomorrow when they meet in the 74th game between the service academies at John F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium.

title: KROGH FILES PLEA OF GUILTY IN RAID ON PSYCHIATRIST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Egil Krogh Jr., who headed the special White House investigation unit known as the plumbers, pleaded guilty today to a civil rights violation growing out of the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist in 1971.

title: BRINEGAR WEIGHS MASSTRANSIT AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30In a major shift spurred by the energy crisis, Transportation Secretary Claude S. Brinegar said today that the Nixon Administration was moving toward a broader look at mass transit that would include the use of Federal funds for operating subsidies.

title: Unishops Petitions For Reorganization
description: Unishops, Inc., a chain store organization with a volume of more than $200million annually, filed a petition yesterday for an arrangement with its creditors under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Escaped Convict Is Slain; Five Hostages Are Safe
description: BARNSTABLE, Mass., Nov. 30 (AP)An escaped convict Ifrom Norfolk state prison was shot to death today by an offduty patrolman after he held family hostage for 26 hours, the police said.

title: Pentagon Awards Contracts For Close to $140Million
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30, (Reuters)  The Pentagon to day awarded six major contracts with a total value of nearly $140million.

title: Kissinger's Nobel Cash Goes to Children of G.I.'s
description: OSLO, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Secretary of State Kissinger, in a letter to the Norwegian Nobel Prize Committee, announced tonight that he had established a $57,500 scholarship fund for children of American servicemen killed or missing in action in Indochina.

title: HAIG WILL TESTIFY ABOUT TAPE GAP Nixon Aide Will Go to Cour at Prosecution's Request, According to Garment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30President Nixon's chief of staff, Alexander M. Haig Jr., will testify in Federal Court next week about the circumstances sorrounding the discovery of the 18minute gap on one of the subpoenaed Watergate tape recordings.

title: U.N. SEEKS REVIVAL OF MIDEAST TALKS
description: CAIRO, Nov. 30The commander of the United Nations Emergency Force made separate approaches to the highestranking military leaders of Egypt and Israel today in an effort to get the suspended) talks on the CairoSuez road's started again.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If President Nixon is serious in his search for historical precedent to guide him in handling his multiple dilemmas emanating from the Watergate fiasco, I respectfully suggest he stop repeating his erroneous version of Jefferson's position on confidentiality and start reading about two more recent figures whose problems very closely resembled his ownwhich is, at heart, crisis of confidence in the man and in his Administration.

title: Mark Twain Devotees Mark His 138th Birthday in Hartford House He Built
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 30  In the splendid Victorian house that Mark Twain built in Hartford, the 138th anniversary of his birthday was celebrated last night by a group of men Eland women who cling to the memory of the famed writer, the creator of Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn.

title: Waterbury's Unemployment Drops Below Level of 6%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)The number of major cities with substantial unemployment of 6 per cent or more declined by one in November to 33 when Waterbury, Conn., was removed from the list, the Labor Department said today.

title: Dance: Contemporary Art Company
description: The Ballet of Contemporary Art Company has a professiona polish, though its ballets generally do not have much imaginative bite. Its artistic director is Keith Lee, who draws dancers from American Ballet Theater and who choreographed most of the dances presented Thursday evening at the Theresa L. Kaufmann Concert. Hall.

title: Noted Businessmen Sought Chessie
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 30The unsuccessful attempt at a friendly takeover of Chessie System, Inc., earlier this week involved an array of prominent names in the world of business and finance, it was learned today.

title: M.I.T. Giving a Course on Failure As a Dominating Theme in Society
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 30Nothing seems to work these days. The mail is late, the railroads are bankrupt, products fail, fuel is scarce and Government seems helpless to cope. Few forces seem to dominate modern life like the fear of failurefailure in school, business, marriage, health.

title: R. E. Smith, Multimillionaire Who Aided in Astrodome, Dies
description: HOUSTON. Nov. 30 (AP)R. E. Smith, a multimillionaire former who was instrumental in bringmg majorleague baseball to Houston and controlled the land, on which the Astrodome was built, died last evening at the age of 79. In recent years, his wealth had been estimated at is total of more than 8500million.

title: U.S. Ready to Help Dutch in Oil Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The United States has told the Netherlands that it is prepared in principle to come to her aid in case the Arab oil embargo causes a serious emergency for her, Administration officials said today.

title: Big Board Seat Sold
description: A seat on the New York Stock Exchange hands at $110,000, down $15.000 from the last sale, on Nov. 23, the exchange announced.

title: RADIATION BELTS OF JUPITER DEEP
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 30  Dr. James A. Van Allen, discoverer of the earth's radiation belts, reported today that data from the Pioneer 10 spacecraft indicated that radiation surrounding Jupiter extended out farther than had been predicted in belts considerably different than earth's.

title: Campaign Reform Dispute Snarls Status of U.S. Debt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Congressional eforts to finance Presidential elections with public funds rather than large private contributions bogged down today in a parliamentary squabble and the threat of a oneman filibuster in the Senate.

title: Minor to Moderate Quake Is Reported in Four States
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 30 (UPI)A minor to moderate earthquake was felt in four states early today, but there were no reports of injury or major damage.

title: Nixon Is Reported As Still Possessing Deposit of $100,000
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) President Nixon still owns a $100,000 certificate of deposit purchased Sept. 9, 1969, in a bank headed by his friend C. G. Rebozo, sources said today.

title: New U.S.Soviet Agreement Widens Scientific Cooperation
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30  President Nixon's science adviser, Dr. H. Guyford Stever, signed a new accord here today calling for more specific SovietAmencan scientific cooperation and indicated that it would not be affected by the controversy over Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident Soviet physicist.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DROP, THEN RALLY
description: After a weak opening, soybean future prices on the Chicago Board of Trade rallied yesterday. The movement came mostly on the news of a short age of hexane, which is used as a solvent in the crushing process that reduces the beans to oil and highprotein meal.

title: Krogh's Court Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Following is the text of statement read today in Federal court by Egil Krogh Jr. upon entering a plea of guilty to a civil rights charge.

title: SALERNO TO JOIN NEW QUEENS D.A.
description: Ralph F. Salerno, who Vol more than 20 years in the intelligence unit of the New York City Police Department, will be chief rackets investigator in the Queens District!ness Attorney's office, it was announced yesterday by State Senator Nicholas Ferraro, the District Attorneyelect.

title: Notes on People
description: Unassisted except for crutches, Edward M. Kennedy Jr. left the Georgetown University Hospital yesterday and went home to McLean, Va. The 12yearold son of the Democratic Senator from Massachusetts carried with him a football from the coach of the Washington Redskins, George Allen. Physicians at Georgetown amputated the youth's right leg Nov. 17 in the hope of arresting bone cancer. Teddy will spend the next several days at home catching up with is schoolwork. . . . In Los Angeles, Elizabeth Taylor was said to be looking great and doing very well in her recovery from surgery to remove an ovarian cyst and to correct an intestinal disorder. She is expected to he out of the hospital in a week. . . . And here in New York, W. Averell Harriman, the diplomat and former Governor, was discharged from Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center after a threeday stay for undiclosed reasons. The 82yearold Mr. Harriman was admitted Tuesday.

title: Beame Is Considering Puerto Rican Appointees
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame said last night that he was considering the appointment of Puerto Ricans to important posts in his administration.

title: T.W.A. Talks Go On
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Talis between Trans World Airlines and its 5,300 striking stewardesses continued today but an airline spokesman said there was no appreciable progTess. The fact that they're meeting might be considered progress but I have nothings else worth reporting, the spokesman said.

title: St. John's Five Wins In Opener
description: CLEMSON, S.C., Nov. 30 (UPI)St. John's built a 16point halftime lead and held on to defeat Jacksonville, 6964, tonight in the opening college basketball game for both teams.

title: U.S. Plans to Seek New Nuclear Arms In Case Talks Fail
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger said today that the Administration would propose development of a new series of strategic weapons as insurance against the possible failure by the United States and the Soviet Union to agree to further limitation of their nuclear arsenals.

title: MISS CAROLINE HORN
description: Caroline Ethel Horn, a lighting specialist who retired in 1954 after spending the greater part of 50 years with the Electrical Testing Laboratories, 2 East End Avenue, died Thursday in a nursing home at Newbury Park, Calif, Her age was 87.

title: Jerusalem Police Break Up Protest by Kin of P.O.W.'s
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 30 (UPI) Policemen using water cannons and clubs broke up a street demonstration today by relatives of Israeli war prisoners and missing soldiers. The protestors, carrying placards and shouting, had demanded a meeting with Prime Minister Golda Meir.

title: Governors Said to Lean To Port Voice for Mayor
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beanie said last night that Governor Rockefeller was sympathetic to his proposal that the Mayor of New York be permitted to name a member of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Transit Turnabout?
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayorelect Beame have returned from their pilgrimage to Washington with Federal funds to help save this city's 35cent fare but with a new basis for hope that some may be forthcoming soon.

title: News Summary and Index SATURDAY, DECEMBER 1, 1973
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Jersey Welfare Mothers Find Careers
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30  Two years ago, Rosa Thomas was just another statistic on the Essex County welfare roles. She was 25 years old and the sole support for three children. She had only an elementary school education, no steady job and, with the children to care for, little prospect of finding one.

title: Edwin H. Blanchard Dies; Newsman, Publicity Agent
description: Edwin H. Blanchard, a former reporter for the World in New York and an editorial writer for The New York Sun from 1925 to 1951, died yes. terday at his home, 3:543 84th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 78 years old.

title: Judge Clears Pfizer, Cyanamid And BristolMyers in Trust Suit
description: A Federal judge acquitted Charles Pfizer & Co., the American Cyanamid Company and the BristolMyers Company yesterday of conspiracy and of monopolizing the market for broadspectrum antibiotics.

title: OilRelated Cut in Training Worries U.S. Military
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Current fuel shortages would not interfere with the United States' ability to make an immediate military response, if necessary, in an international crisis, according to Arthur I. Mendolia, Assistant Secretary of Defense for Installations and Logistics.

title: A.E.C. Still Investigating Gas Decline at Rio Blanco
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The Atomic Energy Commission said today that it was still investigating a problem that came to light recently in connection with its May 17 underground nuclear blast in western Colorado to stimulate release of natural gas from tight sandstone formations.

title: ROBERT V. NEW
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 30Robert V. New, an oil man who had developed several major fields in southern California, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack in Methodist Hospital.. He was 69 years old and lived here.

title: Minority Capitalism: Only Game in Town
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Much evidence is being produced purporting to show that the Nixon Administration's minority capitalism program has been severely abused and politicized and was made to serve the President's reelection effort among minorities last year.

title: 3 South Dakota Brothers Held in Death of 4 Youths
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Nov. 30 (AP)  Three brothers were captured without resistance and charged with murder in the shotgun slayings of four Sioux Falls teen-agers Nov. 17, the authorities reported today.

title: JAPAN'S ECONOMY STILL WORSENING
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30Japanese economic statistics released today pointed up a steadily worsening situation in the country.

title: Waiting for Kohoutek
description: Comet Kohoutek's approaching rendezvous with planet: earth duiring the Christmas holidays is causing no particular alarm. This was not the case the last time one of these rare and awesome outerspace travelers intersected our orbit. In 1910, people all over the world fell into states of anxiety or outright panic as they nervously awaited the arrival of Halley's comet.

title: SENATEHOUSE UNIT CUTS H.E.W. FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) House and Senate conferees agreed today to cut $400million from a $32.9billion appropriations bill for the Department of Health, Education and Welfare in the hope of avoiding a veto.

title: Truck Driver Sues Ford
description: DETROIT, Nov, 30 (AP)A 26yearold truck driver who says his right leg was severed last February when his truck's clutch assembly flew apart has filecra $1million damage suit against Ford Motors Company. The driver. Ronald G. Ralston of Bryant hid., was hauling feed grain in a Ford semitruck tractor when the mishap occurred, according to the suit.

title: WINE TALK
description: The disclosure in recent days that Almaden Vineyards agreed last year to pay the Federal Government a quarter of a million dollars, after the Government charged that the company had mislabeled wine, gives rise to some thoughts about the status of the wine business these days.

title: Surgery Unkindest Cut for Mendenhall
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 30 John Mendenhall went over the rapids into a Lake Houston spillway in an outboard motorboat last April but that wasn't nearly as scary as what he's facing this weekend.

title: Statue Returned in Washington to Cameroon Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30FrancoisXavier Tchoungui, the Cameroon Ambassador to the United States, formally accepted today for return to his country next week the AfoAKom, the wood carving sacred to the people of the tiny kingdom of Kom in West Cameroon.

title: Police Wives Fight Use Of Women in Car Teams
description: The wives of 15 New York City policemen demonstrated yesterday in front of the 112th Precinct station at 6840 Austin Street, Forest Hills, Queens, to protest the Police Department's use of women officers in carpatrol learns with their hushands. The practice of using women as patrolcar partners with men was begun seven rmonths ago.

title: Most Gas Stations Will Close Tomorrow
description: Most of the nation's gasoline stations will be closed tomorrow, state surveys disclose. But emergency services are being; established and some stationsestimates run up to 20 or 25; per centmay be open, which means gasoline will be hard but not always impossible to find during the nation's first gasolineless Sunday.

title: KOGAN IN TOP FORM WITH AMIABLE MUSIC
description: When a Soviet artist plays in New York without disruptive demonstrations these days, it's. news, and Leonid Kogan's. violin recital in Fisher Hall on Wednesday night proceeded. smoothly, undisturbed by protests.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Weiskopf Tied for South Africa Lead

title: 3 Big Oil Companies Raise Prices of Gasoline Today
description: At least three of the nation's leading oil companies disclosed yesterday that they were raising gasoline prices this morning, when motorists are expected to be stocking up in advance of anticipated widespread closing of service stations throughout the country.

title: Kansas City Postmaster Fatally Stabbed in Office
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan., Nov. 30 (AP)Robert L. Roberts, post1 master here for 14 years, was stabbed fatally in his office yesterday afternoon, and the police arrested a former mail handler who had been disImissed twice in the last year.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Utility Buys GasPipeline Site

title: Reform Not Abolition
description: The National Commission on the Reform of Secondary Education has made some sound recommendations for easing the excessive rigidity of high school curricular and operating procedures, but its call for lowering the compulsory attendance age to 14 is not one of them.

title: DONALD ADAMS, LED RESERVE OFFICERS
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Nov. 30Donald Bennett Adams, former president of the Reserve Officers Association and a former president and chairman of the board of ThompsonStarrett Company, construction, died yesterday at his home here. He was 83 years old.

title: Votes in Congress The Week's Tally for Metropolitan Area
description: Senate

title: S. B. A. Aide Says He Refused To Destroy Audit on Matthew
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Thethe Small Business Administration investgator who audited four businesses headed by Dr. Thomas W. Matthe testified today that one of his superiors in the agency suggested that he destroy his 84page report on the Matthew enterprises and that he refused.

title: 3 Big Oil Companies Raise Prices of Gasoline Today
description: At least three of the nation's leading oil companies disclosed yesterday that they were raising gasoline prices this morning, when motorists are expected to be stocking up in advance of anticipated widespread closing of service stations throughout the country.

title: Store Criticized in Japan's Fire Disaster
description: KUMAMOTO, Japan, Nov. 30 (Reuters)  The department store destroyed by a fire that killed at least 101 people yesterday had been warned several times of its vulnerability to such a disaster, authorities, said today.

title: Former Model Cities Aide Gets 2 Years in Bribe Case
description: John Sanders the former acting director of the HarlemEast Harlem Model Cities program, was sentenced to two years in Federal prison yesterday on his guilty plea to conspiring to receive a $25,500 bribe from a Catskill youthcamp owner.

title: More Aid to Aged Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Senator Edward M. Kennedy. Democrat of Massachusetts, urged a Senate appropriations subcommittee today to restore $40million that was deleted from legislation providing for a special employment program for the elderly.

title: Architect Got U.S. Contract, Then Gave G.O.P. $50,000
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP)A prominent architect said today that he secretly contributed $50,000 to President Nixon's, 1972 campaign fund after his firm received a Federal contract, worth nearly $1million.

title: GANG INQUIRY AIMS AT LINK TO POLICE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30A statewide grand jury is investigating possible police and municipal corruption in the Newark area following the indictment yesterday of 10 reputed members of a renegade crime fanrily on murder and armed robbery charges.

title: Nets' Erving and Co. Rout Rockets
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov, 30The book on the Nets is that their bench is not strong. At least that's what Alex Hannum, the coach of the Denver Rockets, said tonight after New York battered hs team, 123102, at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: White Is Glad to Meet Namath Again
description: Someone showed Joe Namath a picture the other day and asked if he'd like to have it for his scrapbook. Namath glanced at the photo, then laughed and politely declined the offer.

title: Greece Won't Try Deposed President
description: ATHENS, Nov. 30The new Greek leadership has decided against bringing George Papadopoulos, the deposed President, to trial.

title: Nixon Morality Assailed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30 (AP)Senator Harold E. Hughes, Democrat of Iowa, said here yesterday that the Aciministration was morally bankrupt and that he was dismayed that the Senate Watergate committee had postponed its hearings.

title: Watergate Unit Pressing Hughes Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Senate Watergate Committee is preparing for a showdown next week with a dozen employes of Howard R. Hughes who have refused to answer the committee's subpoenas.

title: She Has a Fashion Lesson for Intellectuals
description: Women come into my shop and they say, I like your things, you must dress me, and I tell them, No I cannot do that, you must dress yourself, that is your work.

title: Art: 2 Rewarding Collage Shows
description: It's a long stretch from the Kraushaar Galleries, 1055 Madison Avenue at 80th Street, to Acts of Art at 15 Charles Street, near Seventh Avenue South in Greenwich Village. But if you can make it, both galleries have rewarding collage exhibitions, Fred Laros's at Kraushaar and James Denmark's at Acts of Art.

title: Tentative Accord Reached By Stereotypers and Post
description: John Kennedy, president of New York Stereotypers Local No. l, yesterday announced that his union had reached a tentative agreement on a new contract with The New York Post.

title: Writer Is Absolved In Narcotics Case Involving Hoffman
description: Michael Drosnin, who was indicted last Sept. 5 along with Abbie Hoffman and three others in connection with an alleged sale of three pounds of cocaine to two undercover agents, was cleared yesterday by a new, grand jury after it received testimony that he had been at the scene in his capacity as a reporter on an assignment from Harper's magazine.

title: LORIN W. KEMP
description: EDISON, N.J., Nov. 30Lorin W. Kemp, who retired in 1956 as manager of the Raritan Copper Works in Perth Amboy, died of cancer today at his home, 315 Plainfield Road. He was 84 years old. Mr. had been with the

title: British Yachtsman Is Murdered Outside St. Thomas Apartment
description: ST. THOMAS, Nov, 30 (Reuters)Jan Victor Major, 56 years old, an internationally known yachtsman and World War II British commando, was stabbed to death by an apparent intruder outside his apartment here last night, the police reported.

title: Many Small Grotesques In Sculpture by King
description: In the exhibition of recent sculpture by William King that opened this week at the Terry Dintenfass Gallery, 18 East 67th Street, we are offered a multitude of miniature grotesques. There are 14 bronzes and 34 ceramics, all quite small and all devoted to figures or heads. Some are said to be portraits, and all appear to derive from the observation of living models.

title: Th' Vice Prisidincy
description: It's sthrange about th' viceprisidincy, said Mr. Dooley. Th' prisidincy is th' highest office in th' gift iv the' people. Th' viceprisidincy is th' next highest an' th' lowest. It isn't a crime exactly. Ye can't be sint to jail f'r it, but it's a kind iv a disgrace. It's like writin' anonymous letters. At a convintion nearly all th' dillygates lave as soon as they've nommynated th' prisidint f'r fear wan iv thim will be nommynated f'r viceprisidint. . . .

title: Cambodia Force Routed Near Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 30A battalion of Cambodian Government troops was badly bloodied today when fought its way out of an important, encircled garrison 12 miles east of Phnom Penh.

title: Mahaffey Still Leader at 206
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov 30John Mahaffey retained the lead in the $150,000 Walt Disney World golf classic with a 54hole total of 206 today, but Jack Nicklaus was in a challenging group of five trailing the 25yearold Texan by two strokes in second place.

title: LOVE NARKS ON GAS RATIO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 John A. Love, director the President's Energy Policy Office, declared tonight that gasoline rationing is a possibility that we must face.

title: JAMES F. CLARK
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 30 James F. Clark, former president of American Car and Foundry Industries, Inc., died last evening at Greenwich Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 132 Pecksland Road.

title: SENATE APPROVES 11% PENSION RISE, TAX HELP FOR POOR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Senate passed legislation tonight increasing Social Security benefits and, for the first time since the start of the program in 1936, easing somewhat the burden of Social Security taxes on lowincome families.

title: James G. Vermillion Dead; Master
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Nov. 30James G. Vermillion, retired) master of St. George's School, died today at his home Middletown. He was 73 years

title: New Soviet Tractor Plant May Require U.S. Role
description: The Soviet Union has begun to publicize a large new industrial project that may involve substantial purchases of equipment from abroad, including the United States.

title: GANG INQUIRY AIMS AT LINK TO POLICE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30A state wide grand jury is investigating possible police and municipal corruption in the Newark area following the indictment yesterday of 10 reputed members of a renegade crime family on murder and armed robbery charges.

title: Judge Clears Pfizer, Cyanamid And BristolMyers in Trust Suit
description: A Federal judge acquitted Charles Pfizer & Co., the American Cyanamid Company and the BristolMyers Company yesterday of conspiracy and of monopolizing the market for broadspectrum antibiotics.

title: Mobutu Seizes Alien Farming Concerns in Zaire
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Nov. 30 (AP)  President Mobutu Sese Seko announced today the nationalization of all foreign agricultural companies operating in his country, but promised compensation for seized properties.

title: Body Found at Curb Ina Box of Garbage; Police Hold Suspect
description: The police said yesterday that a 33yearold man had shot and killed an acquaintance during an earlymorning argumeat, put the body in a wooden crate, and then put the crate, covered with garbage, in front of the building where he lived, to be picked up by sanitationmen.

title: BRINEGAR WEIGHS MASSTRANSIT AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30In a major shift spurred by the energy crisis, Transportation Secretary Claude S. Brinegar said today that the Nixon Administration was moving toward a broader look at mass transit that would include the use of Federal funds for operating subsidies.

title: A Telethon in Miami to Raise Funds to Help Cuban Refugees
description: Television station WLTV in Miami will present a 14hour telethon Sunday from 10 A.M. 10 midnight to raise funds for the purchase of 10.000 airplane tickets to help transfer refugee Cubans from Spain to the United States.

title: STEEL PRODUCERS PLAN PRICE RISES
description: Major steel producers announced yesterday that they would follow the United States Steel Corporation in planning price increases for a wide variety of products beginning Jan. 1

title: U. N. COMMANDER SEEKS TO REVIVE TALK IN MIDEAST
description: CAIRO, Nov. 30The commander of the United Nations Emergency Force made separate approaches to the highestranking military leaders of Egypt and Israel today in an effort to get the suspended talks on the CairoSuez road started again.

title: High School Notes
description: The inscription on the button reads: The In Group. When students at George Washington High School in Manhattan began noticing it on the collars of their classmates, they tried to find out what it was all about. To get the answer, the students were told, they would have to have 100 per cent attendance for at least two months.

title: FRANK FALLON
description: EASTON, Mass., Nov. 30 (AP) Frank Fallon, a Boston sportscaster, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home. He was 77 years old.

title: Woman, 23, Slain in Bar
description: A 23yearold Brooklyn woman was shot and killed in a Booklyn bar yesterday by an unknown man. The victim, Linda Walker of 290 Blake Avenue, was standing at the bar, at 704 Nostrand Avenue, when she was shot.

title: Questions on Energy Situation
description: Considerable confusion abounds about the nation's present energy situation, much of it the result of conflicting figures and their interpretation. The following questions and answers are an attempt to clear up some of the confusion.

title: Sabres' Perreault Drills
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 30 (AP)Gil Perreault, the Buffalo Sabres' center, skated today for the first time since he fractured his lower right leg on Oct. 28. He planned to fly with the Sabres to Detroit and work out there before the game against the Red Wings tomorrow night.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Sees Deception As Cause for Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations in the third of a series of statements calling for President Nixon's impeachment, said Yesterday that removal proceedings were warranted because Mr. Nixon has consistently deceived the American people regarding Watergate and related matters.

title: U.S.Latin America Talk Gains As Colombian Meets Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The opening of a new dialogue between the United States anc ?? America was agreed or ?? in a meeting betweer ?? of State Kissinger anc the Colombian Foreign Minister Alfredo Vzquez Carrizosa.

title: People and Business
description: At a time when the securities business is worried about its unprofitability and the absence of individual investors, the Securities Industry Association has selected as its new president the head of a profitable regional concern that does most of its volume with individuals.

title: 12d School Board Vote Confirms a Victory for Beatty,
description: Last Tuesday's rerun of the May school elections in a central Brooklyn district, with the same field of 32 candidates, has confirmed the disputed victory of State Senator Vander L. Beatty. His wife was indicted the week before on electionfraud charges.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Nov. 30Margie Gengler, Princeton class of 197:3, will return to her alma mater tomorrow along with some of the world's top tennis stars to participate in a procelebrity exhibition in Jadwin Gymnasium benefiting the Princeton community tennis program and the Princeton University tennis teams.

title: Peter Grose Is Appointed To Times Editorial Board]
description: The appointment of Peter Grose to the editorial hoard of The New York Times was an mounced yesterday by John B. Oakes, editor of the editorial! page.

title: Eastern Will End Shuttles At Newark and Montreal
description: Eastern Airlines announced yesterday that to achieve fuel savings ordered by the Nixon Administration, it would end its shuttle services connecting Newark with Boston and Washington, effective Jan. 7. In addition, it will drop its shuttle service to Montreal, which operates from La Guardia Airport.

title: Music: A Britten Trilogy
description: Benjamin Britten's three church parableshe asks that they not he described as operasconstitute a major effort to meld two ancient theatrical traditions: the Japanese Nodrama and the medieval Christian mystery or miracle play. The first of the trilogy, Curlew River, was presented Wednesday night in St. Stephen's Church on West 69th Street, as part of a series of nine performances of the cycle that will run through Dec. 19.

title: Going Like Fifty
description: NORTH EGREMONT, Mass.When the President suggested a selfimposed speed limit of 50 miles an hour, he overlooked the impact of his remarks on an important aspect of the national character  a tendency toward priggishness. To my generation, brought up to think that a mile a minute was going like hell, or, as we used to say, licketysplit, his proposal seemed reasonable enough in the circumstances. Or so I thought until I began to practice what he preached.

title: Partly Erased Tape Scrutinized at Lab
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Technical experts appointed by Chief District Judge John J. Sirica have begun examining apartly erased White House tape recording at a New York City laborato.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW DROP AGAIN
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell again yesterday in light trading.

title: Crown Matrimonial Closing
description: Crown Matrimonial, the Royce Ryton play about King Edward VIII and the events leading to his abdication, will end its Broadway run at the Helen Hayes Theater on Dec, after 79 performances. Eileen Herlie and George Grizzard are costars in the Lester OstermanRichard Horner production.

title: Boston Detective Is Killed Trying to Prevent a Holdup
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (AP)A Boston police detective whose brother, also a policeman, was slain during a bank robbery three years ago, was shot in the head and killed while trying to, prevent an armed robbery by three men of a loan office today.

title: 150 Seoul Reporters Strike, Calling for Press Freedom
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov., 30About 150 local reporters went on a 24hour strike today to support their demands for guarantees of freedom of the press.

title: Jewish Guide Offers Food for Thought and Palate
description: Would you like to know how to turn a ram's horn Into a shofar? Do you need help in organizing a seder or building a sukkah? Would you Iike a recipe for gefilte fish that is guaranteed tasty by Richard Siegel's mother?

title: Insurance Rates Hearings
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (AP)State Insurance Commissioner John Ryan said today that he planned to open hearings next; week into the possibility of freezing 1974 auto insurances rates in Massachusetts at their 1973 level. This came in response to a request from Gov. Francis W. Sargent, who earlier in the day signed a bill to allow Mr. Ryan to order rebates in 1974 if the insurance companies make excess profits as a result of safer driving rules caused by the energy crisis.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: Two winning numbers were picked yesterday in a special New York lottery:

title: Rangers Trade Youth for Muscle and Get Marotte
description: Captain Crunch is coming to the Rangers.

title: DEEP RECESSION SEEN FOR EUROPE
description: PARIS, Nov. 30An assessment by Common Market authorities of the impact of the oil shortage on European economic activity is predicting the deepest recession in a quarter century next year.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS 1 Coarse meal

description: BASKETBALL C.C.N.Y. at Columbia, 8 P.M. (RadioWKCR, 7:45 P.M.) Princeton at Fordham, S P.M. (RadioWFUV, 7:30 P.M.) Merrimack at L.I.U., S P.M.; St. Francis at Pace, S P.M.

title: RISES DEFERRED FOR 1974 AUTOS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The Cost of Living Council suspended temporarily today proposed new price increases on 1974 model automobiles. The council said in a statement that it needed more time to review price proposals, which were considered at a public hearing last week.

title: OFFICIAL ATTACKS HEALTHFUND CUT
description: The chairman of the Presidents Cancer Panel attacked the Nixon Administration yesterday for cutting the funds for general biomedical research and the training of young scientists at the same time as it greatly increased money for cancer research.

title: Business Briefs
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 30 (UPI)Canadian oil exports to the United States will be reduced to 977,000 barrels a day in December from 1.03 million barrels in November and 1.2 million earlier this year.

title: Subsidized Housing Units in Westchester Dedicated
description: HAWTHORNE, N. Y., Nov. 30Two years ago the residents of the quiet Westchester County town of Mount Pleasant reacted angrily to a proposal by the Urban Development Corporation to build 1,000 garden apartments on the Grasslands campus of New York Medical College.

title: ASPIN CITES EXPORTS OF U.S. GASOLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (LTD Representative Les Aspin said today that despite the threat of rationing, the United States exported 493,000 barrels of gasoline during October.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: City Study Scores Failure Of Welfare Job Programs
description: Three major city and state job programs for welfare recipients here were described yesterday as inadequate to help the 174,000 relief clients the city believes are potentially employable.

title: Nixon Signs Extension Of Grand Jury's Life
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)President Nixon signed a bill today to extend for as much as a year,'if necessary, the life of the Watergate grand jury. The grand jury had been scheduled to go out of business next Tuesday. The extension was requested by the Department of Justice.

title: TV Review
description: Four hours is a lot of Frankenstein, especially an uneven one derived from the original tale by Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley and absurdly claiming to be the true story. Half the National Broadcasting Company's network special was shown last night; it will continue tonight at 9.

title: Argentina Pledges Safeguards After Ford Co. Evacuates Staff
description: BUENOS AlRES, Nov. 30 (AP)The Argentine Government pledged today to take all measures net:essary to protect, foreigners after death threats by terrorists had caused the Ford Motor Company's subsidiary here to move its 25 American executives out of the country.

title: Skylab Is Maneuvered on Picture Sweep
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)America's giant space laboratory was put through a roller coaster maneuver on its 200th day in space today as the Skylab 3 astronauts looked for a better angle to shoot pictures of the earth.

title: 6 Letter Bombs in Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 30 (UPI)Security officers announced today that they uncovered six more letter bombs in Tel Aviv's central post office yesterday.

title: Risky Maneuvers
description: Machinegun and mortar fire is once again breaking the silence along the Suez Canal. The Egyptian and Israeli generals, who had made significant progress in pacifying the front lines, have called off their facetoface negotiations. Israel and Egypt may be on the brink of their most important opportunity for a genuine political settlement, but anxiety remains strong that the forthcoming peace conference may be preceded by one more burst combat.

title: LYONS TO ACQUIRE ICE CREAM MAKER
description: The United Brands Company announced yesterday it had agreed to sell its 83 per cent interest in the BaskinRobbins Ice Cream Company to an American subsidiary of J. Lyons & Co., a major British fastfood chain. United Brands said the transaction was valued at about $37million in cash and notes, or $18.50 for each Baskin  Robbins: share, subject to downward adjustment if BaskinRobbins's 1973 earnings were less than 107 per cent of its 1972 earnings.

title: Sunday Motorists Told to Plan Ahead
description: Motorists planning to travel during the weekend should have a clear idea of how far they plan to travel, the range of their cars on a tank of gasoline and how they will handle emergency breakdowns, highway officials warned yesterday.

title: Beverly Sills Hailed In Coast Premiere For I Puritani
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29A cheering audience saluted Beverly Sills during and after her performance Wednesday night as the griefstricken Elvira in the local debut of Bellini's 1 Puritani at the Los Angeles Music Center.

title: Television News With Subtitles Planned in Boston for the Deaf
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 30 Thousands of persons who are deaf, or whose hearing is partially impaired, will he aided by a system of captioning of television pictures developed by WGBHTV, a Boston educational station.

title: Germans Sweat for Cars
description: BONN (UPI)The privilege of driving a car in Germany is is case of hard labor. To pay government taxes on his car, including gas taxes, the German car owner works 114 hours, up from 104 in 1972, according to the Federal Office of Statistics.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 30 (AP)Tom Weiskopf of the United States shot a threeunderpar 67 today and was tied for first place with Vince Baker of South Africa with a 206 total after the third round of the South African Professional Golfers' Association tournament. Two strokes behind were two South Africans, Gary Player and Hugh Baiocchi. At 209 was Bobby Verwey of South Africa, followed by Noel Hunt of Britain at 210. Baiocchi shot a courserecord 65 today.

title: ExNavy Aquanaut Accused Of Fraud and Embezzlement;
description: SAN DIEGO. Nov. 30 (AP)Federal charges of fraud and embezzlement have been filed against a former Navy aquanaut who was lead diver in last summer's attempt to salvage treasure from the sunken Italian liner Andrea Doria.

title: Knicks Lose 5th In Row
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30The road continued perilously downhill for the New York Knicks tonight as they suffered their fifth straight defeat, a 11597 setback at the hands of the aggressive and talented Chicago Bulls at Chicago Stadium.

title: KROGH FILES PLEA OF GUILTY IN RAID ON PSYCHIATRIST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Egil Krogh Jr., who headed the special White House investigation unit known as the plumbers, pleaded guilty today to a civil rights violation growing out of the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist in 1971.

title: Brooklyn Woman Raped And Beaten on Her Roof
description: A 34yearold woman, whose husband and three children are living in Jamaica in the British West Indies, was found yesterday raped and beaten unconscious on the roof of 1710 Carroll Street the sixstory building where she lived in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn.

title: Chappaquicldick Expected To Hurt Kennedy in 1976
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (AP)Many leading Democrats think. Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, will not get his party's PresL dential nomination in 1976 because of his Chappaquiddick image, according to a survey by The Christian according Monitor.

title: Mrs. Beame Opens Bazaar at Home for the Aged
description: Mrs. Mary Beame, wife of the Mayorelect, spent yesterday morning chatting with 106yearold woman, shopping for a bargain for her daughter and worrying the chores she faces in her amove to Gracie Mansion.

description: Thank you, international, the telephone operator said. South Africa on the line. Moments later, Bob Foster was talking from the Landdrost Hotel in Johannesburg.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Central Intelligence Agenev has about three dozen American journalists working abroad on its payroll as undercover informants, some of them as fulltime agents.

title: Aussies Lead U.S. In Davis Cup, 20
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 30Fiveset victories by John Newcombe and Rod Laver staked Australia to a 20 lead over the United States tonight in the final round of the Davis Cup.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE MANNINGS. By Fred Mustard Stewart. 648 pages. Arbor House. $8.95.

title: DR. MAX P. COWETT
description: Dr. Max P. Cowett, who retired in 1963 as assistant professor of clinical surgery at the New York University Medical School, died yesterday, apparently of a stroke, at the University Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 424 East 52d Street.

title: FORD LAYING OFF 2,546 AT 13 SITES
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company joined the General Motor Corporation and the Chrysler Corporation today in announcing layoffs because of parts shortages and a slump in bigcar sales induced by the energy crisis.

title: U.S. PLANS TO ADD TO NUCLEAR ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger said today that the Administration would propose development of a new series of strategic weapons as insurance against the possible failure by the United States and the Soviet Union to agree to further limitation of their nuclear arsenals.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPACEDAY The Space for Innovative Development is one of the newer nonprofit cultural centers in town, one that specializes in experimental arts. Its home is a hulking, fivefloor fornier community church center at 344 West 36th Street (9474671) in it are eight studios plus a number of smaller rooms, which are now completed and open to use by the Space's unusual tenants.

title: The Legislative Moral Pledge
description: While the State Senate was approving a bill that puts moral pledge behind the taxexempt securities on the financially strapped Meadowlands sports complex on Thursday, a major bond rating service was reaffirming its conviction that such pledges are not necessarily worth the paper they are written on.

title: Reiner Leaving Dick Van Dyke Show After C.B.S. Cuts LoveMaking Episode
description: An episode of the Dick Van Dyke Show already produced for the current season has been canceled by the Columbia. Broadcasting System because it concerns a child's discovery of her parents in the act of love in their bedroom.

title: New Car Dealers in Test Are Accused of Dishonesty
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30 (UPI)Attorney General Frank J. Kelley accused 27 of 35 new car dealerships in the Detroit area of dishonesty, incompetence or both yesterday.

title: Fisco Omits Dividend
description: Fisco, Inc., announced yesterday that its board of directors had voted to omit the fourthquarter dividend of the Philadelphia  based insurance holding concern. The company paid a dividend of 4 cents a share in the fourth quarter a year ago and 5 cents a share each of the first three guarters of 1973.

title: family food fishions furnishings
description: Silently at first, and now vociferously, a group of Roman Catholic women, named for the 15th Century saint who was burned to death at the stake, are fighting for the equality of women within the church.Catholic home, even if the woman has an I.Q. of 165 and the man has 125, the woman is still submissive to her husband.

title: An Old Mare Is Better Than She Used to Be
description: About five weeks ago, Bill Resseguet Jr. claimed a 7yearold mare named Tiki Minx for Dr. Eugene Grandon for $12,500. Within the last 10 days, Tiki Minx has been to the post three times and has won all three outings, the last in yesterday's second race at Aqueduct. Resseguet conceded after yesterday's triumph, in which Tiki Minx paid $11 for $2, that such frequent competition is relatively rare these days, particularly on the major circuit.

title: Further Clarification
description: Here are pressing questions about the energy crisis and answers supplied by the experts.

title: Kuhn Retains Fine; Finley to Sue Him
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (UPI)Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland A's said today he would take Commissioner Bowie Kuhn to court to fight Kuhn's fines of $7,000 and the probation imposed on Finley as a result of his actions during the World Series.

title: VICTOR F. CAMPBELL
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 30 (AP)Victor F. Campbell, originator of the Howdy Doody Show with Buffalo Bob Smith, died this week, apparently of a heart attack, at Anne Arundel General Hospital. He was 62 years old.

title: Senate Votes Rise In Social Security, Cut in Tax for Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Senate passed legislation tonight increasing Social Security benefits and, for the first time since the start of the program in 1936, casing somewhat the burden of Social Security taxes on lowincome families.

title: Some Painterly Paintings byCalcagno
description: Amid the oddball antics and shrill cries for attention that sometimes characterize the art scene, there are exhibitionsmodest in scale and quiet in their intentionsthat are in danger of being overlooked. The show Permutations: Earth, Sea and Sky, an exhibition of 30 mixedmedia paintings by Lawrence Calcagno, now on view at the New York Cultural Center, 2 Columbus Circle, is an exhibition of this kind.

title: Oilfield Off Zaire Expected To Begin Production in
description: PITTSBURGH Pa., Nov. 30 (AP)An untapped oil field offshore from the Central African Republic of Zaire should begin producing 25,000 barrels a day in mid1975 the Gulf Oil Corporation reports.

title: Israelis Back From War Bring Tales of Pathos and Confusion
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 30On the Egyptian front a day after the Oct. 22 ceasefire, two Israeli freelance photographers armed only with cameras stumbled upon an Egyptian missile base and accidentally took 18 Egyptian soldiers prisoner.

title: RARE MOON GRAZE IS DUE TOMORROW
description: At 5:28 P.M. tomorrow, anyone looking at the sky through a telescope from a particular stretch of land between Fort Dix and Sandy Hook will be able to watch the moon pass in front of a star and see the light of the star twinkle as it appears and disappears past the valleys and behind the mountains of the southern edge of the moon.

title: Student on Guard Duty Catches Two Suspects
description: A 20yearold student from Hampton Bays, L. 1., caught two alleged car thieves yesterday afternoon inside John Jay College of Criminal Justice in midManhattan, where he is studying fulltime to become a Suffolk County policeman.

title: Varick Center Dedicated; Hailed as Place of Peace
description: Harlem's newest place of peace and ray of hope, the $1.6.million James Varick Corn. munity Center of the Mother A.M.E. Zion Church, was dedicated yesterday in the presence of four bishops, a score of civic leaders and more than 600 Harlem residents.

title: Next Step in the Arts
description: Settlement of the long strikes at the New York Philharmonic and the Museum of Modern Art underscores the need for some permanent machinery to help promote constructive management relations in the cultural field.

title: INCUMBENTS SAID TO GET MOST AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Registered political committees showed a pronounced preference for incumbents in their contributions to 1972 Congressional candidates, Common Cause reported today.

title: TOGE FUJIHARA
description: Toge Fujihara, staff photographer of the United Methodist Board of Global Ministries in New York, died Wednesday in ivancouver. British Columbia, where he had been on a special assignment for the United Church of Canada. He was 57 years old and lived in Roslyn Heights, L. I.

title: Bucks Snap Celtic String By 11793
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 30 (AP) Bob Dandridge poured in 15 of his 27 points in the fourth quarter tonight, helping the Milwaukee Bucks to break open a close game and beat the Boston Celtics, 11793, in the National Basketball Association. The Celtics' 12game winning streak was snapped.

title: City Study Scores Failure Of Welfare Job Programs
description: Three major city and state job programs for welfare recipients here were described yesterday as inadequate to help the 174,000 relief clients the city believes are potentially employable.

title: Film: Cape of No Hope
description: A helicopter silently descending, a figure in a long black cape: when an opening shot yields two references to Ingmar Bergman (from "Through a Glass Darkly" and "The Seventh Seal"), you immediately worry about the film maker's powers of invention. In "Stereo," the capeworn by a young man with permanently arched eyebrowsappears to be the central character. The movie will be shown at the Film Forum, 256 West 88th Street, this weekend and next, along with "Dans la Vie" and "Le Bleu Perdu," two beguiling animated shorts from the National Film Board of Canada.The theme of "Stereo" is the inhumanity of science: male and female guinea pigs at a Canadian Academy for Erotic Enquiry suffer through some fragmented experiments in telepathy and omnisexuality. The narration is shared by some academic voices that gargle about "human social cybernetics," the dependency of language on thought, "telepathic bonding," psychochemistry, the space continuum and so forth. The livliest moment occurs when the cape-wearer eats a candy bar. Otherwise, doors that won't open, enigmatic card games, long empty corridors and sex on an examination table make it all quite old fashioned, and the images are as formless as scrambled eggs."Stereo" mainly proves that you can't successfully spoof psychology merely by making it dull.

title: Big StepUp in Soviet Assistance Announced in India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30  A major expansion of Soviet eco nomic assistance to India was announced here today.

title: Questions on Energy
description: Questions and answers designed to clear up confusion about the energy situation are on Page 19.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Raytheon Company received a $73million Army contract for production of improved Hawk missiles and for training and supplies for supporting the weapon at various bases.

title: Campaign Reform Dispute Snarls Status of U.S. Debt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Congressional efforts to finance Presidential elections with public funds rather than large private contributions bogged down tonight in a parliamentary squabble and the threat of a oneman fiibuster in the Senate.

title: Home Town of Papadopoulos Grieves, Others Rejoice
description: ELEOHORION, Greece, Nov. 29For the 250 Greeks in this tiny village in the Peloponnessus it is now a case of the local boy who made bad. And they are not happy about it.

title: Transportation System Uses Jet Engines and Airfoils
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Drawing on his experience in the Air Force, a retired major general proposes a transportation system that does not quite fly but uses jet engines for propulsion and airfoils for lift and braking. Gen. Robert L. Walsh of Washington was granted Patent 3,774,542 this week for his method of moving people at high speed from city to city in light cars suspended from overhead tracks.

title: HOLIDAY TO JAN. 7 URGED ON SCHOOLS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30The State Department of Education strongly recommended today that the schools across the state save fuel by extending the Christmas holiday period until Jan. 7, revoking student parking privileges and strictly limiting the afterhour use of school buildings.

title: Nuptials Held for Ann Curry And Robert William Marcato
description: Miss Ann Curry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis R. Curry of New York, was married here early yesterday evening to Robert William Marcato, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Marcato of Larchmont, N.Y.

title: Eastern Will End Shuttles At Newark and Montreal
description: Eastern Airlines announced yesterday that to achieve fuel savings ordered by the Nixon Administration, it would end its shuttle services connecting Newark with Boston and Washington, effective Jan. 7. In addition, it will drop its shuttle service to Montreal, which operates from La Guardia Airport.

title: U.S. Set to Aid Dutch
description: The United States has told the Netherlands that it is prepared in principle to come to her aid in case the Arab oil embargo causes serious problem. Page 11.

title: Antiques: A Major Shift
description: The recent opening by Bernard Levy of a new antiques business inspired both Mr. Levy and his cousin. Benjamin Ginsburg, to chat about the history of Ginsburg & Levy. Inc., the prestigious antiques concern their fathers founded in 1901. Mr. Levy's departure from the firm Mr. Ginsburg still heads ends their 36year association in the familycontrolled business.

title: Public Broadcasting Forms Minority Programs Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Corporation for Public: Broadcasting announced today the formation of a panel to advise it on objectives and priorilies for minority programing. Dr. Gloria Anderson, a member of the corporation board and chairman of the chemistry department of Morris Brown College in Atlanta, will be chairman.

title: Jersey Welfare Mothers Find Careers
description: NEWARK, Nov. 30  Two years ago, Rosa Thomas was just another statistic on the Essex County welfare roles. She was 23 years old and the sole support for three children. She had only an elementary school education, no steady job! and, with the children to care for, little prospect of finding one.

title: Modern Art Strikers March Back
description: A happy group of professional and administrative staff employes walked together into the Museum of Modern Art yesterday morning, bringing to an end sevenweek strike against the museum. Led by Jean Rabena.w, their union local's chairman, and by Susan Bertram, head of the local's negotiating team, the 110 employes marched into the museum from a meeting place at Fifth Avenue and 53d Street only to be confronted, on reaching their desks, by nearly two months of storedup letters and projects.

title: White House Tree Due
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The White House Christmas tree will he delivered Dec. 10 by the North Carolina Christmas Tree Growers.

title: Citibank Raising Its Prime Rate to 9%
description: The First National City Bank said yesterday that it was raising its base lending rate to 9 per cent from 9 per cent. effective Monday.

title: 3 Dozen American Journalists Are Said to Do Work for C. I. A.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Central Intelligence Agency has about three dozen American journalists working abroad on its payroll as undercover informants, some of them as fulltime agents.

title: Long Before and After Marx
description: PARISOne reason for the highly indigenous character of the Chinese Communist revolution is that China experimented with many facets of what now is called Marxism long before Karl Marx ever lived. Indeed, with its current attacks on the Confucian philosophy, Maoism indicates persistence of old concepts.

title: Chess:
description: Savielly Tartakover, 18871956, derided combinational play in his epigram, Sacrifices only prove that somebody has blundered. However, all his remark proves is that the FrancoPolish grandmaster was more than willing to sacrifice logic for wit.

title: Broadway's in a Party Mood
description: HENRY FONDA, it was reported, once threw a live fish at them. At her height, Tallulah wouldn't play to them. They made noise. They talked. They didn't respond. They obviously resented having to spend $50 or $100 for a pair of tickets to a show they didn't much want to see in the first place. They were pest and a nuisance and just plain uneducated. They were the scourge of Broadwaya theater party audience!

title: BRONSTEIN KEEPS PERSONNEL POST
description: Mayorelect Abraham D Beanie announced yesterday that he was retaining Harry I. Bronstein, one of the city's top experts on Civil Service, as Director of Personnel.

title: SMALL CARS STIR SAFETY CONCERN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1  A dramatic upsurge in the popularity of small cars is generating concern among some automobile safety advocates and posing tough questions on public safety.

The following story examines a recent outpouring of memoirs in which the intimate details of the lives of prominent persons have become public.

description: Profiles in miniature of God and of man

title: Environment: Reformers Are Undismayed by the Energy Crisis
description: The energy crisis has evoked a barrage of demands, ranging from unarguable to implausible, for relaxation of environmental restrictions in the interest of quickly augmenting fuel supplies.

title: Mr. Rockefeller's Last Stand
description: The past is so much with us these days that it is hard to think about the present, let alone about the future, but Governor Rockefeller of New York is doing just that.

title: Dr. John J. Flynn, ExHead Of Kings Medical Society
description: Dr. John J. Flynn, former president of the Kings County Medical Society, died Friday at Victory Memorial Hospital. Dr. Flynn, who lived at 8302 Ridge Boulevard in Brooklyn, was 71 years old.

title: Dangerous Oils
description: In an orgy of heady talk, leaders of the Arab world have now confirmed their intention to use their oncesheathed oil weapon as a means of wideranging political warfare. Their stated policy after the summit meeting near Algiers is to manipulate oil exports according to the attitude of every country toward the Arab cause.

title: More Bang
description: The energy crisis has stimulated the rise of hundreds of small energy consulting services which counsel industries on how to reduce their fuel and power consumption. The biggest of such services is run by a company otherwise engaged in the chemicals business, E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc.

title: Mary Beardmore Is Wed
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 1  Miss Mary Catherine Beardmore was married here this afternoon to Alan E. Silberman, president of Silberman's, a furniture store here. Justice of the Peace Everett P. Sherwood performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's home. Mrs. Silberman, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Stephen A. Beardmore of McKeesport, Pa., is a registered nurse. Her husband's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Robert Silberman, also of Stamford. Mr. Silberman retired as president of Silberman's which was founded in 1890 by his father, the late Philip Silberman.

title: FourChannel Sound Is Here To Stay And Stereo Is Also Alive And Well
description: To the usual (and sometimes bewildering) choices facing the firsttime buyer of sound equipment this year is added a whole new question to consider, that of fourchannel or quadraphonic sound. We at Sam Goody's can help you to decide if quadraphonic sound is something you'd enjoy, both by demonstrating it for you in our stores, and by answering below some of the most commonlyasked questions about this significant development in sound reproduction.

title: Can Opera Survive Its Fans?
description: OPERA is the most addictive of musical pleasures and the people who habitually go to it form one of nature's odder minority groups. Everything they dorailing, praising, even choosing to ignorethey do in extremes.

title: Bobbie Brewster, Editor, Bride Of Douglas S. Scarff, Lawyer
description: BARRINGTON, R. I., Dec. 1Miss Edith Hutchinson Brewster and Douglas Stafford Scarff were married here this afternoon by the Rev. August Kuehl at St. John's Episcopal Church, after which a reception was given at the Rhode Island Country Club, of which the bride's father was president for two terms.

title: The Strange Case Before Judge Sirica
description: WASHINGTONIt started on Halloween Day; it has seemed like Halloween every day since, John J. Sirica sits high on his wooden platform, clad in flowing black, his eyed widening wits; surprise and doubt and disbelief; in the wooden box to his right sits one witness after another, telling tales that could be regarded as goblinlike.

title: Museum Gets a Mastadon
description: PARAMUS  The Hackensack mastadon, a 12,000yearold cousin of the elephant, will make its 20thcentury debut on Wednesday. That is the day when the Bergen Community Museum of Arts and Science opens its new Science Hall to the public.

title: A NATO Nuclear Strategy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The North Atlantic Treaty allies have agreed upon a strategy providing, that any largescale use of nuclear weapons by forces within Europe should be accompanied by strikes by United States forces stationed outside Europe, a report by the staff of the SenatoForeign Relations Committee disclosed today.

title: British Vets Call the Cropping Of Puppy Tails Very Bad Show
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 (Reuters)The hallowed chambers of the Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons echoed with revolutionary fervor this week as that distinguished body finally took a stand on a question dear to the hearts of the British, great lovers of dogs.

title: Juniata Aerials Sink Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. I (AP)  Gary Shope threw touchdown passes of 62 and 45 yards to Pete Lentini today as Juniata advanced to the National Collegiate College Division III national football championships with a 3514 victory over Bridgeport.

title: More Woes for Skiers: No. Snow or a Cold Spell
description: Faced with a season that may prove financially disastrous because of the energy crisis, many ski area operators in the northeast ready have been plagued with another major problem the lack of snow and lack of a sustained cold spell to manufacture it.

title: Papua New Guinea Begins A New Era With SelfRule
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 1Papua New Guinea, a vast and potentially rich Southwest Pacific territory, became selfgoverning today, ending decades of direct rule by Australia in sonic of the wildest and most primitive country in the world.

title: 450Room Luxury Hotel Is Planned in Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. I (AP) Plans were announced today for a 22story, 450room luxury hotel that would rise on the boardwalk alongside the Convention Hotel.

title: Pilot to Marry Gail Versfelt
description: SCARBOROUGH, N.Y., Dec. 1Mr. and Mrs. William H. Versfelt of Scarborough announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Denise Versfelt, to Lieut. Donald Ross Hay, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. H. R. Hay of Van, Tex.

description: How does a nice country like the United States get itself into such a dreadful economic mess?
