description: Gaylord Perry's socalled spitball, his psychological aceinthehole against American League batters, may be doomed by the new rule adopted Monday that allows umpires to call the illegal pitch a ball if in their judgment that's what they think a pitcher is throwing. No proof needed.

title: 50 Youths Arrested
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. 4 (AP) The police arrested 50 youths on the parking lots of Freedom High School in Bethlehem Township near here today and confiscated marijuana and wine, Police Chief John Uditis said. Chief Uditis said that those arrested, ranging in age from 16 to 18 years, included students from Freedom High and Liberty High School here.

title: Simon Sees Decision Soon On Rationing of Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4William E. Simon, the new chief of the Government's energy programs, said today that the Nixon Administration would have to decide by the end this month whether to ration gasoline. Mr. Simon made the statement at a news conference after President Nixon formally announced that he would head the Federal Energy Office.

title: Two Moves Planned in Congress To Bar Surprise Nixon Action
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield, said today that Congressional leaders were planning two moves to guard against any surprise maneuvers by President Nixon during a monthlong Christmas adjournment.

title: Alfred C. Fuller Dies
description: Alfred C. Fuller, founder and retired chairman of the Fuller Brush Company, died yesterday in Hartford Hospital at the age of 88. Page 50.

title: Taming the Budget
description: Congress is slowly trying to master the old and difficult problem of its own responsibility for the nation's budget. A President can act decisively in shaping the multitudinous money requests of the agencies and departments into a reasonably unified and coherent document. But when the budget reaches Capitol Hill, power is divided between the two houses of Congress and within each house between the committees that write the tax laws and those that decide appropriations. Moreover, within the appropriations committees, power is further fragmented among a dozen subcommittees, each of which usually has the lak word in its jurisdiction.

title: Stocks in London Hit Lowest Levels In Over Two Years
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI) Shares on the London Stock Exchange, feeling the effect of the growing energy crisis and industrial disputes, plunged to their lowest levels in more than two and a half years today.

title: Newly Elected Civil Judge Here Is indicted on Bribery Charges
description: A recently elected Civil Court judge here has been indicted on charges of conspiring to fix a murder case while he was a law secretary to a State Supreme Court Justice the office of the special state anticorruption prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, announced yesterday.

title: CON EDISON FACES DISPUTE ON COAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Russell E. Train, the head of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, indicated strongly today that he would not approve the Consolidated Edison Company's burning of coal to generate electricity in New York City because the added air pollution would be too much of a health hazard.

title: LIBERAL IS ELECTED MAYOR OF HOUSTON
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4Fred Hofheinz, a 34yearold liberal lawyer and the son of a former Houston Mayor, narrowly defeated tonight a conservative City Councilman in a non partisan runoff election to succeed Mayor Louie Welch, who held the office for 10 years and is retiring.

title: Vizzini and Aides Admit Guilt In Firemen's Election Day Halt
description: Richard J. Vizzini, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, and three other union officialsas well as the union itself  pleaded guilty, yesterday to contempt of court for leading and participating in the fiveandahalf hour strike by the city's firefighters on Nov. 6.

title: Nixon Counsel Hints Tax Data Release
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 President Nixon's lawyers have indicated their willingness to permit the Congressional Joint Committee on Internal Revenue to examine the President's $570,000 tax deduction for his VicePresidential papers to determine if it is legal and proper.

title: Reid Is First to Announce Campaign for Governor
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Governor yesterday and coupled it with an attack on his onetime friend Governor Rockefeller.

title: Nine Elderly Persons Dead In Fire at a Nursing Home
description: WAYNE, Pa., Dec. 4 (AP)Nine elderly residents of nursing home were killed and 12 others hospitalized today when fire enveloped a nursing Home in this affluent Philadelphia suburb.

title: A Full Peace Pact Is Held Israeli Aim
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4Israel is expected to press, at the outset of the IsraeliArab negotiations scheduled to open in Geneva on Dec. 18, for an Arab commitment to conclude a full and formal peace.

title: SALESTAX GRAFT IS LAID TO 10 HERE
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced the indictment of 10 state examiners yesterday for accepting bribes from businessmen in exchange for underestimating their annual sales taxes.

title: PRICES DROP AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange fell again yesterday for the fourth consecutive session after a spate of afternoon buying failed to overcome early losses. Volume was moderate. Prices in the overthecounter market also continued to decrease in slightly increased trading.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1973

title: F.D.I.C. SETS LOAN TO WESTGATE CORP.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, in an unusual action, has lent about $500,000 to a company formerly headed by C. Arnholt Smith, the San Diego financier.

title: Books of The Times
description: CHILD OF GOD. By Cormac McCarthy. 197 pages. Random House. $5.95. It's interesting to see how a good writer can make us care about a bad character. I mean bad in a moral sense. Talent, seems, can find the humanity behind the inhuman, the pathos that comes from being out of step with the world, the loneliness, like death, that is the wages of sin. In spite of our increasing disillusionment in fiction and in the social sciences with homo sapiens, he is still all that we've got and only the most obdurate misanthrope can resist him when he is presented in the round, when even his imperfections pulse with life and hope.

title: 2 Die on Pike as Car Hits Jacknifed Truck
description: WOODBRIDGE, Dec. 4 (AP)Two persons were killed last night on the New Jersey Turnpike when their automobile hit a truck that was blocking the road after an earlier accident.

title: Advertising: J. W. T. President
description: Edward B. (Ted) Wilson 2d, who has spent his entire agency career at J. Walter Thompson, need not look for a change now. On Jan. 1 he'll become the sixth president of the 109yearold company, the world's largest single agency, which expects to bill more than $800million this year.

title: Alfred C. Fuller, 88, Founder Of Brush Company, Is Dead
description: Alfred C. Fuller, founder and retired chairman of the Fuller Brush Company and one of the foremost promoters of doortodoor salesmanship, died yesterday in Hartford Hospital of myeloma, a bonemarrow disease. He was 88 years old and lived in nearby West Hartford.

title: 5 AFRICAN LEADERS HOLD BROAD TALKS
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon, Dec. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Five African heads of slate met here yesterday to work out agreements on the transit of cattle tod farm produce, fishing rights and the sharing of debts and responsibilities in the area of Lake Chad in Central Africa.

title: MOTHER AND 4 DIE IN BLAST AND FIRE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 4A mother and four of her children were killed today in an earlymorning explosion and fire that destroyed their home.

title: MICHAEL O'SHEA, ACTOR, DIES AT 67
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4  Michael O'Shea, the stage, film and television actor, was found dead in his apartment here today. His death was attributed to a heart attack. He was 67 years old.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: JOB EQUALITY PACT IN STEEL INDUSTRY BEING NEGOTIATED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 Prodded by Government legal action, the major steel companies and the steelworkers union are quietly negotiating a historic nationwide program aimed at ending racial discrimination in employment practices throughout their industry.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Turnpike Authority announced yesterday that it had delayed awarding a contract for construction on the Alfred E. Driscoll Expressway because of the opposition of the Governorelect, Brendan T. Byrne, to the highway.

title: DUTCH SEE ISRAEL IN ILLEGAL STAND
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Netherlands today said for the first time that she felt Israel's occupation of Arab territory was illegal.

title: Judge to Get White House Tape And Papers on Milk Fund Case
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Justice Department officials said today that they would shortly turn over to a Federal judge a key White House tape and other documents related to a possible link between Administration help to the milk industry and campaign contributions by dairymen.

title: Two Stadiums Gain, With a Study Here And Cahill's Signing
description: Plans for rival stadiums advanced yesterday as Governor tockefeller announced that lie had received a favorable report on the feasibility of a sports complex in Sunnnyside, Queens, and Governor Cahill signed legislation placing New Jersey's moral pledge behind the New Jersey complex proposed for the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: The Dance: Pakistani National Ensemble
description: There are three reasons for going to see the National Folk Ensemble of Pakistan, which made its local debut, for a run through Sunday, at the Felt Forum last night.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1973

title: BRITISH TO MEND TIES WITH SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4Britain and the Soviet Union agreed today to put their relations on a more normal, cordial basis after two years of diplomatic coolness, but remained at odds on the issue of a freer flow of people and information between East and West.

title: Loewy Got a Da for Many Consumer Designs but Nye on Vodka
description: PARIS, Dec. 4The Russians have just picked one of the top industrial designers of the United States to work with them in styling, manufacturing and marketing a range of consumer goods for Western buyers..

title: Du Pont Study Cites Waste of Over 8%
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4American industry could have the energy equivalent of more than 1.5 million barrels of oil a daymore than 8 per cent of current national consumption in fuel that is largely being wasted, according to an authoritative advisory organization.

title: HAYMAN SHAMIR, 53, OF ISRAELI AVIATION
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4 (AP)Hayman Shamir, Israeli aviation leader, died Sunday at the age of 53 in his office here.

title: Auto Makers Urge Speed on Standards
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The big three auto makers urged Congress today to decide at this session whether to approve White House or alternative proposals to ease the laws on automobile pollution.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said here yesterday that although he couldn't prove it, he believed that Arthur H. Bremer, the man who shot him two years ago, did not act alone.

title: Car Hits River Barge
description: JOLIET, Ill., Dec. 4 (AP)James E. Rudder's ear collided with a river barge recently. Mr. Rudder, 29 years old of Romeodrove his car through warning gates at a drawbridge over the Des Plaines River, sheriff's deputies reported. They said his car had dropped through the gap left by the open bridge and had fallen to 20 feet onto a barge carrying healing oil.

title: Virizlay Produces A Silky Cello Tone And Quiet Elegance
description: From the very first notes at his Alice Tully Hall recital Monday night, Mihly Virizlay showed that he can produce as radiant a sound as any cellist before the public today. It was the opening Adagio of the HaydnPiatigorsky Divertimento, and the Hungarianborn virtuoso played it with an extraordinary silky tone, along with a quiet elegance that suited the music perfectly.

title: Mine Union Will Demand 6Hour Day in New Pact
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 4 (UPI) The United Mine Workers of America said today that it would seek a sixhour work day in negotiations for a 1974 contract.

title: Cappelletti Wins 39th Reisman Trophy
description: John Cappelletti, the big, fast tailback on Penn State's undefeated team, was named winner of the 39th annualHeisman Trophy yesterday as the outstanding intercollegiate football player in the United States for 1973.

title: Nell Harrison, 93, Actress; Appeared in Native Son
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4Mrs Nell Harrison Powers, who, as Nell Harrison appeared in character roles in many Broadway, radio and television dramas, died today in a nursing home in Newton Square, Pa. She was 93 years old.

title: Conservative Store Lets Its Hair Down
description: Nobody's ever thought of calling Altman's a swinging store. Stolid, conservative, even fuddyduddy are the words that come to mind. Why, when a buyer ordered Rudi Gernreich's topless swimsuits some years ago, his superiors saw that the garments never reached the selling floor. Wrong for the image.

title: Islanders Lose to Blues by 31
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Dec. 4 Stymied by a 20yearold goalie who kicks, shoves and stops pucks with the best of them, the Islanders tonight blew half a dozen close shots and bowed to the St. Louis Blues, 31.

title: Prices of Corporate Bonds Show Drop
description: Corporate bond prices were marked down yesterday and the taxexempt market drifted lower as dealers and investors assessed a large volume or new offerings.

title: Nixon and Rumanian Leader Confer in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4President Nixon welcomed President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania today with full state honors and warm words. The independentminded Communist leader is here for talks on trade and the Middle East.

title: Newark Housing Agency Plans Appeal Of CourtOrdered 80% Slash in Rents
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4  Robert Notte, executive director of the Newark Housing Authority, today assailed Judge Joseph F. Walsh's recent ruling reducing rents by 80 per cent in the Stella Wright public housing project.

title: Love Home, Bruised, Alter Quitting Fuel Post
description: DENVER, Dec. 4  John A. Love, the President's former chief energy adviser, returned home today, describing himself as battered and bruised a little bit by his experiences in Washington.

title: Temperature Hits 66, Equaling 100YearOld Mark
description: It took Mother Nature precisely 100 years to equal the record high temperature she provided on Dec. 4, 1873: 66 degrees measured in New York on that date then and again at 2:30 P.M. yesterday. But because of manmade air pollution, the mild December centennial rated no more than two cheers,

title: Lindsay Denies ProManhattan Myth
description: Mayor Lindsay denied yesterday what he called the myth that Manhattan still gets too much in this city at the expense of the other boroughs.

title: The Angry Truck Driver: We've Got to Show 'em
description: BRIGHTON, Colo., Dec. 4 John Welcher, a truck driver from Bennett, Iowa, slammed his hand down on the table with a bang, so hard that some of the coffee in his mug popped into the air like a geyser.

title: Michael O'Shea, 67, Stage Actor Also in TV Series, Films, Dies
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4  Michael O'Shea, the stage, film and television actor, was found dead in his apartment here today. His death was attributed to a heart attack. He was 67 years old.

title: Smith Bows But Connors Triumphs
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Jimmy Connors won but Stan Smith lost at the start of the Grand Prix Masters tennis tournament today. The eight top finishers in the yearlong Commercial Union Grand Prix were meeting in a roundrobin with $15,000 as the first prize.

title: 6% INTEREST RATE ON U.S. BONDS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The Treasury will shortly announce an increase to 6 per cent from 5 per cent in the interest rate paid on Government savings bonds, authoritative official sources said today.

title: ERVIN PANEL GETS HUGHES PAYMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A lawyer for Howard R. Hughes opened a brown attach case at a Senate Watergate committee interrogation today, pulled out two manila envelopes containing 1,000 hundreddollar bills and slammed them on the table in front of Senator Sam S. Ervin Jr.

title: COPPER FUTURES CONTINUE CLIMB
description: Copper futures climbed once again yesterday, with the December delivery touching its recent record high of $1.07 a pound. The contract closed on the Commodity Exchange at $1.07, up 2 cents since Monday.

title: A.E.C. Head Doubts Energy Independence by 1980 Despite Research Efforts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Dixy Lee Ray, chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission, has told President Nixon that, even with a fiveyear, $10billion search and development program, the United States is unlikely to attain his Project Independence 1980 goal of energy selfsufficiency by 1980.

title: British Magazine Makes Elite Squirm but Not Budge
description: LONDON, Dec. 4If the child is very small and his voice very squeaky, he may protest as much as he likes and the Emperor will remain undisturbed at the top of the tenbestdressed list.

title: Oilers Blank Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)Chris Worthy recorded his first shutout of the World Hockey Association season tonight to pace the Edmonton Oilers to a 20 victory over the Chicago Cougars. Worthy made 27 saves in helping to send the Cougars to their fourth loss in a row.

title: Newly Elected Civil Judge Here Is Indicted on Bribery Charges
description: A recently elected Civil Court judge here has been indicted on charges of conspiring to fix a murder case while he was a law secretary to a State Supreme Court Justice the office of the special state anticorruption prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, announced yesterday.

title: Tams Are Beaten By Conquistadors
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 4 (AP)The San Diego Conquistadors, paced by Chuck Williams's 18 points, beat the Memphis Tams, 112101, in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Alfred C. Fuller Dies
description: Alfred C. Fuller, founder and retired chairman of the Fuller Brush Company, died yesterday in Hartford Hospital at the age of 88. Page 50.

title: RICHARD P. MALKIN
description: WESTON, Conn., Dec. 4Richard P. Malkin, president of Richard Malkin Company, an advertising and marketing consultant concern of Westport, and executive vice president of Curriculum Studios, New York, died today of cancer in Norwalk Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived here.

title: HALDEMAN POWER AFTER HE QUIT JOB IS CITED BY AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A former aide testified today that H. R. Haldeman retained so much authority at the White House following his departure from the Nixon Administration that he was able, six and a half months after his resignation as chief of staff, to supervise the inspection by present White House aides of files that he had left behind.

title: New Energy Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 One day in September, Bill Simon was bantering with reporter about the heatingoil shortage that loomed even before the Yom Kippur war and ensuing Arab oil embargo. I'm going to buy up all the overcoats, the Deputy Secretary of the Treasury quipped. You can't wear but one at a time, the reporter said. You can sell them, cracked Mr. Simon with just a hint of contempt for a man who did not know an overcoat from an investment opportunity.

title: A.M.A. Shelves Move to Define Death
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Dec. 4Officials of the American Medical Association today ruled out an attempt to set a precise professional definition of the word death.

title: Treasury Bills Mixed At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Yields on United States Treasury bills fell for threemonth bills and Tose for sixmonth bills in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Philadelphia Elects Black
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (AP)Arthur W. Thomas was elected president of the Philadelphia Board of Education last night, becoming the first black to hold the post.

title: Texas Cuts Speed Limits
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 9The Texas Highway Commission has approved lowering all speed limits in Texas from 70 to 55 miles an hour for cars and trucks despite threats by two members of the state legislature to take the matter to court.

title: WORRIED BRITONS JAM GAS STATIONS
description: LONDON, Dec. 4A nationwide run on gasoline today caused clogged highways and jammed service stations, forcing dealers to close early to conserve dwindling supplies.

title: SCRABBLE MOVING OUT OF BAY SHORE
Oil Nominations Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  The Interior Department said today it had asked oil and gas companies to nominate tracts in the Gulf of Mexico off South Texas for a lease sale. A spokesman said no decision would be made whether to hold such a sale until the department had studied the possible environmental effect of offshore oil and gas drilling in that area.

title: Shockley Debates Montagu As Innis Angrily Pulls Out
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 4Dr. William B. Shockley, the Nobel Prizewinning physicist whose views on race and intelligence have provoked wide controversy, finally got to debate his ideas today, but only after his intended opponent, Roy Innis, the black activist, withdrew in anger.

title: Kunstler and 3 Others Found in Contempt at Chicago 7 Trial
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4Federal District Court Judge Edward J. Gignoux today found William M. Kunstler, David T. Dellinger, Jerry C. Rubin and Abbie Hoffman guilty of contempt of court resulting from their conduct during the tumultuous Chicago Seven conspiracy trial here four years ago

title: Dr. Ernest Granger, Headed Restorative Dentistry Group
description: Dr. Ernest R. Granger, past president of the American Academy of Restorative Dentistry, died Friday at Polyclinic Hospital after suffering a heart attack at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He was 68 years old and lived in Pelham Manor, N. Y.

title: PERCY PRINCE
description: Percy Prince, who headed foodstuffs purchasing here for the Cunard Line at his retirement in 1952, died Monday in Bergen Pines Hospital, Paramus, N.J. He was 86 years old and lived at 65 Yahara Avenue in Rutherford, N.J.

title: U.S. Attorney in Brooklyn Apparently Leaps to Death
description: Robert A. Morse, United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, plunged to his death from his fifthfloor Brooklyn Heights apartment yesterday afternoon, hours after he had told the chief judge of the district that he intended to resign.

title: Jackson Sees U.S.Soviet Arms Impasse
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Senator Henry M. Jackson today challenged the Nixon Administration's negotiating strategy on limiting nuclear arms, saying the talks with the Soviet Union were at an impasse.

title: Solzhenitsyn and Sakharov Honored by Freedom House
description: Fifteen courageous dissenters in the Soviet Union were chosen here yesterday as winners of the 1973 Freedom Award by the nonprofit private organization known as Freedom House.

title: Santo First to Veto Trade by His Club
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4Baseball's winter trading market started to boom today when the Pittsburgh Pirates sent Nelson Briles to the Kansas City Royals and the Cincinnati Reds got Mery Rettenmund from the Baltimore Orioles for Ross Grimsley.

title: One That Got Away
description: WASHINGTONIt has never been my belief that America's communications media are particularly biased in their reporting of news. To the contrary, it is my judgment that every Administration has been served up honest and balanced positive treatment along with some bad raps. Unfortunately, however, there is a tendency on the part of the media to focus on problems instead of problemsolving and on crises instead of crisisresolution.

title: U.S. Attorney in Brooklyn Apparently Leaps to Death
description: Robert A. Morse, United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, plunged to his death from his fifthfloor Brooklyn Heights apartment yesterday afternoon, hours after he had told the chief judge of the district that he intended to resign.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Delta Air Lines Is Sued
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 4 (AP)A New Hampshire family filed a $2million suit today against Delta Air Lines in connection with last summer's crash of a jetliner at Logan International Airport in Boston. The family of Roger MacArthur of Chester brought the suit in United States District Court. He was killed in the crash. The family charged that the crash was caused by the negligence and willful misconduct of the airline.

title: Detente Limps On
description: Despite October's SovietAmerican Middle East confrontation, dtente survives but, as Secretary of State Kissinger has pointed out, it remains fragile and limited in scope. For those given to euphoria, the SovietAmerican clash of interests during the ArabIsrael war was valuable corrective. But it does not prove, as Senator Jackson and others argue, that the detente has now been exposed as an illusion.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: A Grenade in Jerusalem Injures 18
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4  A grenade was exploded in the crowded main shopping area of Jerusalem's Old City today, injuring 18 persons, the police said.

title: jazz: Carter at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 4For the third time in four years, Benny Carter, one of the great stylesetting alto saxophonists in jazz, as well as a celebrated composer, arranger and bigband leader, has come from his home in Hollywood to teach and perform at Princeton University.

title: Defense Spending: Lower and Lower
description: Many people believe that the military spends a disproportionate share of our national wealth. In addition, they believe that the military continually raises the specter of the threats to our national security just to obtain more money and to perpetuate themselves. This simply is not true.

title: 64,406 Cars Are Recalled By Chrysler for 2 Defects
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation said today that it was recalling 64,406 of its 1973 and 1974 model cars to correct two defects, one involving the braking ability because of an improper part.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 4 (AP)The Daytona 24hour sports car race, scheduled for Feb. 23, has been postponed until later in the year, Bill France, president of Daytona International Speedway, announced today. France emphasized, however, that the remainder of the track's annual February Speed Weeks program is on schedule, including the $236,325 Daytona 500 for stock cars Feb. 17.

title: About New York
description: The study was called ... A Nice Place to Live, and it was put out yesterday by the Twentieth Century Fund. Studies flutter down on New York like leaves from a tree, and except when they are commissioned by an administration to prove its own point of view, they are earnest and sober and full of deep thinking.

title: Records
description: Buffalo Springfield is always held up as a classic example when discussing the pitfalls of the rock'n'roll life. When the Springfield was in full flowerthe group formed in 1966, lasting only a couple of yearsit appeared to be the group, a mixture of divergent strains that made up the music then, somewhat prophetic and forwardlooking.

title: The Angry Truck Driver: We've Got to Show 'em
description: BRIGHTON, Colo. Dec. 4 John Welcher, a truck driver from Bennett, Iowa, slammed his hand down on the table with a bang, so hard that some of the coffee in his mug popped into the air like a geyser.

title: Westchester Legislator Assails Beame Accord
description: State Senator Bernard Gordon, the senior state legislator from Westchester County, expressed strong opposition yesterday to the plan evolved on Monday by Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame of New York City, County Executive Ralph G. Caso of Nassau and County Executiveelect Alfred Del Bello of Westchester to weld the legislators from those three areas into a political bloc in Washington and Albany on common problems.

title: Boris Anisfeldt, 94, Artist, Designed for Ballet Russe
description: STONINGTON, Conn., Dec. 4 Boris Anisfeldt, an artist who had designed costumes and dcor for the Ballet Russe when it was directed by Diaghilev, died today at the New London Convalescent Home, Waterford. He was 94 years old and lived here.

title: Premier in Seoul Vows Reforms To End Mistrust of Government
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 4 Premier Kim Jong Pil promised today that his new Cabinet would carry out administrative reforms to try to dispel mistrust of the Government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A Nov. 15 Times editorial advocated gasoline rationing on grounds of equity and recalled the World War II experience. Unfortunately, the editorial sidestepped the severe problems arising from the changes that have occurred since 1942.

title: JOHN W. KERRIGAN
description: John W. Kerrigan, a wholesale, florist and past president of the New York Flower Club, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at Bellevue Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 280 Collins Avenue, Fleetwood. Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: PALESTINE ISSUE A SNAG FOR TALKS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 4The claim of the Palestinian guerrillas that they are the sole representatives of Palestinians in Israelioccupied territoriesa position now formally accepted by most Arab governments is among the most difficult problems facing a Middle East peace conference.

title: Transit Strike in 2d Day
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 4 (AP)The city and its nearly 200,000 commuters suffered through the second day of a bus and trolley strike today while transit and union officials argued in court over efforts to end the walkout.

title: Reid First to Enter Race for Governor
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Governor yesterday and coupled it with an attack on his onetime friend, Governor Rockefeller.

title: Temperature Hits 66 Equaling 100YearOld Mark
description: It took Mother Nature precisely 100 years to equal the record high temperature she provided on Dec. 4, 1873: 66 degrees measured in New York on that date then and again at 2:30 P.M, yesterday. But because of manmade air pollution, the mild December centennial rated no more than two cheers.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two gunmen held up a branch of the Chemical Bank at 9301 Northern Boulevard, Jackson Heights, Queens, shortly after 2 P.M. yesterday and fled with $10,000. The police said the robbers were middleaged, with beards and mustaches that might have been disguises.... Three armed men wearing ski masks held up a crowded, newly opened Chase Manhattan Bank branch a 4200 Baychester Avenue, in the Wakefield section of the Bronx, shortly after 1 P.M., ordered 30 customers, 15 staff members and a disarmed guard not to move and escaped with $7,700. . . . The police reported that when Winston Davis returned to his home at 725 Autumn Avenue in the East New York section of Brooklyn, he found his wife, Barbara, 29 years old, and their son, Arrin, 2, Iying dead in the bathtub, apparently the victims of an overdose of barbiturates. . . The police arrested four Bronx men acting suspiciously in a gypsy cab that contained a jar with hundreds of dollars in coins, a rifle, a starter's pistol and a machete. An investigation led to Harry Andrews, 33, of 750 Grand Concourse, the Bronx, who said the suspects had invaded his apartment at rifle point and had ransacked it after tying him up.

title: Phillips Pleads Guilty to Illegal Nixon Contribution
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Phillips Petroleum Company and its former board chairman, William W. Keeler, pleaded guilty in United States District Court here today to contributing $100,000 illegally to President Nixon's 1972 campaign.

title: Rabbi Wentworth Matthew, Led Ethiopian Temple Here
description: Wentworth A. Matthew, founder and chief Rabbi of the Beth HaTphila Ethiopian Congregation, One West 123d Street, died monday at Harlem Hospital, following a heart attack he suffered last month. He was 81 years old.

title: ROCKEFELLER GETS A FORD ACCOLADE
description: With Vice Presidentdesignate Gerald R. Ford at his side, praising him as Presidential timber, Governor Rockefeller held the first meeting of his new National Commission on Critical Choices for America yesterday and denied that it was a stepping stone toward tht White House.

title: NATIONAL AIRLINES PLANS SERVICE CUTS
description: National Airlines announced yesterday that it planned to cancel scheduled daily roundtrip service between Miami and London on five dates this month to conserve fuel. In a related action, Pan American World Airways and Eastern Airlines asked the Civil Aeronautics Board to approve an agreement they had reached providing for a 20 per cent reduction by each line in planned schedules linking Miami with San Juan, St. Thomas and St. Croix.

title: Rutgers Loses on A Forfeit
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Dec. 4  Pittsburgh was awarded a game forfeit tonight when some 75 to 100 black Rutgers students, protesting minority programs at the state university, marched onto the basketball court with three minutes left in the first half and staged a sitin demonstration.

title: ROCKEFELLER GETS A FORD ACCOLADE
description: With Vice Presidentdesignate Gerald R. Ford at his side, praising him as Presidential timber, Governor Rockefeller held the first meeting of his new National Commission on Critical Choices for America yesterday and denied that it was, a stepping stone toward tht White House.

title: Truck DriverOwners Block Highways in Five States
description: Hundreds of tractor trailer drivers blocked highways in at least five states yesterday, contending that lower speed limits and higher fuel prices were costing them money.

title: The Money Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The latest battle in the Senate to get some honest rules for financing political campaigns was defeated, but this was only the opening skirmish in a long war, and maybe the vote to delay a decision was not all bad.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Drive Begun in U.N. to Oust Phnom Penh
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 4Algeria, China and 31 other countries opened a drivel in the General Assembly today to expel the Cambodian Government of President Lon Nol and seat instead that of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed leader now living in Peking.

title: A Men's Line Obtains Frazier's ...Well, Aid
description: Clyde took a ride yesterday. He drove his burgundy RollsRoyce across the Manhattan Bridge to Brooklyn, where he eventually wound up in a woodpaneled room with a sign over the door that said: The Clyde Room.

title: CITY IS NOTIFIED OF A 14% GAS CUT
description: Both the state and the city were notified by their gasoline suppliers yesterday that allocations would be cut sharply this month. For the city, which, is supplied by Exxon, it means that government agencies will have to cut back services as of next Monday because of a 14 per cent reduction.

title: Park Is Shown in Need of Repair
description: At the entrance to Central Park: A Beginning for the Second Century, an exhibition that opened yesterday at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is a series of old photographs tracing the construction of park roads and landscaping. They are an apt reminder that the park landscape is in fact an artificial construction. And today, it is a fragile one indeed. The exhibition's intention is frankly polemical  to tell us how serious the physical condition of Central Park is and to publicize the ambitious restoration program that the city is about to embark on under the direction of the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administrator, Richard M. Clurman.

title: ATHENS CONTACTS RENEWED BY U.S.
description: ATHENS, Dec. 4The United States today resumed full diplomatic contacts with Greece's new armybacked Government, which took power in a bloodless coup Nov. 25.

title: Pact Is Reached in Fish Strike; Ample Supply Expected Today
description: A tentative contract agreement was reached yesterday between Fulton Fish Market employers and their workers, who went on strike Monday. As a result, fresh fish is expected to be to be back in ample supply in restaurants and retail market.

title: Xerox Acquires Two Sites In Connecticut for Offices
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec.  The Xerox Corporation, blocked in its plan to build an office campus in the rural back country of Greenwich, announced today that it had acquired instead sites in Stamford and in downtown Greenwich.

title: RADIO LIBERTY MAN REPORTED IN SOVIET
description: Izvestia named the man as Y. M. Marin, and said that he had been working for the last few years at the WestGerman based station that beams programs to the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe, It is largely staffed by migrs from the Communist countries.

title: British Expert Terms 10% Saving Easy
description: When it comes to energy matters, you Americans aren't fat; you're obese, said Harvey Morris, a 36yearold British fuel expert, in describing his feelings about our energy crisis after visiting in the last month a handful of American industrial plants and apartment boiler rooms.

title: Lecture Saturday On Striped Bass
description: The East Coast's Most highly prized lighttackle marine game fish, the striped bass, will be the subject of a lecture series at the College of Mount St. Vincent in the Bronx Saturday. The program opens at 10 A.M. in the Cardinal Hayes Auditorium. It is sponsored by the Striped Bass Fund, a conservation organization, and is open to the public.

title: Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Dead at 82; Was President of Mexico '52'58
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 3 (UPI) Adolfo Ruiz Cortines, President of Mexico from 1952 to 1958, died here Monday of a heart attack at the age of 82.

title: Epic of Buster Friend on Double Bill
description: THE INTERVIEW, Peter Swet; directed by Ted Story; THE EPIC OF BUSTER FRIEND, by Richard Lenz, directed by Michael Kahn; lighting by Maureen Gibson; production stage manager, Donald Walters. The Matinee Series, presented by Lucille Lortel, artistic director. At the Theater de Lys, 121 Christopher Street.

title: Oil Group's Head Sees A Persistent Shortage
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (AP)The American Petroleum Institute's president, Frank N. Ikard, said today that the oil shortage would last as long as most of us will live.

title: North Vietnamese Seize Highlands District Capital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 5North Vietnamese tanks and troops yesterday assaulted and seized a district capital in remote, mountainous Quang Duc Province, once again taking the offensive in a monthold struggle for control of a key road system in the Central Highlands, the Saigon command announced this morning.

title: BIDS RAISE COST OF STADIUM WORK
description: Bids for the reconstruction of Yankee Stadium were opened yesterday and they were $5million above architects' estimates.

title: MISSISSIPPI SCORED ANEW OVER PRISON
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., Dec. 4 (UPI)The Justice Department told a federal court judge today that it had new evidence of beatings of inmates by guards at the Mississippi State Penitentiary.

title: Way Open to Name Stern to U.S. Bench
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4The way has been cleared for the nomination of Herbert J. Stern, United States Attorney for New Jersey, to the United States District Court, the office of Senator Clifford P. Case in Washington reported today. A spokesman said Mr. Case hoped the White House would announce the appointment at a scheduled news briefing tomorrow.

title: Crabiel Is Chosen Secretary of State For Byrne's Cabinet
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4Brendan T. Byrne, the Governorelect, announced today that he had chosen J. Edward Crabiel, the Democratic Senate minority leader from Middlesex County and one of his opponents in the party's gubernatorial primary, as Secretary of State.

title: Who Came to Dinner?
description: In an open letter to Mr. Agnew, published on the OpEd page on Oct. 15, Roy M. Cohn took the former Vice President to task for making a dumb mistake... in quitting and accepting a criminal conviction. Having himself been acquitted after three separate Federal indictments on charges of conspiracy, bribery and fraud, Mr. Cohn evidently considered himself particularly well qualified to suggest That Mr. Agnew's chances for legal and political survival were excellent. To Mr. Cohn, who first gained national visibility as the late Senator Joseph R. McCarthy's chief counsel, it was evident that some people were obviously out to get Mr. Agnew, since the public knows that virtually every political officeseeker gets cash contributions in one form or another.

title: Egyptian Says Kissinger Warned: Peace Is Not Around the Corner
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Secretary of State Kissinger reportedly told a leading Egyptian editor last month that peace in the Middle East was not around the corner and that it might take six months to a year for concrete results from the ArabIsraeli negotiations due to begin in Geneva on Dec. 18.

title: HANAYAGI ARTISTRY IN JAPANESE DANCE
description: Suzushi Hanayagi presented a concert of Japanese classical dance on Monday at Carnegie Recital Hall. Such concerts too often radiate an aura of a Cultural Event, but her program was blessedly undidactic. She drew the audience into the formal tradition of Kabuki, Noh and JiutaMai with serious and totally involved artistry.

title: Defense Loses Bid For a Fact Hearing In Carpi Death Case
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4A judge rejected today a motion for hearing on whether the prosecution had suppressed evidence in the murder case involving Mrs. Laura Carpi, whose head was severed after her death.

title: Florida's Tourist Industry Fears Oil Cut
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 4 The energy crisis is sending shivers up the spines of entrepreneurs of tourism in Florida's sunshine long before the numbing cold of winter settles in up North.

title: Simon Sees Decision Soon On Rationing of Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4William E. Simon, the new chief of the Government's energy programs, said today that the Nixon Administration would have to decide by the end of this month whether to ration gasoline. Mr. Simon made the statement at a news conference after President Nixon formally announced that he would head the Federal Energy Office.

title: The Theater: Creeps
description: The agonized impotence of cripples and their hopes for heroism and survival are the subject matter of a documentary  style play called Creeps, which opened last night at Playhouse 2 on West 48th Street.

title: CURB ON INFLATION IS SOUGHT BY SPAIN
description: MADRID, Dec. 4  The Spanish Government is making its most elaborate effort yet to moderate inflation without halting economic expansion.

title: '74 Social Register Has Few Surprises
description: The 1974 edition of the New York Social Register, that little black and orange volume used by the ins as an auxiliary phone and address book, is off the press and on its way to subscribers.

title: City Council Takes Additional Space To Meet Growth
description: The City Council, increasing in size by six members on Jan. 1 and already too large for City Hall, has decided to take, more than two floors of additional space in a 31story office skyscraper across Broadway from City Hall Park.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An exhibition, Central Park: A Beginning for the Second Century, opened yesterday at the Metropolitan Museum to publicize the city's campaign for the restoration of the park, including restoration of all bridges and arches, a treepreservation program, and restoration of major park areas such as the Mall, the Bethesda Fountain and the Sheep Meadow.

title: SALESTAX GRAFT IS LAID TO 10 HERE
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced the indictment of 10 state examiners yesterday for accepting bribes from businessmen in exchange for underestimating their annual sales taxes.

title: J. P. Stevens Net at Peaks in the Quarter and Year
CREW OF 19 RESCUED FROM SINKING SHIP
description: Coast Guard surface and air units and a French ore carrier joined forces in the Atlantic 150 miles southeast of here yesterday afternoon to rescue the 19man crew of the sinking Cypriot freighter Aegis Duty.

title: Frazier's Surge Helps Knicks Win
description: Walt Frazier of the. Knicks and Geoff Petrie of Portland were one of the backcourt matchups last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: First Private Foundation To Aid the Arts Is Set Up
description: The first private, foundation on a national scale devoted solely to the arts and the humanities is now being incorporated by a group of arts patrons and professionals. To head it, W. McNeil Lowry will leave next June his post as vice president of the Ford Foundation's humanities and arts division, where since 1957 he has dispensed more than $306million.

title: Nader Blames the Oil Industry For Nation's Energy Problems
description: Ralph Nader said here yesterday that the oil industry was to blame for the nation's energy problems and that consumer apathy in general  fostered for years by oil and other industriesmade it likely that even dramatic increases in fuel prices would get by with relatively little outcry.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: CITY IS NOTIFIED OF A 14% GAS CUT
description: Both the state and the city were notified by their gasoline suppliers yesterday that allocations would be cut sharply this month. For the city, which is supplied by Exxon, it means that government agencies will have to cut back services as of next Monday because of a 14 per cent reduction.

title: New Jersey Sport
description: ENGLEWOOD, Dec. 4The day of the tennis gypsy is not over. Although the game is now better organized, there are still players who float round the world seeking to get into tournaments to earn enough money for expenses, with something left over to enjoy the pleasures of whatever city they happen to be in.

title: Supreme Court Asked to Allow Suit Over Kent State Killings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Attorneys for the parents of three of the four students killed by National Guardsmen at Kent State University asked the Supreme Court today to let them sue Ohio officials for damages as a result of the 1970 campus disturbance.

title: People and Business
description: Among the names of those proposed as allied members of the New York Stock Exchange in the Big Board's latest weekly bulletin is that of Lloyd M. Bentsen 3d. And if those reading down the long list of names of proposed allied members happened to stop at this one, the reason probably is that his father, Lloyd M. Bentsen Jr., is the junior Senator from Texas and chairman of the Senate financial market subcommittee.

title: ENERGY SHORTAGE GUTS AUTO SALES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4The energy crisis is cutting deeply into auto industry sales and production.

title: First Private Foundation To Aid the Arts Is Set Up
description: The first private foundation on a national scale devoted solely to the arts and the humanities is now being incorporated by a group of arts patrons and professionals. To head it, W. McNeil Lowry will leave next June his post as vice president of the Ford Foundation's humanities and arts division, where since 1957 he has dispensed more than $306million.

title: Stereotypers in Final Accord With 3 Newspapers Here
description: John Kennedy, president of Stereotypers Local No. 1, announced yesterday that his union had reached a final agreement on a twoyear contract with The Daily News, The New York Post and The New York Times.

title: Paternalism for the Poor
description: That special solicitude the defenders of free choice on Capitol Hill keep showing fur the poor was in evidence last week when the Senate whooped through an antiabortion rider to the bill liberalizing Social Security benefits.

title: Fuel for Disabled Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  The Veterans of Foreign Wars urged President Nixon today to make available extra allowances of gasoline to disabled veterans if a rationing program is instituted. Ray R. Soden, commander of the 1.8 milionmember group, said in a letter to Mr. Nixon that most disabled persons cannot use public transportation to travel to schools to work or for medlcal treatment.

title: The Key Quarterback Draws
description: The collective health and skill of the quarterbacks are key matters in the three crucial games this weekend, two of which are to be televised here. Oakland, protecting a halfgame lead over Kansas City and Denver in the American Conference's Western Division will be host to the Chiefs on Saturday and Channel 4 will show that contest beginning at 4 P.M. On Sunday, there is Cleveland at Cincinnati and Washington at Dallas, the latter to be televised by Channel 2 at 4 P.M.

title: Quebec Is Leader In Bermuda Golf
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 4  The Whitlock Golf Club of Hudson Heights, Quebec, held a onestroke lead over Tiuro Golf Club, Nova Scotia, and York Downs Golf Club, Unionville, Ontario, at the halfway stage of the 21st annual Bermuda Goodwill golf tournament today.

title: DAYLIGHT SAVING ALL YEAR 'ROUND VOTED V SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Senate approved tonight emergency legislation sought by President Nixon to put the nation on yearround daylight saving time for the next two years to help ease the energy shortage.

title: SCRABBLE MOVING OUT OF BAY SHORE
description: BAY SHORE, L. I.For nearly 25 years, Mrs. Eleanore Lutz has awarded 10 points to each letter Z and one point to Ashe is one of hundreds of Scrabble workers here in Bay Shore and millions of players worldwide for whom the game has become a way of life.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: Sonics Trounced By Bulls, 130107
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (UPI)Coach Dick Matta cleared the Chicago. Bulls' bench tonight as the club posted its highest scoring game of the season in a 130.107 decision over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: RICHARD P. MALKIN
description: WESTON, Conn., Dec. 4 Richard P. Malkin, president of Richard Malkin Company, an advertising and marketing consultant concern of Westport, and executive vice president of Curriculum Studios, New York, died today of cancer in Norwalk Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived here.

title: OIL SUPPLIER HERE RAISES PRICE 60%
description: A major wholesale supplier of some heating oil in the New York City area raised the price to retailers yesterday by 11.1 cents a gallon, an employe of the concern said last night.

title: A Full Peace Pact Is Held Israeli Aim
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4Israel is expected to press, at the outset of the IsraeliArab negotiations scheduled to open in Geneva on Dec. 18, for an Arab commitment to conclude a full and formal peace.

title: Cadillac Sets Records Despite Energy Pinch
description: Despite the surging demand for economic small cars stirred by the energy crisis, Cadillac dealers continued their record sales pace in November, breaking their calendaryear sales mark established last year.

title: A.A.A. Urges Motorists To Reduce Use of Cars
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)American Automobile Association has urged motorists to reduce the use of their automobiles voluntarily by at least 25 per cent, to forestall the prospects of gasoline rationing.

title: G. & W. IS TARGET OF INVESTOR SUIT
description: A group of investors filed a $500million suit yesterday against Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., charging that a pending tender offer is part of a conspiracy to destroy the value of Madison Square Garden stock.

title: Supermarket Stocks Low
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (UPI) Thousands of California supermarkets were faced today with dwindling food supplies in a strikelockout that stretched into its second day with no settlement in sight.

title: Cawley Holds Rap Sessions With His Men, and Policewomen Are Topic A
description: Police Officer John Mugan had never spoken face to face with a police commissioner. But there he was in a room with one dozen fellow officers yesterday asking in a booming voice about one of the department's most controversial issues: women on patrol.

title: People and Business
description: Among the names of those proposed as allied members of the New York Stock Exchange in the Big Board's latest weekly bulletin is that of Lloyd M. Bentsen 3d. And if those reading down the long list of names of proposed allied members happened to stop at this one, the reason probably is that his father, Lloyd M. Bentsen Jr., is the junior Senator from Texas and chairman of the Senate financial market subcommittee.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: JUDGE IS SUPPORTEL ON CHARGE TO JUR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4?? Supreme Court upheld today the right of a trial judge to ?? struct a jury that an ?? criminal is presumed to tell ?? truth but that the presumption can be overcome by his ?? havior or other contradicton evidence.

title: T. K. Peters, Photographed San Francisco Earthquake
description: FT. BRAGG, Calif., Dec. (UPI)T. K. Peters, one of the few photographers who filmed the 1906 San Francisco earthquake, died Saturday of a heart attack. He was 89 years old.

title: Bridge: Opponents' One NoTrump Can Be Test of Philosophy
description: Balancing with a distributional hand is always a tricky proposition when the opponents stop in one notrump. The conservative view, probably the right one in rubber bridge or team play, is to leave well alone.

title: The Forecasts: Pessimists Win Public
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The first round of forecasts concerning the economic impact of the energy shortage has drawn an unusual number of participants and disclosed an extraordinary range of predictions. The earliest of these, which tended to be based on the least profound analysis, and to take the most extremely pessimistic positions, seem to have achieved the greatest grip on the public mind. They came from men who hold important positions in Wall Street and other businesses, and they foresaw depression with unemployment rates in excess of 10 per cent.

title: Mare With Pep
description: An old chestnut mare named Tiki Minx completed a rare kind of triple at Aqueduct yesterday by racing to her third victory in a week.

title: PANEL CALLS CITY NICE PLACE TO LIVE
description: A citizens panel headed by former United States Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau put out a suggested series of priorities for Mayorelect Abraham D Beame yesterday under the ?? tee ... A Nice Place to Live.

title: JOB EQUALITY PACT IN STEEL INDUSTRY BEING NEGOTIATED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Prodded by Government legal action, the major steel companies and the steelworkers union are quietly negotiating a his toric nationwide program aimed at ending racial discrimination in employment practices throughout their industry.

title: Saudi, Here, Links Oil to a Pullout
description: Sheik Ahmed Zaki alYamani, the Saudi Arabian Minister of Petroleum Affairs, said here yesterday that the mere bargaining of peace talks between the Arabs and Israelis would not alter the Arabs' oil embargo and production cutbacks that had brought about worldwide energy crisis.

title: Moderate Technical Rally In Stock Market Vanishes
description: A moderate technical rebound yesterday evaporated in the last hour of trading, and stock prices ended lower in heavier trading.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Sonics Trounced By Bulls, 130107
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (UPI)Coach Dick Motta cleared the Chicago Bulls' bench tonight as the club posted its highest scoring game of the season in a 130107 decision over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: WEEKLY IN FRANCE CHARGES BUGGING
description: PARIS, Dec. 4France's most popular satirical newspaper, Le Canard Enchan, charged today that the French Government had sent a team of five men to break into the weekly's new offices last night to install electronic listening devices.

title: Reinstated Cost Analyst Balks At Post Offered by Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) A. Ernest Fitzgerald, who was dismissed in 1970 after disclosing cost overruns of $2billion on the C5 jet transport plane, said today that he did not want the new job the Air Force was offering in place of his old one.

title: DAYLIGHT SAVING ALL YEAR 'ROUND VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Senate approved tonight emergency legislation sought by President Nixon to put the nation on yearround daylight saving time for the next two years to help ease the energy shortage.

title: Romanticism Marks Viardo's Piano Style
description: VLADIMIR VIARDO, piano. At Carnegie Hall.

title: Bucks Down Rockets for 7th in Row
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 4 (AP)  Kareem AbdulJabbar scored 14 of his 32 points in the second quarter tonight, breaking open a tight game and leading the Milwaukee Bucks to a 124109 victory over the Houston Rockets.

title: The Key Quarterback Draws
description: The collective health and skill of the quarterbacks are key matters in the three crucial games this weekend, two of which are to be televised here. Oakland, protecting a halfgame lead over Kansas City and Denver in the American Conference's Western Division will be host to the Chiefs on Saturday and Channel 4 will show that contest beginning at 4 P.M. On Sunday, there is Cleveland at Cincinnati and Washington at Dallas, the latter to be televised by Channel 2 at 4 P.M.

title: Ruling Danish Party Is Defeated in Vote
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Denmark's ruling Social Democrats and the threeparty nonSocialist opposition both suffered heavy defeats in Parliamentary electiohs today and Premier Anker Jorgensen announced he would resign.

title: WAY OPEN TO NAME STERN TO BENCH
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9The way has been cleared for the nomination of Herbert J. Stern, United States Attorney for New Jersey, to the United States. District Court, the office of Senator Clifford P. Case in Washington reported today. A spokesman said Mr. Case hoped the White House would annotince the appointment at a scheduled news briefing tomorrow.

title: Singing Is Excellent In Fiery Furnace, A Britten Parable
description: The Burning Fiery Furnace the 75minute musical retelling of the Biblical story of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednegois the central panel in Benjamin Britten's triptych of church parables, all of which are being staged in repertory this month at St. Stephen's Church on West 69th Street. It is the most immediately attractive of the three works, lighter (even comic) in tone, more theatrically busy, less rigidly stylized and more colorfully scored than its companions.

title: Chile Expels Envoy of Sweden Over Incidents Following Coup
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. (Reuters)The Chilean Government today ordered the Swedish Ambassador, Harald Edelstam, to leave the country, a Government spokesman said here.

title: White House Flew 2 To Capital for Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The White House confirmed today that its Congressional liaison office dispatched an Air Force plane Sunday to Oklahoma, where it picked up two Republican Senators and returned them to Washington, where they voted to uphold a filibuster aimed to kill an amendment to the debt ceiling bill.

title: A Touch of Show Biz Is on the Way for Race Tracks
description: It's not official yet, but horseplayers may soon be betting on thoroughbreds with names like My Fair Lady, Airport; Love Story, Hello Dolly, Huckleberry Finn and Sound of Music. Until now, Jockey Club rules have prohibited the use of copyright names (books, plays, films and songs, etc.) for the thoroughbreds. Some of those rules have been amended, though, and are awaiting final approval by the club membership. The decision be made next month.

title: A Fence That Isn't There
description: PARISIn 1950 Mao Tsetung published an essay saying: All Chinese without exception must lean either to the side of imperialism or to the side of socialism. Sitting on the fence will not do, nor is there a third road.

title: A Christmas Fair to Start Off the Holiday Fun
PRIMITIVES SUFFER CIVILIZED ILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Health problems that civilized man often attribute to civilization can also afflict primitive people living in isolation from modern industrial society, studies begun eight years ago in the Amazon jungles have disclosed.

title: SmallBusiness Administrator Denies Charge That His Agency Is Mismanaged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Thomas S. Kleppe, administrator of the Small Business Administration, rejected today allegations that his agency was riddled with political and criminal corruption and was badly mismanaged.

title: Sold $247Million in European Money for U.S. Currency
description: The Federal Reserve, which began to intervene in the foreign exchange market in July to prop the dollar, disclosed yesterday that its activity tapered off substantially during the threemonths from early August to late October.

title: HALDEMAN POWER AFTER HE QUIT JOB IS CITED BY AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A former aide testified today that H. R. Haldeman retained so much authority at the White House following his departure from the Nixon Administration that he was able, six and a half months after his resignation as chief of staff, to supervise the inspection by present White House aides of files that he had left behind.

title: Guilder Off Sharply Over Fuel Fears Gold price Up
description: PARIS, Dec. 4  Mounting fears of economic disorders stirred by the fuel crisis resulted in a sharp drop for the Dutch guilder today as gold rose by $6 an ounce to $106 in the major bullion centers.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4President Nixon indicated today that he would veto the trade bill if it finally reaches him with provisions aimed at curbing trade with the Soviet Union. The President's position was outlined in letter to Carl Albert, the Speaker of the House, requesting that the House of Representatives proceed with the basic legislation. The existence of the letter was made known last night and its contents were released today.

title: Cappelletti Wins 39th Heisman Trophy
description: John Cappelletti, the big, fast tailback on Penn State's undefeated team, was named winner of the 39th annualHeisman Trophy yesterday as the outstanding intercollegiate football player in the United States for 1973.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RESEARCH (HIC) It was on Dec. 5, 1933, that the country drank a fond farewell to Prohibition; the toastable 21st Amendment came into effect repealing the staid 18th. The 40th anniversary of this singularly happy national moment is memorialized in an exhibition on the second floor of the NewYork Historical Society, 170 Cenral Park West, at 77th Street (8733400).

title: Wilderness Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) Legislation to create IB wilderness areas in 15 states in the East and South was approved unanimously today by the Senate Interior Committee. The areas, covering a total of more than 233,000 acres, would become a part of the National Wilderness Preservation System under standards less restrictive than have been applied in the West.

title: Diane Lady Beatty Wed to J.G.Nutting
description: LONDON, Dec. 4Diane Lady Beatty, widow of Earl Beatty, was married to John Grenfell Nutting in Westminster Abbey today.

title: Cowboys Lift Ban On Signs for Fans
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys announced today that for the first time signs would be allowed to be exhibited in Texas Stadium on a Sunday. This week the Cowboys play an important National Football League Eastern Division game with the Washington Redskins.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Burroughs Corporation said yesterday that the Socit de Banque Suisse, the Swiss Bank Corporation, had ordered six mediumscale B3700 computers, 200 system and communications processors and 1,000 online terminal units. Burroughs said the purchase price was more than $20million.

title: FIDELITY MORTGAGE OMITS ITS DIVIDEND
description: Fidelity Mortgage Investors, a trust for investment in real estate development and construction loans, has omitted its quarterly dividend usually declared at this time, the trust announced yesterday in Jacksonville, Fla. The trust paid total of $2.62 in three quarterly payments so far this year, $2.98 in calendar 1972 and $2.53 in 1971.

title: Judge Ejects 2 Black Militants 4 Times After Court Outbursts
description: In four nearly identical, dramatic confrontations before 150 prospective jurors, two alleged Black Liberation Army members on trial for bank robbery were removed from a Federal courtroom here four times yesterday after they refused to obey a judge's repeated order to keep silent.

title: FULL AID FOR ISRAEL RESTORED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) A $5.8billion foreignaid appropriation bill restoring the full $2.2billion President Nixon requested to replace the arms Israel lost in the Middle East war was approved today by the House Appropriations Committee.

title: 30 School Windows Broken In Explosion in Flatbush
description: An explosion in a schoolyard in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn broke 30 windows in the school last night. No one was injured.

title: F.D.I.C. SETS LOAN TO WEST GATE CORP.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, in an unusual action, has lent about $500,000 to a company formerly headed by C. Arnholt Smith, the San Diego financier.

title: Iona Five Tops Siena
description: Iona outscored Siena, 146, in overtime to register a 10698 victory last night at Mount St. Michael Academy in the Bronx.

title: Frazier's Surge Helps Knicks Win
description: Walt Frazier of the Knicks and Geoff Petrie of Portland were one of the backcourt matchups last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: PIONEER CRUISES BEYOND JUPITER
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 4The Pioneer 10 spacecraft cruised beyond Jupiter tonight, continuing to return scientific data and apparently unharmed by its rough passage through the giant planet's belts of intense radiation.

title: Chairman of Airco Is Urging Rejection Of $18 Curtiss Bid
description: George S. Dillon, chairman of Airco, Inc., is urging shareholders to reject the tender offer made on Monday by the CurtissWright Corporation for about 20 per cent of Airco's stock at $18 a share.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester,. day was:

title: Red Smith
description: The late Don Skene was a gifted sportswriter with a sense of perspective. When he covered the boxing beat, his view encompassed the whole changing scene from Jim Figg to Joe Louis. Things were never like this, would say, when we fought on barges. Unfortunately, Don was unable to attend when the fight mob assembled yesterday in the Playboy Club. There his pleased eye would, have beheld Jerry Quarry and Earnie Shavers, both licensed jungle beasts, posing with two bunnies in gym suits between the velvet ropes of a ring nailed to the parquet floor of the Party Room. For the next week, these predators will punch sparring partners, snort and sweat in that setting in preparation for their tryst in Madison Square Garden Dec. 14. The training exercises will be open only to club members, the working press, and any bunnies not otherwise occupied.

title: President Is Scheduled to Have Physical Exam in MidDecember
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) President Nixon is scheduled to have his physical examination at Bethesda Naval Medical Center around midDecember, the White House physician said today.

title: Aerosol Hearings Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) The Consumer Product Safety Commission said today that it would hold a public hearing early next year on a request to impose tight controls on aerosol sprays. The request was made by a private research group, the Center for Science in the Public Interest.

title: Japan's Exports at Record
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4 (UPI) Japan's certified exports for November reached a monthly high of $3.78billion, up 43.6 per cent from a year ago, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today. M.I.T.I. attributed the sharp rise to price rises resulting from global Inflation, and to big gains in exports of several items.

title: Players Unit May Take N.H.L. To Court Over Option Clause
description: Calling owners complainers because now they only make thousands instead of millions, the head of the National Hockey League Players Association indicated yesterday the league would be taken to court to overthrow its new option clause.

title: Walton Scores 3 Goals
description: ST. PAUL, Dec 4 (AP)Mike Walton scored three goals for the second time this season as he led the Minnesota Fighting Saints to a 92 World Hockey Association victory over the Los Angeles Sharks tonight. The game was delayed 23 minutes as many of the players arrived late because of nearblizzard conditions in the MinneapolisSt. Paul area.

title: Fund Set Up to Aid Dancers on Strike At the City Ballet
description: A small group of supporters of the New York City Ballet has established a Dancers Emergency Fund to help find temporary employment and financial aid for the company's striking dancers.

title: G.O.P. LAWMAKER JOINS DEMOCRATS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 4Assemblyman J. Edward Meyer, Republican of Chappaqua, announced today that he was switching his allegiance to the Democratic party.

title: Bache Securities Insured
description: Securities held for clients of Bache & Co. will be insured for up to $250,000, the company said yesterday. Such insurance applies to fully owned securities left in custody for safekeeping in addition to $50,000 in protection provided by the Securities Investors Protection Corporation. The additional Bache coverage is provided by the Aetna Casualty and Surety Company.

title: The Nature of Energy
description: The notion of national selfsufficiency in energy, which President Nixon has set as a goal for 1980, begs a crucial question for the American future: energy sufficient for what purposes?

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Crabiel Chosen by Byrne To Be Secretary of State
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4Brendan J. Byrne, the Governorelect, announced today that he had chosen J. Edward Crabiel, the Democratic Senate minority leader from Middlesex County and one of his opponents in the party's gubernatorial primary, as Secretary of State.

title: Doctors Say Failure of Breathing Mechanism May Cause Crib Death in Sleeping Infants
description: Crib death, which mysteriously takes the lives of an estimated total of 10,000 seemingly healthy infants in this country each year, may be caused by a failure of the breathing mechanism while the, baby sleeps, according to newly published findings.

title: Players Unit May Take N. H. L. To Court Over Option Clause
description: Calling owners complainers because now they only make thousands instead of millions, the head of the National Hockey League Players Association indicated yesterday the league would be taken to court to overthrow its new option clause.

title: CLOSER ARAB TIES URGED ON ITALIANS
description: ROME, Dec. 4In the last few days, the stateowned oil and gas combine and Italy's large Communist party have come out for a change in foreign policy that would involve a closer relationship with Arab countries.

title: U.S. Orders Fuel Cuts On the Christmas Mail
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Federal Government said today that it had decided to cut back by 1 million gallonsabout 11 per centthe amount of diesel fuel requested by the United States Postal Service to deliver mail during the Christmas season.

title: High Court Holds State Can Override Exchange
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The Supreme Court ruled today that brokerage rules promulgated by the New York Stock Exchange could be overridden by state laws if the rules did not further a national plan to protect the investing public.

title: Fire Claims 3d Victim
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 4 (AP)Mrs. Dorothy Newman, 42 years old, died yesterday of burns received in an explosion and fire at Baker's Fork, raising to three the number of persons who lost their lives in the blaze on Sunday.

title: Santo First to Veto Trade by His Club
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4Baseball's winter trading market started to boom today when the Pittsburgh Pirates sent Nelson Briles to the Kansas City Royals and the Cincinnati Reds got Mery Rettenmund from the Baltimore Orioles for Ross Grimsley.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following Spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 27.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Chicago Faces Push for Police Reform
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5  The Chicago Police Department, plagued in recent months by document instances of police brutality and by numerous indictments of policement on charges of bribery and extortion, is poised for one of its periodic bouts of reform.

title: Buying Time in the Middle East
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill.A longignored idea may soon become the key to solving two major problems facing the United Statesthe Middle East conflict and the immediate energy crisis. The idea is a defense pact between the United States and Israel.

title: Syria Denies P.O.W. Charge
description: GENEVA, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Syria denied today that her soldiers had killed Israeli prisoners of war and said such allegations by Israel were part of a campaign of hatred to cover her own war crimes. In a statement sent to the International Committee of the Red Cross, Syria asked an innediate inquiry into alleged Israeli violations of the Geneva conventions protecting war victims. The Israelis appealed to the committee Nov. 11.

title: U.S. SAID TO SEEK A BID TO KISSINGER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5For two weeks the United States has been trying unsuccessfully to elicit an invitation from the European Economic Community for Secretary of State Kissinger to meet with its Foreign Ministers in Brussels next week, European diplomats said today.

title: Burns Is Hopeful on Nation's Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board told Congress today that the renewed strength of the dollar in the world's foreign exchange markets has served to bolster confidence in our nation's future at a time when we have been beseiged with all sorts of unhappy economic and political news.

title: Defeated Danish Government Resigns
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Premier Anker Jorgensen submitted his Government's resignation today to Queen Margrethe II after the parliamentary elections yesterday in which both the Government and main Opposition parties suffered major setbacks.

title: Corporate Bond List Again Registers Price Drops
description: Prices continued to decline in the corporate bond market yesterday with some older utility issues showing losses of 1 to 2 points so far this week.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An environmental group went into Federal Court in New Haven to block construction of a second section of the new Route 7 in Fairfield County.

title: $475MILLION GAINED BY WHEAT FARMERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) Wheat farmers reaped a windfall of nearly half a billion dollars in Government subsidies last summer because the Agriculture Department underestimated by 60 per cent how much the price of bread grain would go up.

title: Environmentalists Sue to Bar Construction of a Fairfield Highway
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 5An environmental group went into Federal Court here today in an attempt to block construction of a second section of the new Route 7 in Fairfield County.

title: Bridge: ??ntwide Charity Game Will Be Contested on Dec. 14
description: Bridge may well be the only sport or recreation in which 25,000 people take part actively in one event at the same timealthough not at the same place.

title: People and Business
description: The board of directors of the New York Stock Ex change is scheduled to consider at its regular meeting today the membership application of Harold R. Robedee, the son of a Big Board employe, Harold H. (Bud) Robedee.

title: Senate, 4441, Sends $2.3Billion Aid Bill To the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (Reuters)The Senate today narrowly approved a $2.39billion compromise foreign aid bill in the face of a strong attack by a group of conservatives and liberals.

title: Retired Man, 84, Awarded Settlement for Commercial
description: ELIZABETH, Dec. 5 (UPI)An 84yearold retired railroad engineer, who claimed his privacy was invaded by a television commercial, which put his head over the body of a naked lady, accepted a cash settlement today from the filmmaker Allen Funt and dropped the charges.

title: JACOB J. KALTER
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 5Jacob J. Kalter, a former political columnist at The Hudson Dispatch in Union City, died today at his home here. His age was 74.

title: U.S. to Help Drivers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 The Administration, responding to wildcat blockades of the nation's highways by truck drivers, promised today to take immediate action to alleviate the truckers' problems and to give high priority to fuel for trucks in a national energy allocation program.

title: House Approves $33Billion For Two Federal Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) The House passed and sent to the Senate today a $33billion appropriation for health, education, welfare and labor, which President Nixon had promised to veto but which Republicans now say he will accept.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Mattel Reports Gain in Quarter; NineMonth Loss Is $7.6Million
description: Mattel, Inc., the nation's largest toy producer, which had losses in all but one of the last eight quarters, reported yesterday a profit in the third fiscal quarter ended Nov. 3. Net income came to $9,6million, up 19.5 per cent from the similar three months last year.

title: Beame Panel Calls for Overhaul Of Health and Hospital Agencies
description: A 42member task force on health and hospitals appointed by Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame has recommended a complete overhaul of the Health and Hospitals Corporation and the Health Services Administration.

title: JOHN JENNINGS DIES; HISTORICAL NOVELIST
description: John Jennings, historical novelist and travel writer, died Tuesday at his home at Miller Place in Suffolk County, L.I. His age was 66.

title: MRS. F. HAMILTON PECK
