description: ATLANTIC BEACH, LI., Dec. 10Scientists who have been looking into the growing practice of dumping sewage sludge into the ocean found today that some of the sludge had oozed as close as half a mile to the beach here.

title: HOFFMAN BID DENIED IN NARCOTICS CASE
description: A State Supreme Court judge denied yesterday a motion by Abbie Hoffman and two other persons to have cocaineselling charges against them dismissed on the ground that state law had misclassified cocaine as a narcotic.

title: Arabs' Pressure on Japan Grows as 2 Mideast Envoys End Talks in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10Arab diplomatic pressure on Japan built up today as two Arab envoys concluded two days of highlevel talks here and Japan's Deputy Premier took off on an oilseeking mission to Arab capitals.

title: Governor's Decision Due
description: Governor Rockefeller has scheduled a news conference in Albany today at which he is expected to announce his resignation. Page 60.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Commodore Gail Morgan, Navy Aviation Leader, 80
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Dec. 10Commodore Gail Morgan, U.S.N., retired, for many years a ranking aviation officer, died here Saturday. He was 80 years old.

title: Water Council Opening Hearings On a Proposed New Reservoir
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10The state's Water Policy and Supply Council began public hearings here today on a controversial proposal to construct a $20million dam and reservoir north of the Wanaque Reservoir in northern Passaic County.

title: BRITISH SOCCER RESULT
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Mrs. Davis Is Wed To J. B. L. Reeves
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N. J., Dec. 10  Mrs. Edwynna Wilson Davis of New York, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Bird Wilson, was married here Saturday to Jay Bucknell Lippincott Reeves, a widower, of Philadelphia. He is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Samuel K. Reeves of Philadelphia and a greatgrandson of Joshua B. Lippincott, founder of the publishing house.

title: Wrong Place to Fight
description: The cause of effective law enforcement in New York City will suffer if a battle over prerogatives between Mayorelect Beame and Police Commissioner Cawley should result in the Commissioner's ouster.

title: Stocks Continue Gain
description: The stock market extended yesterday the strong rally that began last week. The DowJones industrial average bounded in afternoon tratling to finish at 851,14, a gain of 13.09 points. This brought the total advance in the last three sessions to nearly 63 points. Page 63.

title: King, 18, Wants Subjects Who Are Less Submissive
description: THIMPHU. BhutanThe 18yearold King of Bhutan would he glad to surrender some of his royal powers, but his subjects refuse to let him.

title: Nixon and the Tax Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Disclosure by President Nixon of his tax returns for the last four years has highlighted two quite different questions about the tax laws and the way he has used them.

title: PENSION SUIT FILED AGAINST RAYBESTOS
description: A class action was filed in New Jersey State Court last week by former employes of RaybestosManhattan, Inc., to compel the company to pay pensions that were not vested following the closing of its plant in Passaic in June of 1973.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: ESTIMATE BOARD MAY GET RAISE
description: A bill to grant a $10,00 yearly raise to the eight members of the Board of Estimat?? was introduced in the Cit?? Council yesterday after a three hour session behind close?? doors. Council members predicted passage later this month.

title: Move to Expand School in Queens. Sets Off a Dispute
description: The Board of Education was accused of insensitivity to racial integration needs and de fended as a victim of the worst kind of scapegoating in an argument between two officials at a City Hall hearing yesterday.

title: People and Business
description: Dr. W. Clarke Wescoe, vice chairman of Sterling Drug, Inc., has been named chairman and chief executive officer, effective Feb. 1, 1974. He succeeds Dr. J. Mark Hiebert both are medical doctorswho will retire at the age of 69.

title: Long Foresees a Complete Audit Of Nixon's Income Tax Returns
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Senator Russell B. Long of Louisiana, vice chairman of the Congressional committee that will review President Nixon's tax returns, said today that he believed the committee would want to conduct a complete audit of the returns.

title: NIXON TRADE BILL CLEARS A HURDLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The Nixon Administration's farreaching trade legislation cleared a major hurdle in the House today and appeared headed for easy passage to morrow.

title: LibyanSyrian Talks
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 10 (Reuters)The Libyan leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, and Syria's President, Hafez alAssad, resumed talks here today after an overnight meeting that followed the Syrian leader's sudden arrival from Damascus yesterday.

title: G.O.P. Watergate Woes Typified in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 10If Pennsylvania is still a fair guide to the political balance in the country, the Republican party faces a national Watergate disaster in major elections next year.

title: OilShort Europe Is Facing Hardest Winter Since War
description: LONDON, Dec. 10The most difficult winter since World War II is in prospect for Western Europe, and Britain in particular, as the energy crisis intensifies.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Kissinger Is the Focus of Attention as NATO Ministers Gather
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10A Hungarian journalist asked an American today if Secretary of State Kissinger would hold a news conference while in Brussels. When he was told that it was unlikely, the Hungarian replied: But I came from Budapest only to see Kissinger. Do you think I care about the NATO meeting?

title: Nobel Prizes Awarded; King Olav Jeered
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 10 (UPI)  Ten men cited for exploring new paths of knowledge received 1973 Nobel Prizes today and were honored at a formal tie ceremony for rendering the greatest service to mankind during the preceding year.

title: Flow Princeton Undergrad Took Case to High Court
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 10 nester S. Spatt is one of thousands of students currently seeking admission to law school. However, unlike most of his counterparts, Mr. Spatt aready has taken a case to the United States Supreme Court.

title: ALEX S. ROBERTS
description: Alex S. Roberts, president of Alex S. Roberts Associates, Inc., exporters of phonograph records, died Sunday in Doctors Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 311 East 72d Street.

title: VENEZUELAN RACE IS NECK AND NECK
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 10 Venezuela's two major center parties both claimed victory today as the returns came in slowly from the presidential election yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: The first American to orbit the earth, John H. Glenn Jr. announced yesterday he would try for the third time to win the Democratic nomination for Senator from Ohio. Mr. Glenn will run against Howard Metzenbaum, who defeated him in the 1970 primary, only to be defeated himself by Robert Taft Jr., a Republican, in the general election. The former astronaut also ran in the party primary in 1964 but was sidelined by an injury to his ear. The Ohio Senate seat is the one being vacated by a Republican, William B. Saxbe, who is President Nixon's choice for Attorney General.

title: Dance
description: Repetitive movement and hypnotic sound are natural performance companions. During the weekend the choreographers Laura Dean and Nancy Topf used these elements in different proportions and individual ways. In Miss Dean's case the outcome was a striking success. Her concert at the Loeb Student Center on Saturday evening had grace, purity and simplicity.

title: St. Joy Minerals Plans to Raise Prices
description: The St. Joe Minerals Company, the largest domestic producer of lead and zinc, announced yesterday that it was raising the price of these two commodities.

title: MINE UNION BACKS CONTRACT DEMANDS
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 10 (AP)  The United Mine Workers approved today contract demands that are expected to stir controversy when preliminary talks with the coal industry begin next month.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Many basketballminded New Jerseyans will be keeping a close watch on the exploits of Perth Amboy's Blake Taylor as the schoolboy schedule moves into full swing Friday, barring changes because of the energy crisis.

title: Third Party Helps Trudeau Win Confidence Vote
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 10Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau easily won a vote of confidence in the House of Commons tonight, and the way he did it reflects the Canadian Government's recent moves toward an informal kind of twoparty coalition.

title: CONTROLS ENDED IN AUTO INDUSTRY IN PRICE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Government abolished price and wage controls over the auto industry today in exchange for promises by three manufacturers that they would limit increases on 1974 models.

title: Contract Awards
description: Pacific Western Airlines, Ltd., a western Canadian regional carrier, ordered two Boeing 737200 aircraft from Boeing at a total cost of over $13.5million. They are scheduled for delivery in April and May, 1975.

title: CONFEREES BACK DAYLIGHT SAVING, NOW LIKELY JAN. 6
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Senate and House conferees agreed today on legislation that could put the nation on yearround daylight saving time as early as Jan. 6 to conserve energy.

title: BERNARD L. FLYNN
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 10Bernard L. Flynn, vice president for purchases of the Lever Brothers Company and former chairman of the Soap and Detergent Association, died yesterday at his home, 264 Warwick Avenue. He was 61 years old.

title: SUSPECT ARRESTED IN METER THEFTS
description: An unemployed tool and die maker from Rockland County was arrested in lower Manhattan last night by two plainclothes men who watched him collect coins from a parking meter much the way regular daytime collections are made by the Traffic Department, the police reported.

title: Chicago Alderman, Daley Aide, Goes on Trial for Misconduct
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10The longawaited trial of Alderman Thomas E. Keane, chairman of the City Council Finance Committee, on charges of official misconduct and conflict of interest, opened today in Cook County Circuit Court.

title: Checks to Neediest Replace Yule Gifts
description: A favorite and growing custom of friends of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund is to make contributions to the cause in lieu of Christmas cards or gifts.

title: Market to Open Dec. 24, 31
description: The New York Stock Echange reported in its weekly bulletin yesterday that the Big Board would be open on Dec. 24 and 31. The exchange will he closed on Christmas and New Year's Day.

title: Giants Lose, Clinch Last Place
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10A match between a divisional champion sharpening up for the playoffs and a lastplace team that has won only one game in nearly three months turned out to be just what one would expect: Los Angeles Rains 40, New York Giants 6.

title: FREEING OF ASSETS IS SOUGHT BY VESCO
description: Lawyers for Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive New Jersey financier, moved in the United States Court of Appeals here yesterday for a reversal of an order freezing certain Vesco assets.

title: U.S.FRENCH CLASH OPENS NATO TALKS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10Secretary of State Kissinger and Foreign Minister Michel Jobert. of France clashed openly today over whether improved relations between the United States and the Soviet Union undermined the security of Western Europe.

title: Sewage Sludge Is Nearing L.I.
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, LI., Dec. 10Scientists who have been looking into the growing practice of dumping sewage sludge into the ocean found today that some of the sludge had oozed as close as half a mile to the beach here.

title: VALDEZ RENA HEARD IN 3D PIANO RECITAL
description: Oscar Luis Valdez Mena, a Dominican pianist who graduated from the Juilliard School in 1971, gave his third New York recital on Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Peasants, Pushed by Saigon, Digging Antitank Trenches. North of Capital
description: HOA LOI, South Vietnam, Dec. 7The peasants here are being told that the sinuous oneandahalfmile gash they are digging in the earth is an irrigation canal.

title: ANCIENT NEBULA FOUND RADIATING
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 10Mariner 10, an unmanned spacecraft heading for Mercury, has detected tremendously intense radiations emanating from the gaseous cloud of the Gum Nebula in wave lengths never before observed from earth.

title: SCHOOL IS CLOSED BY RACIAL CLASH
description: White students at James Madison High School in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn, armed with sticks, window poles, pipes, canes and chairs, attacked a group of black students there yesterday morning in a new outbreak of continuing racial tension at the school.

title: Oil Debate in France
description: PARIS, Dec. 10The French Government has been raising some profound questions about the future of the oil businessin effect, suggesting the commodity may be too important economically and too sensitive politically to be left to the businessman. In a calculatedly provocative speech a week ago Premier Pierre Messmer raised a few points that are stirring a lively debate. He said in part: What interests the oilproducing countries is to earn the most possible to carry on their industrialization programs. ... One wonders whether this industrialization effort, which calls for a high degree of cooperation, does not make it necessary to forge agreements between [producer and consumer] nations rather than between the producer nations and the companies.

title: Imprisonment Threatened, Soviet ExBallet Star Says
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10 (Reuters) The Soviet Jewish ballet dancer Valero Panov has said that he has been threatened with imprisonment on charges of living like a parasite.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 11, 1973

title: Dayan Links Syria Talks to P.O.W.'s
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 10Defense. Minister Moshe Dayan said, here today that Israel would not enter peace talks with Syria unless that country first disclosed the fate of Israeli prisoners of war. Israel has reported 102 men missing on the Syrian front, and Damascus has refused to say how many are being held prisoner.

title: TRADING RESUMED IN JAVELIN SHARES
description: MONTREAL, Dec, 10 (Canadian Press)Shares of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., were traded on the Montreal Stock Exchange today for the first time since being suspended Nov. 27.

title: Smith and Connors CoRanked No. 1
description: Can a tennis player be considered the best in the world if he must share the No. 1 ranking in his country?

title: The New St. John's: A Community Catalyst
description: Worshipers wound through the cavernous Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine on a recent Sunday, shaking tambourines, singing plainsong and watching medieval mystery plays.

title: FORD WILL RESUME MAHWAH OPERATION
description: MAHWAH, N. J. Dec. 10 (AP)The 3,400 workers laid off at the Ford Motor Company here last Tuesday will return to work on Dec. 19, according to a Ford spokesthan.

title: POLISH DEAL IS SET BY WESTINGHOUSE
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced here yesterday that it had signed $10million contract with Poland to design and equip an advanced electronics manufacturing plant near Warsaw.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest percentage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Fumes Kills 4 in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (UPI)Gas fumes from a blocked chimney filled an old threestory West Side hotel today, killing four persons and hospitalizing at least eight others. The victims  most of them elderly men  were found in rooms on the second and third floors of the Hartman Hotel on West ??

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Groucho Marx once remarked that he would not care to join a club that would have him for a member. By the same sound reasoning, we should never vote for anybody who wanted to run for President of the United States, nor should we put faith in anybody who enjoyed being a restaurant critic.

title: WALLACE ACCUSED ON POLICE HIRING
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 10The Alabama National Association for the Advancement of Colored People has asked Federal judge to start criminal contempt proceedings against Gov. George C. Wallace on the grounds that the Governor has obstructed a court order directing state officials to hire more Negro policemen.

title: Market Place: Tender Offers Tough Deals?
description: Several small companies have regarded the low prices of their shares in the bear market as offering them a suitable opportunity to go privateor nearly so. Their tenders for stock are not without irony.

title: Stovall Sentenced
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec, 10 (AP)Paul Stovall, a former college and professional basketball player, was sentenced to six months in jail and 2 years probation today on three counts of receiving stolen money orders. Stovall played with the Phoenix Suns last season.

title: Strongest in U. S. Rent Control Is Passed by Newark's Council
description: NEWARK, Dec. 10The City Council tonight adopted a municipal rentcontrol ordinance described by its sponsor as the strongest in the nation. The council's action came after a raucous threehour public hearing during which there were two shoving matches and one city official was forcibly ejected.

title: Alleged Bookmaker Is Shot to Death In a Brooklyn Club
description: A 33yearold Brooklyn man described by the police as bookmaker was killed last night when two men stormed into political club in Brooklyn's Brighton Beach section, stood him against a wall and opened fire, the police reported.

title: On the Road to Tipperary
description: After four days of practically nonstop negotiations at the highest level, Britain, the Republic of Ireland and political leaders of both Catholic and Protestant communities in Northern Ireland have achieved a historic agreement. They will set up a Council of Ireland, the first official entity representing the whole of Ireland since partition of the island 52 years ago.

title: Asbestos Cement Pipe Ban Is Urged by Science Center
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) A science study group urged the Government today to ban further installation of asbestos cement pipe to carry drinking water until researchers can determine whether the asbestos might contribute to stomach cancer.

title: Mathematical Precision Marks Dancing by Childs Company
description: The air was heavy with respect at a soldout concert bye Lucinda Childs and Company at the Whitney Museum of American Art on Friday. This response was appropriate enough in view of the fact that Miss Childs was one of the original Judson Dance Theater avantgarde choreographers and has not performed much recently.

title: U.S SAYS STATE LOST POPULATION
description: The Federal Census Bureau has estimated a population drop for New York State for the first time in census history a decrease of 102,000 people as of last July 1, from a year ago.

title: Frazier Defaults Suit
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 10 (UPI)Joe Frazier, the former heavyweight champion, was ordered today to pay $5,500 in a breach of contract lawsuit. The default judgment was made after Frazier failed to answer a suit filed last year by E. O. Franklin of Memphis. In the suit, Franklin said he entered into a contract with Frazier for the boxer and his singing group, but Frazier failed to finalize plans for the concert.

title: Screen: Albee's A Delicate Balance
8 PALESTINIAN ARABS EXPELLED BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Dec, 10Israel expelled eight Palestinian Arab nationalists into Jordan today. among them the Mayor of El Birah, a West Bank village.

title: Boy Here Got $50,000 in Tips
description: Tips amounting to more than $50,000, including a fortune in old silver, were disclosed yesterday to have been the reward of a supermarket delivery boy who befriended an elderly widow who lived alone on Manhattan's East Side.

title: Rodeo Scene Changing, but Danger Remains Constant
description: The remains of Old Tornado, the greatest bull of them all, are up on Persimmon Hill in the Cowboy Hall of Fame.

title: Nixons Invite Billy Graham
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) The Rev. Billy Graham wil conduct a worship service in the White House East Room Sunday at the invitation of the President and Mrs. Nixon. Mr. Graham presided at the first Nixonsponsored White House church service on Jan. 26, 1969, and has since participated in three others.

title: POUND DECLINES IN AIR OF ANXIETY
description: LONDON, Dec. 10Anxieties over the state of the British economy led to heavy selling of the pound here today in the foreignexchange markets. Sterling traded at its lowest level ever against the United States. dollar.

title: Mrs. Leonetta von Schnitzler Married
description: Mrs. Leonetta Nunes von Schnitzler and Murray Vernon Jr., grandson of the late George E. Ruppert and grandnephew of the late Jacob Ruppert, both of whom served as president of the Jacob Ruppert Brewery, were married here late yesterday afternoon by Justice Owen McGivern of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Gas Station Owners Advised To Avoid Protest Shutdowns
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 10 Leaders of the nation's independent gasoline station owners urged their members today not to stage protest shutdowns, which they describe as illegal actions.

title: Shildrick A. Kendrick, 50, Of College Entrance Tests
description: Shildrick A. Kendrick, chief of research for the College Entrance Examination Board, died of cancer yesterday at his home, 39 Claremont Avenue. He was 50 years old.

title: Reed Sees Okla. Doctor
description: The injuryplagued Willis Reed will be examined today in Oklahoma City by Dr. Donald O'Donoghue, an orthopedic surgeon. The Knicks' captain has a sprain behind his right knee that has failed to respond to treatment. He has missed 14 of the 29 games this season, including the last seven.

title: 3 Detectives Seized as Grafters Through Help of a 4th Detective
description: Three New York detectives were arrested yesterday one charges of taking a $3,000 bribe to go easy on a husband and wife they had apprehended with more than 100 cartons of untaxed cigarettes that had been smuggled into the city.

title: HIGH COURT BARS BLUE CROSS CASE
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 10 (UPI)The Supreme Court refused today to review lowercourt decisions that Blue Cross is exempt from Federal antitrust laws in areas where it operates under state supervision.

title: CONTROLS ENDED IN AUTO INDUSTRY IN PRICE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Government abolished price and wage controls over the auto industry today in exchange for promises by three manufacturers that they would limit increases on 1974 models.

title: Governor Will Announce His Plans in Albany Today
description: Governor Rockefeller is expected to announce his resignation at a news conference this morning in Albany, setting in motion his final run for the Presidency and his succession by Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson after 15 years of silent loyalty and labor.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 58yearold Passaic doctor was charged yesterday by the state police with having dispensed narcotics illegally to an undercover agent. Dr. Phillip Snell pleaded not guilty to the charge before Judge Charles S. Joelson in Superior Court in Paterson and was released in $7,500 bail.

title: Hughes Link to Nixon Brothers Surmised as Goal of Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Documents filed in court today indicate that Senate investigators are considering a theory that the men who broke into the Democratic headquarters in the Watergate complex in June, 1972, were trying to find out what information the Democrats had linking President Nixon's brothers to Howard R. Hughes.

title: Theodore Bolton, 84, Artist And Art Historian, Is Dead
description: Theodore Bolton, art historian, artist and former librarian of the Century Association here, died Friday at his home in Coconut Grove, Fla. His age was 84.

title: Easing Future Shock
description: Governor Rockefeller certainly knew that his launching of a National Commission on Critical Choices for Americascheduled to report its findings late in 1975would be interpreted as the launching of his Presidential campaign for 1976. Nevertheless, the scope and purpose of the commission raise it above the level of a mere political device.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The most diabolical curse to be inflicted on the world of sports in this century was the device known as the point spread. It gave the gambling industry a comeon of matchless appeal and even lured nonbettors into taking plunges into the bottomless pit of false hopes and empty returns. Except for a few shrewd professional appraisers of both prices and probabilities the only ones to get rich from the point spread have been the bookmakers.

title: Jaworski Receives Tapes, Including Two Cox Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Presidential tape recordings and documents, a point of explosive confrontation between the former Watergate special prosecutor; Archibald Cox, and President Nixon, have begun to flow to Mr. Cox's successor, Leon Jaworski.

title: COURT TO REVIEW OBSCENITY CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Supreme Court raised the possibility today that it may liberalize or at least clarify the new restrictions on obscene plays, motion pictures and publications that were handed down last June.

title: New Guardian of Energy
description: The new regional director of the Federal energy program in the metropolitan area is a toughminded native New Yorker who says he will fight to make sure the area gets its fair share of fuel supplies.

title: 300 Aged Are Moved To a Home
description: Some wept like children and some sat tensely quiet as 300 elderly patients were transferred in wheel chairs and stretchers yesterday morning from their quarters in the 53yearold Daughters of Jacob Geriatric Care Center in the Bronx.

title: Police Kill Suspect After He Seizes Gun In Harlem Station
description: A 20yearold suspect in a grand larceny case was shot to death in a police station in Harlem last night in a gunfight that erupted after he seized his arresting officer's service revolver, the police reported. None of the police officers involved were hurt.

title: Financial Ills Denied by Black Muslims
description: Louis Farrakhan, the national representative of Elijah Muhammed, the leader of the Black Muslims, has denied that the organization is in financial trouble and he asserted that the Nation of Islam's temples had not become a repository of crime.

title: Pope Voices Confidence Leaders Will Avert War
description: ROME, Dec. 10Pope Paul VI voiced confidence today that the wisdom of world leaders would stave off new wars.

title: Santo Likes Chicago, Not Cubs
description: Ron Santo, who turned down a trade last week which would have sent him from the Chicago Cubs to the California Angels, said yesterday: I will not put on a Chicago Cub uniform again because of what has happened over the past week.

title: Cordero Appeals FiveDay Suspension; Turcotte, Also Set Down, May Protest
description: Protests abounded at Aqueduct yesterday, and the prospect is that there may be more to come. Angel Cordero Jr. submitted the most notable objection, when he requested reexamination of a fiveday suspension handed to him for a riding violation last week. The sentence starts today.

title: Pravda Kicks About Soccer Quality
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10 (UPI)Soccer players are the latest Soviet sportsmen to come under criticism for poor performance on and off the field. The Communist party newspaper, Pravda, said today better training methods and more intensive searches for players should be instituted.

title: WINE TALK
description: At the Leonard Kreusch booth a short fat man, puffing on a huge cigar, poured wine for the multitudes. At the genuine live vineyard, a woman stubbed out her cigarette in the dirt around the vines. At the expresso bar, someone made off with 150 pounds of coffee.

title: British Oxygen Sets $20 Airco Stock Bid
description: The British Oxygen Company, which has been holding discussions with Airco, Inc., since early last summer on a possible tender offer for Airco's 11,765,233 outstanding shares, made a firm bid yesterday of $20 a share for only threemillion Airco common shares, or 26 per cent of the outstanding stock. George S. Dillion, chairman of Airco, which produces industrial gases and ferroalloys, last last week urged company shareholders to reject an offer made Dec. 3 by the CurtissWright Corporation for about 20 per cent of Airco common stock at SIS a share.In its letter to Airco's stock

title: State Pension Panel Proposes 2 Coalitions for Negotiations
description: ALBANY, Dec. 10 (AP)The State Pension Commission today proposed lumping public employes in the state into two coalitions for pension negotiations, rather than the four suggested by the Legislature and the commission's own consultant.

title: Rail Traffic Is Tied Up as Trailer Falls Off Flatbed Car Near Metuchen
description: METUCHEN, Dec. 10 Commuter and eastbound mainline rail traffic from Chicago to New York was delayed for about half an hour at rush hour this morning when a piggybacked truck trailer fell off a Penn Central freight car and blocked the two eastbound lines.

title: Chess: The Pointless Draw Poses A Problem in Tourney Play
description: In the first international tournament, at the Crystal Palace of the London Exhibition in 1851, the problem of draws was neatly solvedthey didn't count. The competition was run on the knockout system and only victories mattered.

title: Special Relationships
description: Secretary Kissinger's recent attempt to rebut European complaints about lack of consultation during the Mideast war brought a wry rejoinder from Britain's Earl of Cromer, the one NATO Ambassador he had roused out of bed by telephone, at 1:07 A.M., to inform of the controversial American worldwide military alert Oct. 25.

title: Dorothy Shakespear Pound, 87, Widow of Poet, Dies in England
description: LONDON, Dec. 10  Dorothy Shakespear Pound, widow of the American poet Ezra Pound, died Saturday at her home near Cambridge. She was 87 years old.

title: OWNERS TO GET BACK 115 CHILE COMPANIES
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10 (UPI)Chilean military Government authorities have announced that 115 nationalized companies, including 12 controlled by foreign capital; will be returned to their former owners.

title: Lewis Triumphs In Bout at Forum
description: Hedgemon Lewis, the topranked welterweight boxing contender, pressured Johnny Gant with a sharp left hook last night and scored a unanimous 10round decision at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Wheat, soybean and corn futures prices fell yesterday while potato and meat futures prices rose.

title: F. D. A. Is Charged With Undue Delays In Banning Hormone
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A report from a House subcommittee today charged the Food and Drug Administration with undue delays and errors in judgment in its actions against a hormone drug that was used to increase the growth of beef cattle and other food animals.

title: Mandel Asks Opinions On Marital Problems
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 10 (UPI)In a survey of political attitudes of Maryland voters, Gov. Marvin Mandel is asking for opinions on his marital problems and the possible effect on his chances for another term.

title: All Assistance Possible to Matthew Reported Ordered Personally by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The House smallbusiness subcommittee was told today that President Nixon had personally directed top Administration officials to provide all assistance possible to Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, the New York neurosurgeon convicted last month of illegal use of Medicaid funds.

title: Capital Outlays at Ralston
description: The Ralston Purina Company has authorized record capital expenditures of up to $155million during its 1974 fiscal year, according to the company's annual report.

title: FORD NAMES BELIEU AS LEGISLATIVE AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Kenneth E. BeLieu, an official in the Nixon, Johnson and Kennedy Administrations, was named today by Vice President Ford as his consultant on legislative affairs.

title: Full Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Cash in hand amounts to $8.73. (Actually, the goal here being utter and absolute candor, it is more nearly correct to call $7 of this amount cash in wallet one $5 bill, two $1 bills. The balance, $1.73. is cash in pocket, all of this sum being in coin. Large quantities of diverse coins are kept as cash in pocket to satisfy the bus company's insistence upon exact fare (40 cents) for each ride.)

title: JOHN G. NICHOLSON
description: John G. Nicholson, vice president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in charge of the branch at Third Avenue and 53d Street, died yesterday at the Jersey Shore Medical Center in Neptune, N. J. He was 54 years old and lived at 3 Lincoln Garden, Elberon, N. J.

title: Spoltore, G.O.P. Chief, Suffers Heart Attack
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The Republican state chairman, John Spoltore, suffered a heart attack today and was taken to St. Francis Hospital, where he was listed in critical condition.

title: U.S. SAYS STATE LOST POPULATION
description: The Federal Census Bureau has estimated a population drop for New York State for the first time in census history a decrease of 102,000 as of last July 1 from a year ago.

title: EUROPE EXPECTS TO ADD OIL CURBS
description: PARIS, Dec. 10The decision of Arab oil ministers to reduce production by a further 5 per cent in January is expected to lead to new conservation measures and, according to industry estimates, may produce a shortfall in Europe's petroleum supplies by as much as 25 per cent early next year.

title: Governor's Decision Due
description: Governor Rockefeller has scheduled a news conference in Albany today at which he is expected to announce his resignation. Page 60.

title: TV Review
description: If actionadventure has any serious competition for popularity in TV schedules, it probably is in the category of the creepycrawler, the tale dabbling in the supernatural and occult. A good fingernibbling scare apparently has its attractions. Tonight's specimen, considerably better than most, is called The Cat Creature. It has been packaged for the American Broadcasting Company's 90minute Tuesday Movie of the Week, beginning at 8:30.

title: Steel Production Of Nation Lower By 1.8% for Week
description: Steel production last week slipped 1.8 per cent to 2,907,000 net tons from the weekearlier 2,961,000, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The production index fell to 119.2 from 121.4 in the week ended Dec. 1.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Oil Allocation Head Reported Quitting In a Policy Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Eli P. Reich resigned today as head of the Office of Petroleum Allocation, according to an announcement by the Federal energy administrator, William E. Simon, The Associated Press reported.

title: The decline in party affiliation continues unabated.
description: The political stability of the United States is challenged not by the Watergate episodes, which in themselves are aberrational, but by the decline of the two major political parties as the key instruments for moderation in politics and a guarantee of conformity to constitutional government.

title: U.S. Indicts 7 Top Officials Of Norfolk Ship Company
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 10 (AP)  Seven top officials of the Norfolk (Va.) Ship Building and Dry Dock Corporation were indicted today on Federal charges of allegedly bribing Navy; safety inspectors with liquor, home appliances and al variety of other gifts.

title: Knicks' LineUp
description: AT GARDEN, 7:30 P.M.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest percentage gains on the American Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: FUEL PANEL ASKS 2 MORE HOLIDAYS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10  The Governor's Cabinet Energy Committee today recommended that the state declare Dec. 24 and 31 legal holidays, thus closing all banks and government offices, and that retail establishments in the state curtail their hours to conserve fuel.

title: Boy Here Got $50,000 in Tips
description: Tips amounting to more than $50,000, including a fortune in old silver, were disclosed yesterday to have been the reward of a supermarket delivery boy who befriended an elderly widow who lived alone on Manhattan's East Side.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Kissinger and Foreign Minister Michel Jobert of France clashed over whether the improved relations between the United States and Soviet Union undermined the security of Western Europe. At a meeting of Atlantic alliance foreign ministers in Brussels, Mr. Jobert said the agreement reached in Washington last June on the prevention of nuclear war called into question the American nuclear guarantees to Western Europe. [1:1.]

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MOVING MAN Ever since man began to walk and perhaps before, he has had to take things with him as he moved. A most transient animal, one of the few known to live in all climates, he has always been pulling up roots and taking them along with him.

title: Sweden's ExEnvoy to Chile Says 15,000 Died There
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 10 (Reuters)About 15,000 people have been killed since the military coup d'tat in Chile, the Swedish Ambassador who was ousted from there said today.

title: DAVID FERN
description: David Fern, honorary chairman and a director of Supermarkets, General Corporation, of Woodbridge, N.J., which operates a chain of super markets; died here Sunday. He was 75 years old and lived in Millburn, N.J.

title: PRESIDENT SUBMITS SAXBE NOMINATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) President Nixon submitted to the Senate today the nomination of Senator William B. Saxbe, Republican of Ohio, to be Attorney General after signing a measure that will reduce his salary from $60,000 to $35,000 a year.

title: Amex Seat Sale at $40,000
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that a membership had been sold at $40,000, up $5,000 from the previous sale. Seats are now $36,000 bid and offered at $42,000.

title: Better Late Than Never
description: President Nixon has at last made what appears to be a complete disclosure of his financial affairs. Only team of qualified accountants can fully understand all of the financial data that Mr. Nixon has released and determine whether they are complete and accurate. Similarly, experienced tax lawyers have to examine the deductions he has taken and the decisions about tax liability he has made. If the proposed review by the Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation is to be more than an empty political gesture, the committee has to make a thorough audit of these financial records.

title: LOTTIE POHOSTKIN
description: Lottie Pohostkin, who retired two years ago from the promotion department of The New York Times after 20 years with this newspaper, died Saturday in Beth Israel Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived at 140 West 86th Street.

title: Plans Dismasted
description: Plans to build Courageous, a 12Meter yacht for defense of the America's Cup this summer, were abandoned yesterday because of financial considerations. A second new Twelve, Mariner, will be built.

title: Plank Wins Downhill in Ski Upset
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 10 (AP)Herbert Plank of Italy, a 19yearold farmer's son, won the men's downhill ski race today in the First Snow Critierium.

title: Plank Wins Downhill in Ski Upset
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 10 (AP)Herbert Plank of Italy, a 19yearold farmer's sort, won the men's downhill ski race today in the First Snow Critierium.

title: GEORGE BUSHER, LED BRONX REALTY BOARD
description: George D. Busher, former president of the Bronx Real Estate Board, died Saturday at his home, 22 Cassilis Road, Bronxville, N. Y. He was 75 years old.

title: Randolph Chorus Offers Strong Messiah Series
description: Since the performance of Handel's Messiah Sunday afternoon in Carnegie Hall was the third of five that David Randolph is giving around town this Christmas seasonthe last two will be Dec. 23 in Avery Fisher Hallhe must be doing something right. And in fact he is doing a lot right, especially given the context of a broadly popular series of performances.

title: New Government Installed In State in Southern India
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 10Prime Minister Indira Gandhi installed a new administration in the southern state of Andhra Pradesh today after ending period of rule by the central Government.

title: County Executives Ask State Subsidy for Transit
description: The New York State County Executive Association, which numbers 13 of the major counties representing 80 per cent of the state's population outside New York City focused: on mass transit proposals in the association's legislative program for next year at a meeting yesterday in Buffalo.

title: Paris: A Festival to Vitalize a Season
description: PARISOf all the cultural enterprises favored by President Pompidou, the least polemical and, so far, the most successful has been the Festival d'Automne. Although modestly endowed and only in its second year, it can pride itself this season in having sponsored a number of original works. For while in the visual arts the Festival d'Automne functions primarily as a coordinating organism, in the realm of music, dance and drama it commissions new and preferably risky ventures.

title: Harness Driver, Trainer Indicted
description: BURLINGTON, Ky., Dec. 10 (AP)A driver and trainer were indicted today by the Boone County grand jury in connection with the alleged fixing of a harness race on Nov. 9 at Latonia Race Course.

title: AUSTRIA CLOSES TRANSIT CENTER
description: VIENNA, Dec. 10The Austrian Government today closed the transit center near here that handled some 80,000 Jews emigrating from the Soviet Union.

title: Advertising: On Research Costs
description: If the cost of everything else connected with magazine production is going up, why shouldn't syndicated research. Well, don't worry, it will.

title: Senate Votes to Require Fuel Economy for Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Senate passed a sweeping energy conservation bill today that would require automobile manufacturers to give more miles to the gallon by 1978.

title: OpeningRound Pairings Set for N.F.L. Playoffs
description: The four games in the first round of the National Football League's playoffs line up in this probable order:

title: Jersey Democrats Name A Black Assembly Speaker
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10  The overwhelming Democratic majority in the newly elected New Jersey Assembly tonight unanimously chose S. Howard Woodson, a 57yearold black Baptist minister here, to be Assembly Speaker.

title: 38 Food Outlets Here Charged With Violations of Health Code
description: Health Commissioner Joseph A. Cimino yeaterday released the names of 38 food processing establishments where Health Department inspectors have found violations of the Health Code.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Key Policy Post in House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Representative Barber B. Conable Jr., a Rochester, N. Y., Republican who is a strong supporter of President Nixon and an old, close ally of Governor Rockefeller, has emerged as a leading contender for the post of chairman of the House Republican Policy Committee.

title: Marines Pick Woman To Direct 2,000 Men
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif. Dec. 10, AP  The Marines named their first woman unit commander today over a company that includes more than 2.000 men.

title: Egyptians' Objectives
description: CAIRO, Dec. 10Egypt expects Secretary of State Kissinger's visit to the Middle East later this week to give a new impetus to the deadlocked military talks on the CairoSilez road between Egyptian and Israel generals.

title: C.A.B. Said to Withhold Data on Flight Cutbacks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) A consumer group affiliated with Ralph Nader accused the Civil Aeronautics Board today of illegally withholding information on airline flight cutbacks from communities that may lose all or most of their service.

title: Country Music Folk Stunned by 4 Slayings
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 10Around the Grand Ole Opry and down on Music Row, there is a saying that when one country musician gets cut, they all bleed.

title: Kentucky (13) Routed by No. Carolina
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Dec. 10 (AP)Bobby Jones, a senior center, scored 21 points and pulled down 12 rebounds tonight to lead fifthranked North Carolina to a 10484 victory over Kentucky, the third straight loss of the college basketball season for the Wildcats.

title: College Bowl Elevens in a Travel Bind
description: Notre Dame's football team May find it easier to defeat Alabama in the Sugar Bowl on Dec. 31 than to get a ride home from New Orleans after the game. The Irish do not have transportation for the return trip to South Bend, Ind., vet.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Rentcontrol legislation incorporating local options was urged yesterday by Nassau County members of the State Legislature testifying before a state commission investigating rent increases.

title: Letters to the editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LaidOff Workers Due To Return to Ford Jobs
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today that 18,200 hourly workers laid off last week because of parts shortages would return to their assembly line jobs next week.

title: Sonics Accused Of Dump
description: Walter Kennedy, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, said yesterday that the league's security division was invesigating charges that the Seattle SuperSonics purposely lost a game to the Philadelphia 76ers last season.

title: Saigon Troops Said to Push Into CommunistHeld Town
description: GIA NGHIA, South Vietnam, Dec. 10 (AP)  South Vietnamese troops advanced into the Communistheld town of Kien Duc today, but North Vietnamese artillery and troops were massing nearby, military sources said.

title: Jerry Priddy, ExYankee, Convicted in Extortion Plot
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (UPI) Jerry Priddy. former infielder with the New York Yankees, was found guilty today by a Federal jury of attempted extortion for threatening to set of an explosion aboard a luxury cruise ship.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A series of 39 feature films, representing the favorites of 30 of the country's leading critics, will he shown at the American Film Institute's theater in the Kennedy Center from next Monday through Jan, 16. The films vary widely  from Martin Scorese's 1969 work, Who's That Knocking at My Door? to Movie Crazy, with Harold Lloyd, and Back Streets, with Irene Dunne.

title: Action in SeveredHead Case Defended
description: The Health Services Administration, in a report to Mayor Lindsay, that contradicted previous statements by some persons involved in the case, asserted yesterday that the Medical Examiner's office had acted appropriately when it severed the head of an unidentified woman who was believed to have drowned in the East River in 1971.

title: U.S.FRENCH CLASH OPENS NATO TALKS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10Secretary of State Kissinger and Foreign Minister Michel Jobert of France clashed openly today over whether improved relations between the United States and the Soviet Union undermined the security of Western Europe.

title: Houston Stores Find Buyers Uncertain
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6Outside Foley's department store, which is Houston's largest retailer, there is a steady flow of people coming and going on Main Street. Some of them say that even though prices are high and rising they are not planning to cut anyone off their Christmas lists.

title: NIXON MEETS TODAY WITH G.O.P. LEADERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (Reuters)  President Nixon meets with a group of Republican leaders at the White House tomorrow to discuss strategy for the 1974 Congressional election campaign and the impact of the Watergate scandal and his own personal problems on the party's prospects.

title: Bhutan Is Emerging At a Nervous Pace
description: THIMPHU, BhutanBhutan, a landlocked kingdom nestled in the wild forests and steep valleys of the Himalayas, is emerging from seclusion with rapid but nervous steps.

title: 186 VENDERS SUED OVER KICKBACKS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10  They state filed an antitrust suit today against 186 companies and 24 former Hudson County and Jersey City officials, seeking more than $500million in damages as a result of an alleged kickback system that officials say operated between 1957 and 1971.

title: Colombians Win, to Face U.S. at Net
description: CALI, Colombia, Dec. 10 (AP)Colombia qualified today to meet the United States in the 1974 Davis Cup tennis competition by beating Mexico.

title: Judge and Defendants Clash Again as Chesimard Jury Is Chosen
description: With the defendants banished from the courtroom and their lawyers virtually mute in protest, the bankrobbery trial of Joanne D. Chesimard and Fred Hilton got off dead center yesterday in Federal Court.

title: Thompson: WaltonGang Buster?
description: The message in Raleigh is Shoot Down the Walton Gang. Few of the cars in that North Carolina city are without that redandwhite bumper sticker as North Carolina State prepares to meet U.C.L.A. Saturday afternoon in St. Louis. The nationally televised meeting between last season's only two unbeaten teams brings together the top two college players in the nation, Bill Walton and David Thompson. The game will he carried by Channel 7 in New York at 5 P.M.

title: Battle Creek Takes Vigorous Measures To Deal With a Threatening Fuel Crisis
description: BATTLE CREEK, Mich. Dec. 8A sign on the wall of City Manager Aaron Marsh's office proclaims: Do Something Lead, Follow, or Get Out of the Way.

title: NOLAND, TENOR, GIVES PROGRAM OF SONGS
description: James Noland, a tenor who gave a recital Sunday in Carnegie Recital Hall, shares with many others in his voice category at least one damaging characteristic. Regardless of whether he is singing Strauss's Stiindchen or Schubert's, Duparc's Chanson Triste or Handel's Comfort Ye My People, he sounds far more interested in the effect he is making with the song than with the song itself.

title: William Hutchinson Dead; Led Bethlehem Fabricators
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. 10William B. M. Hutchinson, chairman of Bethlehem Fabricators, Inc., maker of gasfired heaters and other metal products, died Saturday in St. Luke's Hospital here. He was 63 years old.

title: FUNDS APPROVED FOR HEALTH CARE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11House and Senate conferees agreed today on a bill to authorize spending of $375Iniilion over a fiveyear period to test the usefulness of health maintenance organizations as system of medical care.

title: For Her, 4 May Not Be a Calendar Year
description: December. Decisions. Already people are inviting me to January events like incinerator inaugurals and concerts by singers of conservative folk songs (songs of free enterprise and individual initiative). But I can accept nothing. I have no appointment calendar yet.

title: Bronx Man Shot to Death; Police See Act of Revenge
description: A street fight in the Bronx last April in which one participant suffered a broken arm culminated Monday night in the fatal shooting of his 29yearold opponent by assailants bent on revenge, the police reported yesterday.

title: MY OPTIONS OPEN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11Ending a 15year reign over state government and politics, Governor Rockefeller announced today that he would resign to pursue a new national role and turn over his authority to Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson next Tuesday.

title: Woodson Aims to Revamp Legislature
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11 S. Howard Woodson Jr., the black legislator elected Speaker of the New Jersey Assembly, said today that he intended to strengthen the role of the Legislature during the incoming Democratic administration of Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne.

title: Town Rejects Federal Grant
description: RIVERGROVE, Ore., Dec. 10 (UPI)Rivergrove, a Portland suburb, turned down its share of the Federal Treasury last night. The City Council voted to send back the $282 check received because, a spokesman said, We felt all the Government red tape involved doesn't justify the small amount of money we would get.

title: Karma of 'Bobby' Lovers Stirs India's Filmgoers
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 10  He's a rich Hindu boy and she's a poor Christian girl. They fall in love, have a quarrel, are reconciled, stroll in fields of marigolds (hundreds of violins play tremulously) and meet stern objections from his father, an arrogant businessman, and her father, a lovable fisherman.The heroine, Dimple Kapadia, doesn't quite die at the end of the movie as Ali McGraw does in "Love Story," but she tries. Dimple and her co-star, baby-faced Rishi Kapoor, attempt to jump off a cliff after a long chase and a short speech on the generation gap. The pair are saved by their fathers. Happy ending.The month-old film, "Bobby", a sort of "Love Story" Indian-style, has emerged as the biggest movie success in years. The critics are surprised and even disgruntled about the film's success but "Bobby" has all the obvious elements: two new stars, musical numbers when the story lags, a touch of socialism, an obvious appeal to younger audiences, some sexy scenes, violence and three-hours of extravagant escapism.Beyond this, the Hindi film is one of the first to be dominated by youthful actors involved in a scenario, albeit lightweight, about adolescents and parents. The accent on youth is relatively new to Indian movies, whose performers are often older than the characters they portray."People wanted to see some new faces, especially a new girl, and Dimple's perfect," said Mohammad Shamim, film critic of The Times of India. "She's young, she's fresh, she's pretty in an Indian way, kind of thick around the waist.""Of course it's a fairy tale," Mr. Shamim told a visitor. "These kind of characters don't really exist in India. Is there a boy anywhere who is so innocent about sex, so completely free of class consciousness, so good? It doesn't happen. It's all a dream.""The film is an enormous success," he said. "It may be the biggest grosser we've had so far in India.""Bobby" is now playing at a half-dozen theaters here, and is opening across the country to extraordinary ballyhoo.Mr. Kapoor, who is 22 years old, is invariably besieged at air ports, train stations and hotels by hundreds of girls wearing new shirts with the name Bobby printed on them. The actor's father, Raj, produced and directed the movie, and members of the Kapoor family themselves are known as the Redgraves of the Indian film world, with Rishi's uncles, Shashi and Shammi, major film performers.Rishi's co-star, whom everyone calls only Dimple, is an ample, slightly awkward teenager who plays the title role, Bobby.One critic wrote, "It is a male name . . . But never mind, our filmmakers were never sticklers for such minor details."The plot leans heavily on surging background music and profound, silent glances between Dimple and Rishi. The story involves a rich youth who falls in love with his ayah's, or nanny's grand-daughter, whose father is a fisherman from Goa.The pace rarely falters. There are ritzy parties in the hero's pseudo-Gothic family apartment, scenes in a garish discotheque, a tearful reconciliation in Kashmir, a masked ball and an elopement on a scooter. There is even a socialist touch: The youth, who has a picture of Nehru and Gandhi on the wall of his fancy bedroom, turn against his capitalist father and marries the fisherman's daughter."The film is a sad reminder that the old moth-eaten formula of dream merchandising still works wonders with the masses," said the critic for Shankar's Weekly of Bombay, said: "Of course any resemblance here and there to "Love Story" and "The Graduate" must be purely accidental! But even such resemblance does not lend substance to the hackneyed rich-boy-meets-poor-girl theme.'

title: Museum Dismantles Model of a Blue Whale, Leaving in Its Wake 62 Years of Memories
description: The 76footlong blue whale that has awed millions of schoolchildren, their parents and teachers at the American Museum of Natural History for 62 years met the workman's hammer and ax yesterday as a fourday dismantling process began.

title: Baltimore Youth Acquitted In Murder of Legislator
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 11 (UPI)The son of a prominent local minister was found not guilty today on charges of murdering James Scott, a member of the Maryland Legislature, who was shot while he was awaiting trial on Federal charges of conspiracy to smuggle heroin.

title: $4Million, 40Store Shopping Centel Being Planned for Downtown Newark
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Plans to build a downtown shopping center herethe first in a decadewere announced today by Irving Feist, president of Feist & Feist, a 70yearold Newark realty concern, and Lester Crown, a Chicago industrialist.

title: Gen. Alexander Gorbatov Dies; Leader in War Alter His Purge
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (AP) Gen. Alexander V. Gorbatov, a victim of Stalin's purges who was restored to army command in World War II, died Friday, the Defense Ministry announced today.

title: Kansas City Woman Gives Nelson Gallery A $1Million Degas
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 11 The Repetition de Ballet, a pastel by Edgar Degas, was one of about two dozen gifts unveiled last night at a celebration of the 40th anniversary of the opening of the William Rockhill Nelson Gallery of Art here.

title: MAX KLAUSNER
description: Max Klausner, founder of the Prime. Yard. Company, a knit goods concern, died Monday in Yonkers Professional Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 555 McLean Avenue, Yonkers.

title: Music: 5 Swiss Pieces
description: There were almost more sponsors than composers Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall when the Gaited States section of the League of ComposersInternational Society for Contemporary Music joined with the Carnegie Hall Corporation and the Swiss Music Library to present the first of this season's Continuing AvantGarde programs.

title: Knicks' Surge Sinks Suns, 105 to 97
description: The Knicks defeated the Phoenix Suns, 10597, last night at Madison Square Garden. It wasn't much of a game after the first quarter.

title: CON EDISON GIVEN ALTERNATE PLAN
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration has proposed alternatives to Consolidated Edison's controversial 2million kilowatt Storm King pumpedstorage generating project.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TEANECK, Dec. 11Despite a lackluster 6.5 wonlost record, it was a historic year for the Rutgers football team.

title: Kent State Shootings Will Go To U.S. Grand Jury in Cleveland
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The case of the 1970 shootings at sent State University will go to a Federal grand jury in Cleveland next week, the Justice Department announced tonight.

title: Silica Will Give Jaworski NixonDean Tapes Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) Chief Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court will turn over to Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, tomorrow the tape recordings of President Nixon's March 21 cancer on the Presidency talks with John W. Dean 3d, former White House counsel.

title: Blood Bank for NassauSuffolk And Greater New York Merge
description: MINEOLA, L.I.. Dec. 11 InterCounty Blood Banks which serves Nassau and Suf folk Counties, announced today that it was merging with the Greater New York Blood Program.

title: Shrine Teams Set
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Two more players were named today to complete the rosters for the Shrine EastWest football game at Candlestick Park on Dec. 29. Darnell Austin a 6foot4inch, 240pound tackle from South Carolina Who can play offense or defense, was added to the East squad, while Mike Basinger, a 62, 271pound defensive tackle from the University of California, Riverside, was named to the West Squad.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: People and Business
description: Toplevel changes were announced yesterday for the executive suites of three major corporationsInternational Paper, Borden and the Bank of New York.

title: 4 Coast Cities Awarded Pro Soccer Franchises
description: The North American Soccer League awarded yesterday franchises to four West Coast cities. The league, which operated with 17 teams in 1968 and only five in 1969, will function with at least 12 teams in 1974.

title: M'KAY TO BE SOLD TO BRITISH FIRM
description: David McKay Co., Inc., the 90yearold New York book publishing house is to be bought for $3.6million by MorganGrampian Ltd., a British magazine publishing concern, it was announced yesterday.

title: 4 Hurt in Electrical Explosion In Con Edison Plant at 14th St.
description: Four workmen were injured, two critically, in what the police described as an electrical explosion last night in the Consolidated Edison Company steamgenerating plant on 14th Street near the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive.

title: CREDITS TO SOVIET BARRED AS HOUSE BACKS TRADE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The House of Representatives cast a resounding vote against the Soviet Union's emigration policies today and then approved and sent to the Senate the most comprehensive foreign trade legislation in at least 40 years.

title: Two Arab Leaders Confer on Geneva Strategy
description: CAIRO, Dec. 11 (Reuters) President Anwar elSadat met here today with his Syrian ally, President Hafez alAssad, to plan diplomatic strategy for the Geneva peace conference, which is to open a week from today.

title: Roger Jellinek Named Chief Quadrangle Editor
description: Roger Jellinek, assistant editor of The New York Times Sunday Book Review, has been named editor in chief of Quadrangle/The New York Times Book Company, a subsidiary of The New York Times Company. The appointment, effective Jan. 1, was announced yesterday by Herbert Nagourney, president of Quadrangle.

title: 13 Million Families Are Held HousingDeprived
description: In what was called the most detailed study ever made of the nation's housing needs, Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology reported yesterday that at least one out of every five American households lived in substandard or overcrowded conditions or was forced to spend an excessive part of its income for rent.

title: FALSEHOOD CHARGED TO '72 NIXON GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The General Accounting Office said today that a Nixon campaign committee had apparently violated the Election Campaign Act by fictitiously reporting the payment of a $5,220 bill.

title: VENEZUELA TALLY PUTS PEREZ AHEAD
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 11Carlos Andres Perez, a Social Democrat, today held substantial and probably winning lead over the Government candidate in Venezuela's presidential election.

title: Youth and Police Trade Shots in 100 M.P.H. Chase
description: A 16yearold youth driving a stolen Lincoln Continental led the police on a hectic, hourlong chase through side streets and highways in three boroughs last night, the police reported.

title: Tax Ruling Scores White House Role
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A Federal judge ordered the Internal Revenue Service today to grant taxexempt status to a public interest research group, on the ground that the refusal of the White House to give the judge some documents in the case constituted an admission that the White House had exercised improper pressure the I.R.S.

title: Basketball Scoring AMERICAN ASSOCIATION.
Vesco Extradition Is Dropped by U.S.; Inquiry in Argentina
description: United States Attorney Paul J. Curran said yesterday that his office would not make a second attempt to extradite the New Jersey financier Robert L. Vesco from the Bahamas, United Press International reported.

title: LargeScale Buckpassing
description: Politics and postponements seem the ritual game of the Board of Estimate this month. Lindsaysponsored programs are being deliberately held up in the transfer of power to a new administration.

title: Broad Soviet Drive On To Automate Economy
description: A massive campaign is under way in the Soviet Union to modernize economic management, automate the planning system and upgrade industry to stimulate lagging technological growth and keep up with tne West.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Two Students Hurt in Blast
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. 11 (AP)Two graduate students were injured, one seriously, when a laboratory experiment exploded today at Worcester Polytechnic Institute. James Guerrera, 27 years old, of Waterbury, Conn., was listed in very poor condition at Worcester City Hospital with crushed hands and facial burns, ChienScho Lo, 30, of Taiwan, was treated for minor cuts and released.

title: GovernorElect and the Machine
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11 When Brendan T. Byrne was running for Governor he was fond of telling the voters that the one thing New Jersey did not need was another politician, given the state's reputation for political corruption. And despite the fact that he owed his Democratic nomination primarily to the Hudson County Democratic organization, the quintessential political machine in the state, the men closest to him yearned for party reform and saw a promise of political independence in Mr. Byrne, a glimmer, of a fresh start.

title: ExConvict's Son Arraigned on Check
description: The 44yearold son of Abraham Chait, a trucking and rackets figure well known a generation ago in the garment district, was arraigned yesterday in Criminal Court on a charge of grand larcency in connection with an illicit check.

title: Woman Faces Slaying Trial
description: MIAMI, Dec. II (AP)Mary Axelson Cropper, a New York nightclub performer, has been ordered to stand trial in the beating death of her mother, Mary McDougal Axelson. She was bound over for trial on a seconddegree murder charge, and released from Jail on a $10,000 bond after waiving her ??

title: Predecessor Is Recalled On How to Ship Giraffe
description: Governor Rockefeller added a small footnote to history during his Albany news conference yesterday when he told how President Theodore Roosevelt, a biggame hunter and explorer, had managed to get giraffes he brought back to the United States through railroad tunnels.

title: Frankenstein: Alternative To Old HoHoHo Routine
description: Dr. Frankenstein's Monster was down in the Ethical Culture Society's basement at 2 West 64th Street the other day. Macy's Santa Claus was up on the ninth floor at Herald Square, just 30 blocks away.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal investigation into the multiple collisions last Oct. 23 and 24 on the New Jersey Turnpike opened in East Brunswick. The accidents left 9 dead and 37 injured.

title: NATO Examines Its Weaknesses
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11The ArabIsraeli war has brought to the members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization a clearer sense of their differences and of their need to bolster their 24yearold alliance.

title: Calendar Is Heavy for Bond Offerings
description: A heavy oneday calendar of new corporate, taxexempt and Federal agency issues moved well in the bond markets.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved today a fiveyear phaseout of Government insurance of private business investment against political risks abroad.

title: Dresser Lists Record Earnings
Arab Unity Shows Signs of Fragility as Talks Near
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 11The relative unity with which the Arabs waged war against Israel in October is showing signs of fragility as the opening of a Middle East peace conference draws near.

title: Governor Sixth to Resign
description: Five Governors of New York State have resigned in the past, each to assume a high Federal office.

title: Nixon Is Urged to Reveal Extent of Energy Crisis
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 11 (UPI) Wilson S. Johnson, president of the National Federation of Independent Business, said today that the Administration should reveal the extent of the energy crisis before fear of the dark causes a recession.

title: Officials on L.I. Ask For Study of Peril Caused by Sludge
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 11The disclosure that sewage sludge was nearing Nassau County's South Shore beaches and could pose a health hazard drew sharp comments today from the County Executive and a State Assemblyman.

title: A Dim Las Vegas Wonders What Its Odds Are in the Fuel Crisis
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 7  The MGM Grand Hotel stood out like Polaris. Electricians tossed every switch they could muster in the still incompleted newest hotel on the Strip to bath its 26 stories in a golden glow. Searchlights swept the sky.

title: Football Transactions
description: NATIONAL CONFERENCE

title: Weicker Questions Nixon Tax Deduction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. released today a detailed argument questioning whether President Nixon was legally entitled to deduct from his income taxes the value of his VicePresidential papers.

title: To Repeal Dishonor
description: The Senate tomorrow will have what may be its last chance to help remove a heavy cross that the United States has had to bear for the last two years in the United Nations and throughout the Third World. At stake will be the fate of a bill to repeal the Byrd amendment, whose practical effect has been to make this country an international lawbreaker through breaching the sanctions invoked against Rhodesia by the United Nations Security Council.

title: California Ends Its 4Year Ban Against Offshore Drilling for Oil
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11  The California State Lands Commission lifted today a fouryear ban on oil and gas drilling in offshore fields leased from the state.

title: Morgan Library Obtains 1,500Piece Art Treasure
description: The country's largest and finest collection of Italian drawings in private hands, owned by the cellist and art patron Janos Scholz, will be acquired by the Pierpont Morgan Library, Mr. Scholz announced last evening.

title: Urbanized Growth Urged In the MidHudson Region
description: NEW PALTZ. N. Y., Dec. 11  Two regional planning groups ended a threeyear study of the midHudson region today with a strong recommendation that growth now be directed toward the cities rather than the open countryside.

title: Falling Elevator Weights Kill East Side Worker and Hurt 6
description: One worker was killed and six were injured yesterday when two heavy counterweights plunged from the 31st floor of a 42story building under construction on Third Avenue at 91st Street.

title: Richardson Warns on Abuse of Power
description: Former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson said last night that the Watergate investigations had revealed an ugly glimpse of the abuse of power, and he called for legislation prohibiting dirty tricks and dirty money in political campaigns and for a requirement that every employe of the executive branch keep a record of contacts with outside individuals.

title: Shot Firedat Home Of Pele, Soccer Star
description: SANTOS, Brazil, Dec. 12 (UPI)A shot was fired last weekend into the home of Pele, the soccer star, police said today. The bullet smashed into the trophy room, causing little damage.

title: LAIDLAW TAKEOVER OF MIDDENDORF SET
description: Middendorf, Colgate & Co. and LaidlawGoggeshall, Inc., two member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, said they had agreed in principle to merge.

title: New Hungarian Quartet Plays With Much OldWorld Charm
description: The New Hungarian Quartet is as new as its name implies, having been formed only last year as a resident group at Oberlin College. Its traditions date well back into the past, however, for the violist of the present foursome, Denes Koromzay, was a founder of the old Hungarian Quarafter which recently disbanded after 38 years of activity.

title: Stein Asks Outlay to Spur Jobs in Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Herbert G. Stein, chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers, said today the first step required to combat the additional unemployment that will be caused by the fuel shortage should be to increase Government spending in areas where it ought to be increased anyway. The first item on his list of desired increases was defense spending.

title: COALITION FIGHTS SCHOOL TRANSFER
description: NORTH BRUNSWICK TOWNSHIP, Dec. 11For the firsttime in a protracted dispute involving this community and neighboring New Brunswick, black and white parent and neighborhood groups sent their leaders to a coalition conference here last night to demand that regionalization of their school systems be dropped.

title: People in Sports: Reggie Smith Is Drooling
description: Reggie Smith, who accused Boston, among other things, of being a racist town, said yesterday he was through knocking baseball in Boston but had the feeling of getting into the big leagues in his new surroundings  St. Louis.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Kenny Trial Judge Questions Suit

title: About New York
description: It was an ordinary afternoon, and the police tow truck was prowling. On West 47th Street there was a car next to a meter, and the meter had run out of time. The tow truck stopped, two policemen got out, and in unison they began to hitch a tow bar to the car.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Partly sunny skies and cold temperatures will continue across most of the Northeast today; snow flurries may develop in northern New England and the lower lake region. Warmer weather is forecast for the Middle and South Atlantic States, Ohio Valley, lake region, Mississippi Valley and central and eastern Gulf States. It will be colder in New England and northwestern portions of the Plains States. Snow showers are expected from the upper lake region and upper Mississippi Valley to the northern and central Rockies; rain will cover the Pacific Northwest.

title: Basketball Scoring AMERICAN ASSOCIATION
GAY RAIDERS INVADE CRONKITE NEWS SHOW
description: C.B.S. Evening News was disrupted briefly last night when a demonstrator from an organization called The Gay Raiders ran in front of the camera and held up a yellow sign saying Gays Protest CBS Prejudice.

title: Republican Handicappers Now Rate Rockefeller Highly on Presidential Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 11 Republican handicappers here and around the country were saying today that Nelson Rockefeller has finally learned some of the basic rules of Presidential politics.

title: Rosewall Will Play In W.T.T.
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 11 (AP) Ken Rosewall has signed a oneyear contract to become playercoach of the Pittsburgh Triangles of the World Team Tennis league, the team said today.

title: Tobacco Products Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The nation's cigarette manufacturers turned out $3.7hillion worth of tobacco products last year, the Census Bureau said today. This is a 23 per cent increase from 1967, the last time census takers surveyed the industry.

title: CHICAGO OFFICIAL WINS ACQUITTAL
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11Alderman Thomas E. Keane, chairman of the City Council Finance Committee and one of the most powerful men in the Cook County Democratic organization, was acquitted today of charges of conspiracy, conflict of interest and official misconduct.

title: Why Do They Do It?
description: One of the enduring mysteries of human behavior is why intelligent men get addicted to running for the Presidency of the United States and cannot kick the habit even after years of disappointment and torment.

title: Beame to See Wilson On Saving 35c Fare
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that he planned to meet tomorrow with Governor Rockefeller and Governortobe Malcolm Wilson to further our efforts to save the 35cent fare.

title: Europeans Seek Alternatives to Arab Oil After 1983
description: PARIS, Dec. 11  Though Europe apparently cannot shake itself free of dependence on Arab oil for at least the next decade, a hard look is being given at possible alternatives that might ease that dependence later in the century.

title: Hockey Scoring
Acute Danger of New War Is Seen by Jordanian King
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 11 (AP)King Hussein said today that there was acute danger. of renewed fighting in the Middle Fast. He also said, in an interview, that there was great anxiety to see rapid progress toward achieving a lasting, honorable and iust solution to the ArabIsraeli conflict.

title: Dodd of Essex Is Elected President of State Senate
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11The Democratic leadership of the new State Legislature was completed here this evening when the party's overwhelming majority in the Senate chose Frank J. Dodd of Essex County to be President and Matthew J. Feldman of Bergen County as majority leader.

title: Tool Maker Pleads Guilty In Parking Meter Looting
description: An unemployed tool and dye maker who was caught looting a parking meter at Elizabeth and Broome Streets Monday night pleaded guilty to petty larceny yesterday in Criminal Court. He will be sentenced Jan. 28 and could receive a year in jail.

title: Cordero Loses Appeal on Suspension; Turcotte Accepts Ban Without Protest
description: The appeal made by Angel Cordero Jr. against a fiveday suspension handed him by the stewards at Aqueduct was denied by the New York State Racing and Wagering Board yesterday. At the same time Ron Turcotte, who had expressed an intention of appealing a suspension handed him in an unrelated case, decided to accept the exile. Each suspension is for five days. Cordero's began yesterday and Turcotte's starts today.

title: The O.J. Record Train Stops Here Sunday
description: Don't envy the Jets this week. They go to work today to set up what for them seems impossible, a defense that will keep O.J. Simpson away from a precious, publicized record, most yards gained rushing in a single season. So popular and spectacular is Simpson, and so meaningless is Sunday's game at Shea Stadium against the Buffalo Bills, that if the Jet defenders hold Simpson down it will be as if they shot Santa Claus.

title: 2 GUILTY IN SCHEME TO BILK SHOP OWNER
description: A man who won acquittal last fall in the slaying of a Queens nightclub owner was convicted by a Federal Court jury in Brooklyn yesterday of loansharking and conspiracy charges.

title: Speaker of Assembly in Jersey Seeks New Role for Legislature
