description: TRENTON, Dec. 11S. Howard Woodson Jr., the black legislator elected Speaker of the New Jersey Assembly, said today that he intended to strengthen the role of the Legislature during the incoming Democratic administration of Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne.

title: Patient Heir Apparent Malcolm Wilson
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The life and times of Malcolm Wilson have the quality of a threestage rocket.

title: MAYOR WILL VETO PLAN FOR RAISES
description: Mayor Lindsay said last night that if the City Council passed a bill raising the salaries of Board of Estimate members by $10,000 he would veto it.

title: $3,000 Bribery Plot Is Laid to 3 In Gimbels East Security Office
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office yesterday charged the former security manager of Gimbels East and two of his private detectives with demanding $3,000 from Yorkville restaurant owner for not testifying against him in case involving gift certificates stolen from the department store.

title: Rockefeller's 15 Years as Governor Reflect Achievement, Growth and Controversy
description: Fifteen years ago, when Dwight D. Eisenhower was President, Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller was a political neophyte who won the Republican gubernatorial nomination largely because G.O.P. leaders thought it was a Democratic year and because Mr. Rockefeller could finance his own and other Republican campaigns.

title: 6 DEAD AND 38 HURT IN KITTY HAWK FIRE
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 11 (UPI)Six persons were killed and 38 injured today when fire broke out aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk 700 miles east of the Philippines, the Naval Air Force Pacific Fleet announced.

title: 171MILLION ISSUE FOR HALLIBURION
description: The Halliburton Company, a major builder of oilfield equipment, raised $171.2million yesterday in one of the largest sales of stock by a corporation in at least 10 years.

title: Wilt Loses His Case; Can't Play This Year
description: Wilt Chamberlain, who jumped from the Los Angeles Lakers to become playercoach of the San Diego Conquistadors, will not be able to play this year.

title: 2Year Study Is Projected To Define Critical Choice
description: The two national commissions for which Governor Rockefeller is resigning to devote his full energies are cornposed of leaders of government, education and industry, each with a projected budget of $20million and each expected to complete its work within two years.

title: Bridge: Kaplan and Kay Capture Life Master Men's Pairs Chicago Women Win
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 11 One of the world's grew partnerships scored a popular victory here last night in the life master men's pairs, one of the major events in the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals. Edgar Kaplan of New York an Norman Kay of Philadelphia finished strongly to take the title, thus adding to their many honors.

title: STEEL DEMAND SEEN OUTPACING SUPPLY
description: The steel industry worldwide is simply unable to keep up with demand, Ernst Wimpfheimer, president of the American Institute for Imported Steel, Inc., asserted here yesterday.

title: Richardson Comments
description: Following are excerpts from a speech by Elliot L. Richardson, the former Attorney General, at the Appeal of Conscience Foundation Dinner here last night:

title: U.N. Approves Financing Of Mideast Peace Force
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., Dec. 11The General Assembly approved today financing arrangements for the United Nations Emergency Force in the Middle Last, which is to cost $30million for the first six months of operation.

title: Five Arab States Agree on Company For Sumed Pipeline
description: CAIRO, Dec. 11 (UPI)Egypt, Saudi Arabia and three oilrich Persian Gulf states have agreed on terms for forming a joint stock company to run the projected SueztoAlexandria oil pipeline, the Middle East News Agency said today.

title: Yale Lighting Limited To Tree Inside Home
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 UPI)Americans may use indoor Christmas tree lights this holiday season, but other ornamental lighting of private residences as well as commercial establishments is banned, William E. Simon, head of the Federal Energy Office, said today.

title: Senators Hear Some Canners Sell Substandard Food as Prime
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Some major food corporations routinely defraud consumers by marketing as prime quality food products that are underweight or substandard in quality, according to testimony today before a subcommittee of the Senate.

title: The Only Good Politics Is Clean Politics
description: WASHINGTONMost of the things that are wrong with politics in this country can he traced directly to the way we finance campaigns for public office. We would have a different country today if the political power of campaign contributors were measured by their votes and voices, instead of by their pocketbooks.

title: Oil Allocation Director Resigns In a Dispute With Energy Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Eli T. Reich, the 60yearold Navy vice admiral who retired Oct. 31 to head the Government's new oil allocation effort, resigned with genuine regret today, bringing to an end a series of confrontations with William E. Simon, head of the Federal Energy Office.

title: PRICE QUADRUPLES FOR IRAN CRUDE OIL
description: The Iranian Government announced yesterday that it had sold oil for as high as $17.40 a barrel, which represents a quadrupling in price, the Associated Press reported from Teheran.

title: Notes on People
description: The White House announced yesterday that Robert C. Hill would be nominated to become Ambassador to Argentina, succeeding John Davis Lodge.

title: American Can Signs Deal To Spur Soviet Packaging
description: The American Can Company announced yesterday that it had signed a preliminary agreement with the Soviet Union to help develop advanced container and packaging technology.

title: STATE G.O.P. BURT
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The resignation of Governor Rockefeller, the most powerful New York politician since 1959, weakened the state Republican party and gave Democrats their best hope of victory in more than a decade, politicians in all parties agreed today.

title: WOLF V. VISHNIAC, MICRO BIOLOGIST
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 11 (AP)Dr. Wolf V. Vishniac, a microbiologist, fell to his death in Antarctica while on a scientific expedition, it was reported today. He was 51 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PARIS, Dec. 11 (UPI)The International Automobile Association is ready to use substitute fuels to save Grand Prix competition, badly hit by the fuel crisis, Claude Leguezec, secretarygeneral of its International Sports Committee, said today. Drivers, manager's, manufacturers and racing officials from the leading auto racing countries are meeting here this week about the futuie of the sport in 1974.

title: A Ban on Interstate Sales Of Pet Turtles Demanded
description: Consumers Union demanded yesterday that the Federal Government take fast action to ban the interstate sale of pet turtles and to warn parents in the meantime that a seemingly harmless turtle given a youngster for Christmas could be a dangerous carrier of salmonellosis, a serious intestinal disease.

title: Donor to Neediest Finds That Giving Can Be Fun
description: In the spirit of St. Paul, who told the Corinthians in a letter that God loveth a cheerful giver, and in the belief that giving can be fun, Mrs. Albert H. Clayburgh sent $5 in cash to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fuud.

title: Dow Chemical Co. Plans Hong Kong Plastics Plant
description: The Dow Chemical Company announced yesterday that would construct a major polystyrene plant in Hong Kong.

title: Gains Seen in Kissinger's Brussels Visit
description: LONDON, Dec. 11Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here from Brussels tonight after three days of talks with allied officials that apparently succeeded in easing recent strains within the Atlantic alliance.

title: Shot Fired at Home Of Pele, Soccer Star
description: SANTOS, Brazil, Dec, 12 (UPI)A shot was fired last weekend into the home of Pele, the soccer star, police said today. The bullet smashed into the trophy room, causing little damage.

title: Chrysler Corp. Is Erecting Large BodyFrame Plant
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation confirmed today that it was building a nearly onemillionsquarefoot assembly plant to house an assembly line for fullsize and intermediatesize car body frame's.

title: SENATORS PUT OFF PROSECUTOR BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Senate Democratic leader decided today to delay indefinitely action on a bill to empower the courts to appoint a special prosecutor for the Watergate criminal investigations.

title: Mr. Kissinger: No Economic Superstar
description: WASHINGTONEconomics are now clearly central to U.S. foreign policy. They represent the bulk of our relations with Japan, Canada and the Third World. They are an integral component of our relations with Europe, with direct links to our security ties. Much of the Soviet motivation for dtente appears based on a desire for American technology, credits and food. Future U.S. leverage in both Hanoi and Saigon depends importantly on its ability to provide economic assistance.

title: Rally in Stocks Falters
description: The stock market fell yesterday in active trading, ending a strong threeday rally. The DowJones industrials dropped 16.96 points to 834.18. Page 65.

title: GOING OUT Guide
Red Smith
description: Historic offer and spectacular breakthrough were the words Bowie Kuhn chose a year ago to characterize minor modifications in the reserve system proposed by the men who own baseball. When he spoke, the commissioner was aware that the players had already rejected the offer as inadequate. About three months later when agreement on working conditions' was reached, the slave trade was left untouched except for one meager concession. Instead of being owned outright throughout his competitive life, a player now has veto power over trades involving him, provided he has been in the majors 10 years, the last five with one club. The opening of this loophole brought indulgent chuckles from those familiar with the baseball barons' modus operandi. They took it for granted that rather than let a player have voice in his own affairs, the employer would use him in deal at the end of nine years' service, or after four years with his present club. Recognizing the escape hatch worthless, most people forgot about it until last week when Ron Santo, after 14 years of dedicated service the Cubs, said no on a deal that would have sent him the California Angels.

title: Agnew Due in Court Dec. 18
description: TOWSON. Md., Dec. 11 (AP) Former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew is scheduled to appear in court Dec. 13 to fight disciplinary action brought by the Maryland State Bar Association. The association charged that Mr. Agnew's plea of no contest to a Federal taxevasion charge was evidence of ??.

title: Lethargy of Skylab 3 Crew Is Studied
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Dec, 11 (Reuters)The question of whether long space flights can be depressing, cause lethargy and mistakes by astronauts, is under study by doctors in view of the Skylab 3 crew's performance.

title: Airlines Predict Broader Cutbacks
description: A spokesman for the nation's airlines asserted yesterday that reduced Federal jet fuel allocations effective Jan. 7 would cause elimination of 1,600 additional flights each day, the grounding of 275 airliners and the laying off of more than 25,000 employes during 1974.

title: STOCK PRICES SLIP ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The threeday rally staged by the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market halted yesterday as selling late in the session drove prices lower in active trading.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two regional planning groups completed a threeyear study of the midHudson region with strong recommendation that new population be encouraged to settle in urban areas.

title: VLADIMIR ANKUDINOV
description: Vladimir M. Ankudinov, former head of Intourist, the Soviet Government travel agency, died Dec. 3 in Moscow. He was 65 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SECRET LIFE OF PLANTS. By Peter Tompkins and Christopher Bird. 402 pages. Harper & Row. $8.95.

title: G.O.P. Aides Discuss '74 Outlook With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Republican campaign officials discussed 1974 political prospects with President Nixon for an hour this morning without, by their account, once mentioning Watergate.

title: UTILITY OIL TO DROP 34% IN NEW ENGLAND
description: BOSTON, Dec, 11 (AP)The New England Power Pool anflounced today that New England utilities would get 24 per cen less oil than needed this winter, which could lead to severe power shortages.

title: Two Tons of Hams Stolen
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 11 (UPI) Two tons of country hams, many of them Christmas gifts scheduled for shipment around the country, were stolen here last night. Don Robins, owner of Hickory Ridge Country Hams, Inc., said the hams were valued at $6,500.

title: WHEAT FUTURES RISE DAILY LIMIT
description: With demand accelerating and sellers scarce, wheat future prices rose their daily permissible limit of 20 cents a bushel yesterday. Maine potato futures contracts also increased the daily limit of 40 cents.

title: Surgery for Reed; He's Out 2 Months
description: Willis Reed, the chief sore apot of the wounded Knicks, will undergo surgery today at St. Anthony's Hospital in Oklahoma City for a torn cartilage in his right knee. Dr. Donald O'Donoghue, an orthopedic surgeon, will perform the operation.

title: U.S. Acquires City Land For Use in Gateway Park
description: Mayor Lindsay and Ronald H. Walker, the director of the National Park Service, signed the legal papers yesterday to convey 14,000 acres of cityowned land to the Federal Government for the creation of the Gateway National Recreation Area at the mouth of New York Harbor.

title: Prague and Bonn Formalize Relations; Brandt Visit Ends 35 Years' Bitterness
description: PRAGUE, Dec. 11  West Germany and Czechoslovakia put 35 years of bitterness behind them today as Chancellor Willy Brandt flew here and signed a treaty establishing relations between them.

title: Cedeno Held in Fatal Shooting Of Woman, 19, in Motel Room
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Dec. 11Cesar Cedeno, the Houston Astros' star center fielder, was accused this morning of voluntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting of a 19yearold woman. He is expected to appear before the judge of arraignment of the Fourth Judicial Precinct tomorrow morning.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Defamation of Arab character seems to be the accepted style nowadays in United States communications media. Arabs are characterized as cheaters, blackmailers, stabbersintheback and warmongers. It is a pity for American democratic institutions that such allegations go unchallenged by the socalled liberals and the selfstyled antidefamation leagues.

title: 14 Vietnam Veterans Take City TrafficDirecting Jobs
description: Fourteen Vietnam veterans, many of whom directed traffic as military policemen, were assigned to duty at busy city intersections yesterday by the city's Traffic Department.

title: JOHN P. CURLEY
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Dec. 11 (AP)John Patrick Curley, director of athletics at Boston College from 1929 to 1957, died today at the Cape Cod Community Hospital. He was 82.

title: Gilhooley Offers A Plan for Aiding Bus Lines in State
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11  John Gilhooley, president of Transport of New Jersey, the nation's largest private masstransit carrier, today proposed a sweeping fuel conservation program that would include the elimination of bus tolls and other fees charged by port authorities and the relaxation of some rules imposed by regulatory agencies.

title: Others Will Take Each Day as It Comes
description: For those who find the task of tracking down something different the only real probleni about appointment calendars, take heart. Calendars for food buffs, shell or antiques collectors, opera fans, liberated women and design devotees are among the newlogs for 1974.

title: SMALL PANEL SET FOR NIXON INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The House Judiciary Committee reached informal agreement today that its inquiry into the impeachment of President Nixon should be conducted by a select subcommittee.

title: NIXON AIDE ACTED ON REBOZO REFUND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 One of President Nixon's chief advisers in preparing the statement of his personal finances also acted as a key intermediary in the return of $100,000 in cash from Charles G. Rebozo, the Florida banker, to a lawyer for Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire, it was disclosed today.

title: Newspaper Guild and Post Agree on 2Year Contract
description: The New York Post and the New York Newspaper Guild have reached a tentative agreement on a new twoyear contract, John Sladek, chairman of the guild unit, announced yesterday.

title: U.S. PANEL STUDIES TURNPIKE CRASHES
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, Dec. 11 The Federal Government today opened an investigation to the series of accidents that killed nine persons on the New Jersey Turnpike last month and it promptly encountered the issue of who was responsible for the lack of visibility that caused massive collisions on the state's major expressway.

title: Music: Philadelphians
description: More than two months late but still welcome, the Philadelphia Orchestra opened its annual New York series on Monday night at Avery Fisher Hall, which had been offlimits because of the New York Philharmonic's strike and picket lines there. The series, which has been juggled somewhat so that it still consists of 10 concerts, began happily with Carlo Maria Giulini conducting a sensibly scaled performance of Vivaldi's The Four Seasons.

title: Radio Emissions Of Comet Kohoutek Detected in Arizona
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)An Arizona observatory has heard radio signals from the comet Kohoutek, the national space agency reported today. It said this appeared to be the first strong evidence of radio emissions from any comet.

title: Spokesmen for Poor Assail Fuel Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Three spokesmen for consumers and poor people took issue today with the oil industry's contention that it needs higher fuel prices and the Nixon Administration's view that the present shortage should be bridged by squeezing personal, not industrial, consumption.

title: WIDER S.E.C. ROLE GAINS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)  The Senate Securities subcommittee approved today a bill giving the Securities and Exchange Commission broad authority over a proposed new central market system for stock exchanges.

title: Only Survivor in Jet Crash Last July 31 Dies of Burns
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)Leopold Chouinard, the only person to live after a Delta Airlines jet crashed in Boston last July, became the 89th victim of the crash when he died tonight.

title: Relevant Lesson
description: About a year ago, instructions went out to all United States Government agencies to eliminate the use of the word poverty from all official documents and to replace it with lowindome. The Pentagon made semantic history when it coined the abominable phrase protective reaction strike. The pronouncement that declared inoperative all previous Presidential statements on Watergate will long be remembered.

title: Astro Star Accorded Top Rating
description: At last week's winter meetings in Houston, where many baseball people had to spend hours in idle lobby conversation, six managers and general managers were asked at random: If you could pick one ballplayer right now to add to your roster, who would it be?

title: E.P.A. LOSES POWER TO LIMIT RADIATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 In a reversal of policy, President Nixon has shifted the authority to set radiation standards for individual nuclear power plants from the Environmental Protection Agency to the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Stock Prices Off Sharply; Dow Slumps 16.96 Points
description: Stock prices fell sharply yesterday as Wall Street's stirring, threeday technical rally ground to a jarring halt. Volume rose to 20.1 million shares from Monday's 18.59 million shares.

title: Greece Declares Riots Were Incited By ExPoliticians
description: ATHENS, Dec. 11Greece's military police said tonight that former politicians had instigated last month's student revolt but then lost control to anarchists who attempted to seize power.

title: A.K.C. Stays Male
description: A proposal to amend the bylaws and permit women delegates was defeated by 25 ballots at the quarterly meeting of the American Kennel Club in the Biltmore Hotel yesterday.

title: Churchman Sees Need to Curb Extremism in Radio
description: The move by members of government agencies to deregulate radio has been challenged by a defender of public rights in broadcasting, who asserted that many small radio stations were most in need of regulation because they regularly broadcast extremist propaganda or were guilty of advertising abuses.

title: STATE OVERTURNS FUELSAVING EDICT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 11Attorney General Robert K. Killian said today that the Connecticut State Board of Education lacks the authority to order schools to curtail evening activities, extend Christmas vacation and make other changes in their schedules in school calendars to savefuel.

title: MY OPTIONS OPEN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11Ending a 15year reign over state government and politics, Governor Rockefeller announced today that he would resign to pursue a new national role and turn over his authority to Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson next Tuesday.

title: John Spoltore Dies at 52; G.O.P. Chairman of Jersey
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11 (AP)John Spoltore, Republican state chairman, died early today of a heart attack at St. Francis Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived in Bridgeton, where he served as Mayor from 1953 to 1957. Before entering fulltime politics, Mr. Spoltore operated a drycleaning store in Bridgeton.

title: Records: Two Notable Moments in Duke Ellington's Career Are Recaptured
description: The local omnipresence of Duke Ellington includes not only his nightly performances at the Rainbow Grill and the publication of his book, Music Is My Mistress, but also the release of a twodisk album, The Golden Duke (Prestige P24029, $6.98), which focuses on two notable moments in his career.

title: Net Inflow Is Reported By Mutual Savings Banks
description: Following five successive months of net deposit outflows totaling over $2.2billion, the nation's mutual savings banks experienced a moderate $275million net inflow in November, according to figures released yesterday by the National Association of Mutual Savings Banks.

title: Opera: 3 Boheme Debuts
description: The performance of La Boheme at the Metropolitan Opera on Monday night was more than just the annual reentry into the repertory of the popular Puccini work, for there were three important debuts. Leif Segerstam, a 29yearold Finn, was the new conductor, who, surprisingly, turned out to be a Juilliard School alumnus, hay, ing studied there in the midsixties. At present he is director of the Finnish National Opera.

title: HARRY R. WALL
description: JACKSON, Mich., Dec. 11Harry R. Wall, vice chairman of the board of the Consumers Power Company, died at his home on Sunday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: SUSPECT IN SLAYING OF 5 HELD BY F.B.I.
description: A 34yearold Philadephia man wanted in the death of five people in an Atlantic City nightclub shootout was arrested last night, the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported.

title: New Rises Are Feared
description: The Iranian Government announced yesterday that it had sold oil for as high as $17.40 a barrel, which represents quadrupling in price, the Associated Press reported from Teheran.

title: E. P .A. Loes, Its Authority On Power Plant Radiation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11In a reversal of policy, President Nixon has shifted the authority to set radiation standards for individual nuclear power plants from the Environmental Protection Agency to the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Bucks Win 10th in Row; Allen Stars
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 11 (AP)  The Milwaukee Bucks, sparked by 28 points by Lucius Allen and 20 by Bob Dandridge, routed the Seattle Supersonics, 13091, tonight for their 10th consecutive National Basketball Association victory.

title: Advertising: There's GoodNews
description: All things considered, a pretty rosy future was predieted yesterday for the advertising industry. Now let's see if the predictions help the price of public ad agencies' stock.

title: Prosecution Rests Case in Chesimard Robbery Trial
description: Federal marshals dragged about 20 shouting spectators out of the courtroom where. Joanne Chesimard and Fred Hilton were on trial yesterday then battled with them in the corridors of the Federal Court House at Foley Square.

title: PANEL SET TO WEIGH SAXBE'S NOMINATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Senator William B. Saxbe will take the witness chair tomorrow for an expeditedand, it is expected, abbreviatedhearing by the Senate Judiciary Committee on his nomination as Attorney General.

title: CLOSING EXTENDED FOR MADISON HIGH
description: James Madison High School in Brooklyn was ordered closed again yesterday by its principal after renewed violence involving black and white teenagers resulted in one stabbing, at least three other injuries and five arrests.

title: CAR MAKERS POST NEW PRICE TAGS
description: Full $150 Is Added to Cost of the Small Models

title: Patient Heir Apparent
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The life and times of Malcolm Wilson have the quality of a threestage rocket.

title: Fashion of Past and Present To Get Home on 27th Street
description: The largest research facility in the world for fashion designers who want to study the sartorial masterpieces of their predecessors and for textile designers who wish to sort through millions of swatches of material for inspiration is being constructed by the State University of New York at Seventh Avenue and 27th Street.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PARIS, Dec. 11 (UPI)The International Automobile Association is ready to use substitute fuels to save Grand Prix competition, badly hit by the fuel crisis, Claude Leguezec, secretarygeneral of its International Sports Committee, said today. Drivers, managers, manufacturers and racing officials from the leading auto racing countries are meeting here this week about the future of the sport in 1974.

title: Mrs. Paul Wed to Sinclair Hatch
description: Mrs. Jean Lithgow Paul, widow of the Rev. Dr, James A. Paul, rector of the Episcopal Church of the Holy Trinity, was married here yesterday noon to Sinclair Hatch, a member of the New York law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy.

title: Governor Bows Out ...
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller has been a Governor in the fine tradition of New York State. His years in Albany, particularly the early years, kept unbroken a bipartisan chain of distinction that began more than a halfcentury ago with Alfred E. Smith and stretched on through F.D.R., Lehman, Dewey and Harriman.

title: DR. JOHANNA HILKOWICH
description: Dr. Johanna Reisberg Hilkowich, gynecologist and obstetrician and the widow of Dr. be Maurice Hilkowich, died yesterday at Flower Fifth Avenue Hospital. Her age was BO and she lived at 315 Central Park West.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Texas Planning Proposals On an Offshore Terminal
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 11The Texas Offshore Terminal Commission, speeding up its schedule of studies to hasten the start of construction of the nation's first port to handle supertankers, will be ready to make recommendations to the Texas Legislature on Dec. 20.

title: What Lies Behind The Purge
description: BRUSSELSIt is impossible to forecast to what extent the fate of Mao Tsetung's great revolution will ultimately depend on China's relations with Russia. At present these are very bad and one consequence is the new friendship between Peking and Washington. Nevertheless, as I wrote from China (Oct. 31, 1973):

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: MILTON R. LEADER
description: Milton R. Leader, a former builder who had been active for many years in real estate, died yesterday at his home, 145 Central Park West. He was 68 years old.

title: Lottery Proposed to Aid Wilmington Crime Victims
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 11 (AP)The owner of an auto repair shop here, upset at the rash of recent thefts in his area, has raised the ire of the city police by proposing a larceny lottery.

title: Morgan Library Obtains 1,500Piece Art Treasure
description: The country's largest and finest collection of Italian drawings in private hands, owned by the cellist and art patron Janos Scholz, will be acquired by the Pierpont Morgan Library, Mr. Scholz announced last evening.

title: Hockey Scoring
Golf Group Is Shooting For BetterService Role
description: The Metropolitan Golf Association officials struck a note for better service to the community at the annual meeting yesterday.

title: Statements at Rockefeller News Conference
description: I have decided not to seek a fifth term as Governor of New York. I will resign next Tuesday after 15 years of service to the people of the state.

title: Monday's Fight
description: New YorkHedgemon Lewis, 146 pounds, Los Angeles, outpointed Johnny. Gant, 142, Washington, D,C., 10 rounds.

title: Broad Soviet Drive On To Automate Economy
description: A massive campaign is under way in the Soviet Union to modernize economic management, automate the planning system and upgrade industry to stimulate lagging technological growth and keep up with the West.

title: STATE G.O.P. HURT
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The resignation of Governor Rockefeller, the most powerful New York politician since 1959, weakened the state Republican party and gave Democrats their best hope of victory in more than a decade, politicians in all parties agreed today.

title: Tax Break Is Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) Representative Bob Price, Republican of Texas, today introduced a bill that would allow a tax deduction for homeowners who insulate their homes better, thus saving heating fuel. Nearly half the heating energy in homes and offices is wasted through inadequate insulation, he said. His deduction would go to homeowners and small businessmen.

title: BISHOP THOMAS COLLINS
description: MARYKNOLL, N.Y., Dec. 11 Bishop Thomas Patrick Collins, a Maryknoll missionary for 31 years, died on Friday at the Ferncliff Nursing Home in Rhinebeck. He was 58 years, old and was a resident of St. Teresa's, Maryknoll.

title: Thompson Resigns At Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., Dec. 11Leslie Thompson, athletic director and chairman of the athletic department at the State University Center here, has resigned from both his positions, effective at the end of the semester.

title: Rep. Wolff Seeks to Shut Off Pilot Lights on Gas Ranges
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Dec. 11Estimating that 30 to 50 per cent of all gas used by the nation's 41 million gas range is consumed by their con. venience pilot lights, Representative Lester B. Wolff plans to introduce legislation that would require the shuitoff of such lights and bring back the kitchen match as a conservation measure.

title: Jail Guards Protest Slaying
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 11 (AP) Western State Penitentiary was sealed to outsiders today in the wake of the beating's death of a guard officer and a work stoppage by rankandfile guards. Corrections officials met with the dissident guards after the fatal beating of Lieut: Walter Peterson, 42 years old, in an exercise room of a maximum security building in the prison.

title: California Board Rejects Plea On Collecting Nixon State Tax
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11  A straight partyline vote today defeated a proposal that the California Franchise Tax Board publicly announce that it would try to collect state income taxes from Piesident Nixon. The President disclosed last week that he had paid none.

title: Priorities Being Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Nixon Administration pians to require a reduction of gasoline production by as much as 20 per cent, informed sources said tonight.

title: Court Backs Governor's Right To Shift Judges to Drug Cases
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday upheld Governor Rockefeller's right to appoint up to 68 additional Court of Claims judges to preside over narcotics trials.

title: Crib Death Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Senate approved today by voice vote a bill that would provide counseling services for parents whose infants were victims of. crib death. In addition to creating regional counseling centers, the bill would provide support for research.

title: Something New in the Women's Movement
description: The women's liberation movement appears to be on the threshold of a second phasewhen feminist consciousness reaches beyond white, middleclass women. Some examples of what's happening: union women are holding meetings across the country, black feminists have formed a national organization, Puerto Rican women and Chicanos are getting togetherall assessing where we're at as women, where we want to go, and how to get there. These are strong indications that we are moving past the affluent suburban housewife image with which the women's movement has, rightly or wrongly, been labeled.

title: Felipe Alou to Manage
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican republic, Dec. 11 (UPI)Felipe Alou, who was traded last week from the Montreal Expos to the Milwaukee Brewers, has signed as the manager of the Escogido Lions in the Dominican Baseball League. The 37yearold Alou, who retired from Winter League play two seasons ago, replaced Jim Wiliams yesterday.

title: CINCINNATI VOTES INTEGRATION PLAN
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 11  Cin. cinnati's lameduck schoo board voted a sweeping plan last night for the desegregation of the city's public schools three weeks before a newly elected hoard pledged to resist integration takes office.

title: Automotive Parts Makers Hopeful for '74
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11Leaders of the industry that makes, distributes and sells the parts needed to make and keep cars running are bullish about next year in spite of the energy crisis.

title: Supreme Court Widens Power of Police To Search Individual Without Warrant
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Supreme Court broadened today the power of law enforcement officers to search persons without a warrant.

title: Sale of Silver Tray Adds $7,000 To Delivery Boy's Inheritance
description: A rare 18thcentury Italian silver tray, given by an old woman to a helpful delivery boy by means of a pawn ticket and later appraised to sell for $3,000 to $5,000, bought $8,250 at auction yesterday.

title: REV. DR. O. C. MAXWELL
description: The Rev. Dr. O. Clay Maxwell, pastor for 40 years of Mount Olivet Baptist Church at 201 Lenox Avenue, died on Monday at his home, 114 West 120th Street. He was 88 years old.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE Second Division

title: Rally in Stocks Falters
description: The stock market fell yesterday in active trading, ending a strong threeday rally. The DowJones industrials dropped 16.96 points to 834.18. Page 65.

title: Kissinger Repeats Denial on Plumbers
description: LONDON, Dec. 11  Secretary of State Kissinger repeated his denial tonight that he had had any involvement in the White House plumbers or had known that David R. Young Jr., his former aide, was engaged in the group's clandestine activities.

title: Anxiety in Market
description: After a brief rally from its lows, the stock market, off sharply yesterday, is still anxious and uncertain. For the short term, investors appeared to have decided that the market was oversold after hitting bottom a week ago. But the more fundamental issue remained: Did the drop that began during the Middle East war, when the Arabs launched their :oil weapon against the Western industrialized countries and Japan, really create opportunities for investorseven if 1974 turns out to be a year of recession? Or did the slide that began Oct. 17 mark the beginning of a long bear market of an unprecedented and unfathomable nature?

title: Amnesty Group Prepares Charges of Chilean Torture
description: PARIS, Dec. II (Reuters) Officials of Amnesty Internad tional, an organization that seeks to defend the rights of political prisoners, were comIpleting a report today that was said to charge Chile with forture.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Already, a Mary Quant Retrospective
description: LONDONI didn't have time to wait for women's lib, said Mary Quant, the designer who helped revolutionize British fashion and set an international trend.

title: Broncos Print Tickets
description: DENVER, Dec. 11 (AP)For the first time in history, the Denver Broncos are printing playoff tickets. The Broncos, who have floundered for a decade, can win the National Football League's American Conference West Division title Sunday by beating the Oakland Raiders.

title: Santo Stays in Chicago, Cubs Trade Him to White Sox
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11 (UPI)Ron Santo, the slugging third baseman, was traded to the Chicago White Sox today after 14 years with the Chicago Cubs.

title: City Ballet Reappears Tonight at 6
description: Poised and ready for its first entrechats, the New York City Ballet goes back into business after a fourweek dancers' strike with a 6 P.M. performance tonight of The Nutcracker.

title: Negotiation by Waldheim With South Africa is Ended
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 11The Security Council voted unanimously tonight to discontinue the private negotiating tain efforts made by Secretary General Waldheim to persuade the South African Government to give independence to SouthWest Africa.

title: Islanders Set Back Seals, 63
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 11 A dreadful game, in which the Zamboni ice cleaning machine was the only performer that worked, was salvaged in the final minutes tonight by the Islanders.

title: Irate Parents Protest Of School Fund Cuts Continue at Hearing
description: Disputes over financing new or expanded schools continued yesterday as the City Planning Commission held its second session of hearings on the proposed capital budget for the year beginning next July 1.

title: Tax Ruling Scores. White House Role
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A Federal judge ordered the Internal Revenue Service today to grant taxexempt status to a public interest research group, on the ground that the refusal of the White House to give the judge some documents in the case constituted an admission that the White House had exercised improper pressure on the I.R.S.

title: Mahoney Gibes at Governor
description: Governor Rockefeller is leaving New York State locked in a financial half nelson, J. Daniel Mahoney, state chairman of the Conservative party and an old foe, said yesterday. He said the state's taxpayers had the highest percapita state and local tax burdens in the nation. Of the Governor, Mr. Mahoney declared: the one consistent critical choice he always made for New York was to raise taxes and spending.

title: RAILROADAID BILL VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Senate acted tonight to prevent a shutdown of rail service in the Northeast by passing legislation similar to a measure approved a month ago by the House of Representatives.

title: DOLLAR HITS A PEAK AGAINST THE POUND
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (UPI)The dollar rose to its highest point ever against the pound today, when it was quoted at $2.3040 to the pound in early trading. It weakened to $2.3120 at midday but strengthened to close at $2.3075 as the pound drifted downwards.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 12, 1973

title: Murderer Gets Life Term
description: RENO, Nev., Dec. 11 (UPI)A 22yearold man was found guilty of firstdegree murder and sentenced to life in prison last night for the shotgun killing of a young woman who allegedly stole his marijuana. A jury deliberated only six hours before finding William A. Hartman guilty of firing two shotgun blasts though a window and killing Karen Lee Engele, 24, in her Reno apartment Feb. 24.

title: 17,463 See Notre Dame Defeat Indiana
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 11 (AP)  John Shumate scored 26 points for Notre Dame as the sixthranked Fighting Irish beat Indiana, ranked third, 7367, tonight before 17,463 fans, the largest crowd to attend a basketball game in Indiana.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Electric Boat Division of the General Dynamics Corporation has been awarded a contract to build four submarines at a cost of $269millionLast month the same shipyard at Groton, Conn., received the largest submarine contract in its his tory, a $500million contract to build seven of the same type of nuclear attack vessels in the 688 series.

title: Rosewall Will Play In W.T.T.
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 11 (AP) Ken Rosewall has signed a oneyear contract to become playercoach of the Pittsburgh Triangles of the World Team Tennis league, the team said today.

title: Elliott Roosevelt Backed In Securities Case Denial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) Senate investigators cannot corroborate charges that Elliott Roosevelt was involved in selling stolen securities, according to Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington.

title: Shrine Teams Set
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Two more players were named today to complete the rosters for the Shrine EastWest football game at Candlestick Park on Dec. 29. Darnell Austin a 6foot4inch, 240pound tackle from South Carolina who can play offense or defense, was added to the East squad, while Mike Basinger, a 62, 271pound defensive tackle from the University of California, Riverside, was named to the West Squad.

title: Lloyds Bid for First Western Backed
description: The application of the Lloyds Bank Group of London to acquire the First Western Bank and Trust Company of Los Angeles has been approved by the Federal Reserve Board. There is a statutory period of 30 days before the approval becomes effective. Last June, Lloyds Bank Group announced it had agreed to pay $115million in cash for the bank, which is 99.5 per cent owned by World Airways, Inc. That price was $20million higher than one set in 1971 when World Airways proposed to sell First Western to the Wells Fargo Bank of San Francisco for $95million in cash and notes. That transaction was terminated after coming under attack by the antitrust division of the Justice Department.

title: McAlinden Stops Vern MacIntosh
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (UPI)The British heavyweight boxing champion, Danny McAlinden, scored a fourthround knockout over an American, Vern Maclntosh, tonight at the Royal Albert Hall.

title: CREDITS TO SOVIET BARRED AS HOUSE BACKS TRADE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The House of Representatives cast a resounding vote against the Soviet Union's emigration policies today and then approved and sent to the Senate the most comprehensive foreign trade legislation in at least 40 years.

title: MICHAEL GRAY, LED CATHOLIC LAWYERS
description: Michael. C. Gray, president of the Guild of Catholic Lawyers, died, apparently of a heart attack, in Beekman Downtown Hospital on Monday evening after having collapsed in Small Claims Court. He was 65 years old and lived at 6010 Fieldston Road, Riverdale, the Bronx.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Dec. 12, 1973 GENEFAL ASSEMBLY

title: Coast Cities Awarded Pro Soccer Franchises
description: The North American Soccer League awarded yesterday franchises to four West Coast cities. The league, which operated with 17 teams in 1968 and only five in, 1969, will function with at least 12 teams in 1974.

title: PACT WITH SOVIET DEBATED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11Less than two weeks after Leonid I. Brezhnev's visit to New Delhi, Indian officials as well as foreign diplomats are sharply divided over its impact.

title: U.S. Reports a Threat Against Kissinger's Life
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The State Department said today that what the United States Government considered a direct threat against the life ofSecretary of State Kissinger had been made over the weekend.

title: ISRAEL ARMS AID VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The House approved today by a vote of 362 to 54 legislation that would authorize the President to extend $2.2billion in emergency military aid to Israel to rebuild her forces in the wake of the October war.

title: Rockefeller Press Aide to Be Betting and Lottery Commissioner
description: In one of his final acts in office, Governor Rockefeller announced yesterday the appointment of his press secretary, Ronald Maiorana, as Commissioner of Offtrack Betting and Lottery.

title: LAWYER, EXRED, BACKED BY COURT
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 12 (AP)A threejudge panel has recommended reinstatement to the bar for a former member of the Communist party who was convicted of advocating the violent overthrow of the United States Government.

title: Film: 'Happy New Year'
description: Claude Lelouch's "Happy New Year" ("La Bonne Anne") is as much like any number of other Claude Lelouch films as one chicken egg is like another. It shouldn't be reviewed. It should be candled.This one, which opened yesterday at the Fine Arts Theater, is a little old. It's about an off-season caper in Cannes, an attempt by Lino Ventura and Charles Grard, two charming, naive, pragmatic, straight-laced, middle-aged con artists, to knock over the Van Cleef & Arpels shop down the Croisette from the Carlton Hotel. In the course of their preparations, Lino falls in love with Franoise Fabian, the beautiful, worldly, understanding, amusing, liberated, intelligent, witty, sensuous, compassionate, 30-ish owner of an antiques shop next to Van Cleef & Arpels.Though Franoise rates five more adjectives than Lino, she, in turn, falls in love with him. The caper comes off, but not as planned. There's a lot of Francis Lai music on the soundtrack, a lot of footage devoted to transportation by car, truck and train, and a lot of Mr. Lelouch, including some scenes from "A Man and a Woman."I find it difficult to understand how a director as intelligent as Mr. Lelouch, who has a feeling for comedy ("Money, Money, Money") and who hires such attractive performers, can make a film as totally vacuous as "Happy New Year." It bubbles occasionally, but like low-calorie club soda.

title: TV: Shockley vs. Innis
description: With more than a touch of irony, the plans for a controversial debate that made some universities and colleges curiously shy, that gave some student groups an opportunity to become howling censors have been partly. realized on television, a medium frequently and justifiably attacked for its timidity.

title: Coal From Poland
description: The first shipment of Polish coal for use in the United States was being unloaded yesterday at a dock in Somerset, Mass. The cargo12,650 tons of lowsulphur coal  arrived Tuesday night on the Liberian vessel M. V. Birkhall for two New England utilities, the New England Power Company and the Montaup Electric Company.

title: REZONING SCORED FOR E. 86TH STREET
description: A proposed zoning change that would restrict the conunercial development of 86th Street, in the heart of the Yorkville section on the Upper East Side, was attacked yesterday as being a veiled method of discouraging visits of black and Puerto Rican shoppers from nearby Harlem.

title: Mad Bomber, Now 70, Goes Free Today
description: George Metesky, the onetime Mad Bomber, who for 16 years in the nineteenforties and fifties terrorized the city with the explosives he set off in theaters, terminals, libraries and offices, is going home to Waterbury today.

title: Jack Dempsey Is Fighting Back To Save Lease on His Restaurant
description: Jack Dempsey is to appear in LandlordTenant Court this morning to fight a challenger's effort to break the lease for Jack Dempsey's Restaurant, which the former heavyweight champion has had on Broadway for 37 years.

title: SENATORS SUMMON MOTEL'S RECORDS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12The Senate Watergate committee has subpoenaed records from the San Clemente Inn concerning visits there by persons involved with Howard R. Hughes, the special White House squad known as the plumbers and some friends of President Nixon.

title: Text of Address by Kissinger in London on Energy and European Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Following is the text of an address by Secretary of State Kissinger to the Pilgrims, a BritishAmerican organization, in London today, as made public by the State Department:

title: Wilson Selects O'Donnell As Adviser and Press Aide
description: Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson will retain the Rockefeller Cabinet principals and appoint as his spokesman and close political adviser Harry J. O'Donnell, a respected strategist of the Dewey, Rockefeller and Lindsay administrations.

title: Killer Serving Life Weds CommonLaw Wife in Jail
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)Standing together in a tiny unfurnished room with gray walls, a convicted murderer today married his commonlaw wife of 16 years in a jailhouse ceremony. The bride managed to smile before her husband was carted off to prison to serve out a life sentence.

title: Penguins Trounce Penguins Trounce Golden Seals
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Syl Apps and Ron Lalonde scored two goals each as the Pittsburgh Penguins broke a sevengame victoryless streak by trouncing the California Golden Seals, 91, tonight.

title: $42aWeek Raise Is Won At Washington StarNews
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)  Tentative agreement on a new contract providing a $42aweek wage increase over two years has been reached between representatives of The Washington StarNews and the WashingtonBaltimore Newspaper Guild.

title: Decision Reflects Failure to Motivate Players
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 12Near the close of what looms as the second worst season in the 49year history of the New York Giants, Alex. Webster annouced his resignation today as coach, effective following Sunday's final game with Minnesota Vikings.

title: Askew Bars Gas' Sale Ban
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec, 12 (AP)Gov. Reubin Askew declined yesterday to lift a ban on Sunday gasoline sales along the Florida Turnpike. But Mr. Askew assured representatives of the state's tourism industry he would take their plea for adequate fuel for vacation travelers to Washington if gasoline rationing was instituted.

title: City and U.S. Aides Report Exxon Pact Resulting in Only Minor Gasoline Cut
description: City and Federal officials insisted yesterday that New York City had been spared an 84,000gallonaweek cut in December gasoline suppliies as proposed a week ago by Exxon, the city's supplier. Thus, they said, the city will not have to make emergency reductions of such vital services as police protection, garbage collection, fire protection or hospital, ambulance services during the month, as had been feared.

title: Soviet Suggests NATO Drop Dr. Luns as Dangerous
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union advised the North Atlantic Treaty Organization today to dismiss its Secretary General, Dr. Joseph M. A. H. Luns of the Netherlands, alleging that he suffered from delirium tremens.

title: Governors at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The nation's governors have been invited to a White House meeting tomorrow to discuss energy conservation measures, the deputy press secretary, Gerald L. Warren, said today.

title: Paris Intelligence Aide Sees Judge on Bugging Charges
description: PARIS, Dec. 12 (Reuters) A senior French counterespionage official whose identification is a state secret appeared unexpectedly today before a judge after the satirical magazine Le Canard Enchains charged that he was one of the leaders of an attempt to bug the publication's new offices.

title: Cairo Reshuffles Military Leadership
description: CAIRO, Dec. 12Maj. Gen. Mohammed Abdel Ghany elGamasy, who has been conducting the military talks with Israel on the CairoSuez road, today became the Egyptian Army's new chief of staff, replacing Maj. Gen. Saad Eddin alShazli.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 12 (AP)With a little more than two weeks remaining, Herve Filion has locked up his sixth straight North American harness race driving crown. In the latest figures released by the United States Trotting Association today, the Canadian driver showed 411 victories to 316 for Buddy Gilmour, the runnerup.

title: Plan for Allocating Fuels Outlined by Energy Office
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Administration outlined today a tentative master plan for allocating scarce supplies of fuel this winter.

title: Anglicans and Catholics Reach Accord on Ministry
description: An international commission of Anglican and Roman Catholic scholars announced yesterday that it had reached basic agreement on the nature of the priesthood and the ministry of laymen.

title: People and Business
description: The directors of Avon Products yesterday elected Fred G. Fusee chairman of the board of the troubled cosmetics company, effective Jan. 1. He will continue to hold the post of chief executive, which he has held since January, 1972.

title: Soviet Plan for 1974 Promises Faster Rise in Consumer Sector
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12The Soviet leadership, signaling continuing interest in reduction of EastWest tensions, disclosed today a scaleddown economic plan for 1974 that promises increased growth in the consumer sector and a slight cutback in the formal military budget.

title: Mad Bomber, Now 70, Goes Free Today
description: George Metesky, the onetime Mad Bomber, who for 16 years in the nineteenforties and fifties terrorized the city with the explosives he set off in theaters, terminals, libraries and offices, is going home to Waterbury today.

title: WALDHEIM CHOICE TO HEAD PARLEY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 12The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed, that Secretary General Waldheim should preside over the Middle East peace conference that now is regarded as almost certain to begin Tuesday in Geneva.

title: Cincinnati Bus Strike Ends
description: CINCINNATI, Dc. 12 (UPI)Employs of the Queen City Metro voted today 320 to 111 to return to work and end a fourdayold bus strike in this city of 470,000. The members of Local 627 of the Amalgamated Transit Union took the vote after negotiations for both sides had hammered out a compromise agreement. Details of the pact were not immediately available.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 13, 1973

title: Korean Unification
description: CARMEL, Calif.Korea is still at war. Although the guns have been stilled for the time being, their actions are .still cocked. The United Nations forces including the Republic of Korea and the United States armed forces are not engaged in active combat with North Korea's army, but they still face each other along a 151mile frontier in the Korean peninsula. It is a period of suspended hostilities under an armed truce signed over two decades ago. The Korean armistice is the longest armistice agreement in history.

title: Mrs. Ruth S. Tukey Wed to E. W. Bates
description: Mrs. Ruth Schweigert Tukey of Woodland, Mich., widow of Harold Bradford Tukey, was married here yesterday afternoon to Emmert Warren Bates of New York, senior vice president of the Litton Educational Publishing Company. The Rev. Lawrence Durgin, assisted by the Rev. Robert Lecky, both Congregational ministers, performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Paul the Apostle.

title: Spanish Priests End Strike
description: MADRID, Dec. 12 (UPI)Six Roman Catholic priests imprisoned in Zamora for political offenses ended a 16day hunger strike yesterday, an official statement distributed by. Spanish news agencies said. The priests had protested their imprisonment at the prison, a special facility for priests set up by agreement between Spain and the Vatican, and demanded transfers to prisons with other political prisoners.

title: 10Q Filing Is Affected
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission issued new guidelines today for the preparation of quarterly corporate financial reports filed with the commission. It noted that there had been deficiencies in the preparation of the reportsknown as 10Qin the past and failure to comply fully with S.E.C. reporting rules.

title: Personal Finance
F.A.O. Sees Food Threat In Fertilizer Shortage
description: ROME, Dec. 12The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization warned today that the world oil crisis was threatening a serious shortage of fertilizers in many developing countries and a severe reduction in their farm output.

title: Energy Office Concedes Error in Its Fuel Regulations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Federal Energy Office allowed to stand for most of today a major error in its proposed fuel regulations.

title: Rumanian Resins
description: A leading United States manufacturer of plastic products, faced with a serious shortage of raw materials, has concluded an unusual arrangement with the Rumanian Government to buy its entire export of petrochemical materials.

title: Blue Chips and Glamour Stocks Are Off As low Average Plunges 23.45 Points
description: Investors' concern over the increasing energy crisis and its effects on the economy sent stock prices sharply lower yesterday in lighter trading.

title: Baruch in Brooklyn
description: At a superficial glance, the temptation seems irresistible for City University acceptance of the offer to buy a new 40story office building at 2 New York Plaza near Battery Park as the new campus of Baruch College. The vocal supporters of the purchase, including many parttime members of the Baruch faculty employed the Wall Street area, cite the attractiveness of locating a businessoriented institution near the financial district. They also point to the saving in time and money the readymade structure offers in comparison with the projected establishment of a new campus in downtown Brooklyn.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WILLINGBORO, Dec. 12With his father a former college football star and his mother a finalist in the hurdles at the PanAmerican Games, it is no wonder that Cleve Lewis of Kennedy High School was the sensation of South Jersey scholastic soccer this fall.

title: UraniumEnergy Project Explained at Oak Ridge
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., Dec. 12 A new $700million energysource demonstration project, designed to provide electricity while burning now wasted uranium 238, was explained by officials at a gathering of legislators, civic leaders and others.

title: PAUL GUTERMAN
description: Paul Guterman, a vice president of the investmentbanking firm of Bache & Co., and a wellknown metals trader, died Tuesday evening at his home, 903 Park Avenue. He was 68 years old.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Golden Gate Bridge Suicide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (UPI)  A 19yearold youth dropped his wallet on the Golden Gate Bridge, told two strolling teenaged girls, You don't belong here, and then leaped from the span. The coroner's office identified the leaper yesterday as Joe B. Jentrick. He became the 504th known suicide from the bridge. His body was not recovered.

title: Briton Gains in Tennis
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 12 (AP)John Feaver of Britain defeated Saeed Meer of Pakistan, 64, 46, 61, today and moved into the quarterfinals of the West Australian open tennis championships.

title: Soviet Devising a Computer Net for State Planning
description: This is the second of three articles on the Soviet Union's efforts to make its planned economy more productive and efficient through the introduction of new technology. The writer, director of science and education news for The New York Times, has recently completed a twoandahalfweek visit to the Soviet Union.

title: 3 Robbery Suspects Are Shot by Owners In 2 Bronx Stores
description: Three robbery suspects were shot by store owners in two separate holdup attempts in the South Bronx yesterdaythe latest in a series of incidents in which victims have turned the tables.

title: Bureaucracy and E.P.A.
description: President Nixon's decision that the Atomic Energy Commission rather ahan the Environmental Protection Agency should set radiation standards for nuclear power plants has implications that go beyond radiation and environment, to the unatomy of the Federal Government.

title: CLOSE NIXON TIES EXPECTED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Vice President Ford disclosed today that, contrary to the practice with his predecessor, he expected to confer with President Nixon at least once a day. He said that the arrangement had been suggested by Mr. Nixon.

title: Columbia Pictures Chief Criticized About Losses
description: Alan J. Hirschfield, who joined Columbia Pictures Industiries, Inc., as president and chief executive officer last July, faced its stockholders yesterday for the first time at the annual meetingand was immediately greeted by complaints about overall losses of $82million in the last three years.

title: BERGEN OFFICIAL AMONG 6 INDICTED
description: A Commissioner of the Bergen County sewer authority and five others were indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday on a charge that bribes of $3,750 were paid in return for depositing more than $1million of authority funds in a New York City bank.

title: $5,661 a Month Held From President's Pay
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 12 (AP)  President Nixon's monthly pay of $20,433.34, including expenses, is reduced by tax withholding and other deductions to $15,069.88, the White House said today.

title: Births
description: KAMRASDr. and Mrs, Marvin H. Kamras happily announce the birth of their son, Jason Scott on December 12, 1973.

title: JUDGMENT ON COHN VACATED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12  A default judgment against Roy M. Cohn, the New York lawyer and financier, has been vacated in Circuit Court here and the case has been reassigned to another judge, with a trial expected early next year.

title: Millions in Rises Won By Con Ed Recently
description: The most recent electric rate increase granted to Consolidated Edisona permanent rise was for $69.2million. This was approved on Sept. 6 by the Public Service Commission, and coming on top of a temporary increase of $95.3million awarded earlier, it lifted the rates by $164.5million a year. The utility had asked for a total increase of $183.6million.

title: IRISH IS NAMED TO YOUTH AGENCY
description: The appointment of Carleton Irish as program administrator of the Youth Services Agency and executive director of the Youth Board was announced yesterday by Jule M. Sugarman, the Human Resources Administrator.

title: DEMOCRATS CHOOSE KANSAS CITY FOR '74
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) A Democratic party committee formally selected Kansas City, Mo., today as the site of next year's miniconvention.

title: Women's Lib Goes To Dogs
description: Sex discrimination continues at the American Kennel Club. Twentyone years ago a motion to amend the bylaws and accept women as delegates was overwhelmingly defeated. On Tuesday, the allmale assembly of 202 again voted down the motion by the board of directors, this time by 25 ballots. There were 127 in favor, 74 opposed and one ballot was illegal. A threequarters vote of approval was necessary.

title: TAX PANEL PLANS COMPLETE REVIEW OF NIXON RETURNS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Congressional Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation decided today to look into every aspect of President Nixon's tax returns for the years of his Presidency, not just the two items that Mr. Nixon asked the committee to review.

title: Bridge: Blue Ribbon Pairs Attract Record Fall Nationals Entry
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 12 Although far from major population centers, the American Contract Bridge League tournament here is certain to be the biggest Fall Nationals, with more than 13,000 tables in play by the time it ends Sunday. And the event may prove to be the second biggest tournament, trailing the 1973 Summer Nationals in Washington, in which 16,000 tables were in play.

title: On Being Wrong
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  Avid readers of this space may recall an essay this summer that used the great pendulum at the Smithsonian Institution as a symbol.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Classes resumed at Essex County College following three days of disruption over the selection of a vice president. A handful of pickets showed up outside the school in the morning, but this had no effect on attendance.

title: U. S. Dips Into War Reserve to Supply Oil to Indochina
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Defense Department said today that it was drawing upon the nation's war reserves of oil in the Pacific to supply the South Vietnamese and Cambodian armed forces with their daily minimum military requrements.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Contrary to expectations, a study by the Food and Drug Administration has shown that food packages not only are not shortweighted, they are, in fact, overfilled.

title: Cop Edison Seeks a 22.6% Increase in Electric Rates
description: The Consolidated Edison Company asked the Public Servida Commission yesterday for permission to raise electric rates by 22.6 per cent over the next two years.

title: Baseball Is Sued by San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 12 (AP) An antitrust suit against the National League was filed today by the city of San Diego, charging a conspiracy since early 1971 to take the San Diego Padres to Washington.

title: Wilt Is Not Giving Up Legal Rattle to Play
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 12 (UPI)Wilt Chamberlain said today that further litigation was possible in his efforts to gain legal permission to play this season for the San Diego Conquistadors.

title: Businesses in Ulster Plod Along Despite the Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Whenever a display window is blown apart by a bomb explosion at one of the Brand Group's four clothing stores here, workers automatically begin sweeping out the glass and nailing up the plywood.

title: Syria Reports Sharp Clash With Israel on Golan Front
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec, 12A serious clash on the Golan Heights front, involving tank, artillery and mortar fire, was reported today by Syria.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: More Bewildering Than Bedazzling
description: The sheep stole the show at least, at first. Bleating and snorting they nuzzled fashion designers and the Knoll International furniture classics: that the designers had transformed with such things as buckles, furs, ruffles and rhinestones.

title: Alex Webster Resigns
description: Alex Webster, head coach of the New York Giants since 1969, announced his resignation yesterday, effective after Sunday's final game against the Minnesota Vikings. Details, Page 67.

title: SqueezeOut on Oil Is Feared by India In Auction System
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 12  Indian officials fear that the auction system being introduced by oilproducing nations will auction out India from the oil market because affluent Western nations will be able to outbid her.

title: New Delay on Satellites
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Dec. 12 (UPI)The Air Force today ordered a second delay in the launching of twin military communications satellites. Officials said the launching: is now scheduled for 6:57 P.M. tomorrow. The delay will give scientists more time to cheek a faulty instrument in the rocket.

title: Skylab Corrects Position After Comet Photography
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)Small thrusting rockets on the Apollo ferry ship docked to Skylab's nose were fired for 16 seconds today to bring the spaceship back to the proper orbital course after the astronauts phtographed the Comet Kohoutek.

title: NIXON POPULARITY IS UP, POLL FINDS
description: After a year of steadily declining popularity ratings in the Gallup Poll, President Nixon has now shown an increase of 4 points. He has climbed from 27 to 31 per cent in approval of the way he is performing as President.

title: CAMBODIANS DRIVE TO OPEN RICE ROAD
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 12 (UPI)Heavy fighting was reported today northwest of Phnom Penh as Government troops sought to reopen a major highway to the city.

title: Must Christmas Feast Taste Like Thanksgiving Dinner?
description: The Book does not reveal the menu that was served at the inn in Bethlehem that Christmas Eve. That is perhaps just as well, for wherever the event is celebrated, women have applied their genius to produce the best fare that their countries can put on the table.

title: CIGARETTE CHARGE LAID TO MAN HERE
description: Two plainclothes police officers patrolling the streets of Little Italy in lower Manhattan in an unmarked car arrested a 25yearold man last night for driving a small truck without a license and found 4,500 cartons of untaxed cigarettes worth an estimated $23,000 in the vehicle, the police reported.

title: HOUSE PANEL VOTES EXTENSION FOR S.B.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) The House Subcommittee on Small Business agreed today to recommend a sixmonth extension in loanmaking authority for the Small Business Administration while a Congressional investigation of the agency continues.

title: Few at Nixon Rally
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 12 (AP) Sponsors say 75 persons showed up last night for a Support President Nixon rally at which preparations had been made for 1,500. The Republican County Central Committee had declined to sanction the rally because $10 was charged.

title: Dance: The Nutcracker
description: The New York City Ballet opened a run of 31 performances of The Nutcracker last night at the State Theater. It would have been the 615th time for George Balanchine's version of the Tchaikovsky classic to be seen here, had the company not gone on strike Nov. 13. Nonetheless, even with merely 607 Nutcracker performances in the last 19 years, somebody must be doing something right.

title: Grenade Thrown by Arab Wounds 8 on West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 12 (UPI) An Arab guerrilla threw a hand grenade into a crowd in Hebron, on the occupied West Bank of the Jordan River today, wounding eight persons, a military spokesman said.

title: Alex Webster Resigns
description: Alex Webster, head coach of the New York Giants since 1969, announced his resignation yesterday, effective after Sunday's final game against the Minnesota Vikings. Details, Page 67.

title: Cash's Gospel Road Film Is Renaissance for Him
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Dec. 12 Johnny Cash looks 10 years younger. He has lost the tension in his mouth, the burnedout look in his eyes that lasted after his selfdestrucfive decade. He is 41 years old and he bounces like an athlete when he walks.

title: Pro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: Rally by Flyers Ties Hawks, 2 to 2
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12 (AP)Secondperiod goals by Rick MacLeish and Gary Dornhoefer pulled the Philadelphia Flyers into a 22 tie with the Chicago Black Hawks tonight in a National Hockey League battle.

title: Advertising: Media Optimism
description: As the seminar on investment opportunities in the media and ad agencies moved into its second and final day yesterday, at the New York Hilton, the tenor of the speeches remained one of cautious optimism, The audience, however, was smaller.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange issued its latest report on changes in stockholdings by major shareholders, directors and officers in listed companies. Following are the changes reported:

title: WHITE HOUSE AIDS JAWORSKI INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Leon Jaworski, special prosecutor for the Watergate investigation, said today that the White House agreed to let his investigators search through its files in looking for information tied to the Watergate scandals.

title: Boom in Land Development Stirs Fears for Ecology of Florida Keys
description: KEY WEST, Fla.Almost every day some new dredging operation along the shoreline of the chain of islands that make up the Florida Keys sends a boiling cloud of silt seaward.

title: Perspective Is Retained By U.C.L.A.
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12And how does the University of California, Los Angeles, approach its much ballyhooed meeting with North Carolina State on a St. Louis basketball court this Saturday?

title: Premium Cuts May Be in Store for Car Owners
description: EDISON, Dec. 12Jerseyans who are cutting back on their daily driving due to the gasoline shortage may be entitled to reduced insurance premiums on their cars, according to the New Jersey Association of Independent Insurance Agents.

title: City Broadens Medicaid in Part of Bronx
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday an agreement with the Martin Luther King Health Center of the Bronx to provide, for the first time, a total range of prepaid health services under Medicaid.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As the temperature and the stock market drop, there is a lot of talk about raw material shortages.

title: Nancy Lewine Married to Robert Blank
description: Miss Nancy Lewine, daughter of Mrs. David E. Winer of New York and Jerome Lewine of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married here yesterday evening to Robert Saler Blank, a partner in the Whitcom Investment Company and son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Blank of Keystone Point, Fla., and Philadelphia.

title: Braves Bow To Celtics By 126119
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Dec. 12 (UPI)  Steve Kuberski scored 10 of his 12 points in the fourth quarter tonight to lead the Boston Celtics to a 126.119 victory over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Music: Tuba and Bassoon Step Forth
description: Two of what Sir Thomas Beecham once referred to as the drainage instruments of the orchestra, or if he didn't he should have, took solo roles at the Tuesday night concert of the National Orchestral Association in Carnegie Hall. It is seldom that the bassoon comes forward. It is next to never that the tuba takes a leading role. But here were two young players in the Bassoon Concerto by Mozart and the Tuba Concerto by Vaughan Williams.

title: Bicentennial Agency Vetoed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 12 (AP)A $2.5million Bicentennial Authority bill to prepare for 1976 celebrations was vetoed today by Gov. Francis W. Sargent. He cited constitutional problems of separation of powers in having a legislative agency distribute grants to cities and towns.

title: Ervin Says Justice Agency Should Be Independent Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. introduced a bill today to make the Justice Department an independent branch of the Government.

title: WOMAN CHAPLAIN SEES DIFFICULTY
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 12 (UPI)Capt. Lorraine Potter has met resistance as an ordained American Baptist Minister and, as the Air Force's first woman chaplain, she expects another rocky road.

title: Slowdowns Cripple British Rail Lines
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Rail service all over Britain was crippled today as 29,000 railroad engineers and firemen staged slowdowns over a wage dispute, and the Government reacted immediately by extending the national state of emergency for a second month.

title: Plan for Allocating Fuels Outlined by Energy Office
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Administration outlined today a tentative master plan for allocating scarce supplies of fuel this winter.

title: HONDA INTRODUCES LOWPOLLUTION CAR
description: TOKYO, Dec. 12 (Reuters)The Honda Motor Company unveiled today a new car powered by a lowpollution engine that uses compound vortex controlled combustion.

title: TAX PANEL PLANS COMPLETE REVIEW OP NIXON RETURNS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Congressional Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation decided today to look into every aspect of President Nixon's tax returns for the years of his Presidency, not just the two items that Mr. Nixon asked the committee to review.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Borrowing Planned to Save 35c Fare Pending U.S. Aid
description: City and state officials discussed a plan yesterday to save the city's 35cent transit fare by borrowing enough money to tide over the Transit Authority until Federal legislation to aid mass transit is passed.

title: Relief Overpayments Need Not Be Returned
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12 (AP)A state appeals court ruled today that country welfare boards that overpaid clients could not seek repayment of the funds.

title: Management of Giants Is Held Responsible
description: Mistakes in personnel evaluation and management operationrequisites for success in any competitive businessmay be more to blame for the dcline and fall of the New York Giants than the inefficiency of Coach Alex Webster.

title: Rockefeller to Keep 4 of His Top Aides
description: Four of Governor Rockefeller's top state aides will remain with him to work on the National Commission on Critical Choices for Americans and to form the nucleus of a Presidential campaign staff.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: London  Danny McAlinden, 193 pounds, England, knocked out Vern Macintosh, 182, Eustis, Fla., 10 rounds.

title: F.C.C. TURNS DOWN REQUEST BY A.T.&T.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission today turned down a request by the American Telephone & Telegraph Company to reconsider a 1971 decision opening the private line communications field to new competition.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12  Renewed efforts to force another delay of New Jersey's mandatory automobile exhaust inspections showed every sign here tonight of presenting Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne with his first major political confrontation with the Democratic legislative leaders he helped elect earlier this week.

title: Chess: A Pregnant Position Calls For Understanding the Cause
description: Games featuring subtle positional themes can sometimes have a harmful effect on the student. Filled with enthusiasm for the excellent working out of the play, he may not grasp the conditions that made it possible.

title: Cairo's Confidence in Kissinger Is Reported Seriously Shaken
description: CAIRO, Dec. 12Western diplomats said today that the confidence of Egyptian officials in the personal credibility of Secretary of State Kissinger had been badly shaken by a misunderstanding that developed during his last visit here a month

title: $15Million BlackOwned Building Opens in Harlem
description: A $15million building, believed to be the largest blackowned and operated office building in the country, offificially opened in Harlem last night at a dinner attended by more than 600 people, including Federal, state and city officials.

title: Italy's Leaders Urge Closer Ties With the Arabs
description: ROME, Dec. 12Italy's political leadership today called for closer relations with oilproducing countries.

title: Pell Moves in Congress To Void Cuba Resolution
