Exhausted after an all-day tantrum, Fa finally pokes his bottle-nose out of his tank and says, through his spiracle, in a tiny, plaintive sort of midget voice: "Fa wants Bi."Thereafter the film, which has quite charmingly followed the experiments with Fa and Bi, turns heavily to plot. Mysterious strangers appear at the research center to use Fa and Bi for their own evil purposes. The doctor ruminates about the meaning and morality of what he has wrought, while his wife, played by Trish Van Devere, tries to cheer him up.Some of the cloak-and-dagger stuff that follows is so awkwardly staged that it's difficult to know whether the simplicity was designed for youngsters or as parody.There are also times when the inter-species dialogues leave off being the dream of scientist and child come true and become the source of giggles. How can an actor like George C. Scott play a dramatic scene with a dolphin? No matter what he does, the dolphin is bound to untank him. Although the film is mostly played straight, in lovely, broad-horizoned seascapes, which, along with the dolphins, help reduce the actors to mere functions of the story, Mr. Nichols and Mr. Henry make their comic prances felt in a couple of key moments. One has to do with the film's climax and can't be reported.The other features that fine actress Elizabeth Wilson, in what is little more than a walk-on, as one of those executive secretaries who sees herself as the keeper of the flame. "You must excuse us," she says to a visitor who has been kept waiting for five hours, "but today was just one of those days." Says the visitor: "Which one?"

title: Small Gifts Add Up for Neediest
description: The axiom that it's the little things that count was amply illustrated by several of the smaller of the 192 individual contributions acknowledged yesterday by the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: SYRIAN AIDE TELLS OF VIEW ON TALKS
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 19 Syria is prepared to join the Geneva conference on a Middle East peace settlement whenever Israel shows that she is prepared to negotiate in good faith on the fundamental issues, a high Syrian Foreign Ministry official said today.

title: Trial of White House Aides In Ellsberg BreakIn Delayed
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19 (AP) The trial of John D. Ehrlichman and two other former White House aides in the breakin at the office of Dr. Daniel J. Ellsberg's psychiatrist was postponed today until April 15.

title: CARGILL BIDDING FOR CEMENT UNIT
description: Cargill, Inc., announced yesterday it was offering to buy any and all of the outstanding] common shares of the Missouri Portland Cement Company for a net $30 cash each.

title: Whitehead Is Resigning Telecommunications Post
description: Clay T. Whitehead, director of the White House Office of Telecommunications Policy from its inception in 1970, said yesterday that he would resign within two or three months and that he desired to leave Government service.

title: Leafs Beat Seals, 53, on Late Goals
description: TORONTO, Dec. 19 (UPI) Thirdperiod goals by Errol Thompson and Ron Ellis paced the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 53 victory over the California Golden Seals tonight in a game celebrating the 57th anniversary of the National Hockey League.

title: New Designs From Habitat's Architect
description: When his Habitat, a modular, systemsbuilt housing complex, was erected as part of Expo '67 in Montreal, Moshe Safdie was hailed as the architect who had found the answer to our urban housing problems.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Gerald A. Downs, Mayor of Cinaminson, was indicted by a Camden County grand jury on charges of assault and battery on a police officer and resisting arrest. The grand jury returned the indictment in connection with a Dec. 1972, scuffle that Mr. Downs reportedly had with a state trooper, Richard Humphreys. Trooper Humphreys told the grand jury he had stopped Mr. Downs on Route 76 in Mount Efram after seeing the car moving erratically. The trooper said that Mr. Downs had scuffled with him when he attempted to arrest him for drunken driving.

title: Device Converts Typewriters For Notation of Choreography
description: The recording on paper of dance and other highly nuanced body movements has been facilitated by a small, ballshaped typing element, which, when attached to an electric typewriter, permits the printing of Labanotation symbols, a widely used method of dance notation.

title: Kuwait Has No Plans Now to Try Five Arab Hijackers
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 19The Kuwaiti Government said today that it had no plans at the moment to bring to trial the five Arab hijackers of the Lufthansa jetliner that landed here last night.

title: Ruling Upholds City On BaseRent Plan; Further Appeal Due
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court ruled that the city must continue its controversial maximumbaserent program, which permits rent increases of up to 7.5 per cent a year in many rent controlled apartments.

title: About Trade
description: Discussions on EastWest trade cooperation have become more and more academic, as many U.S. corporations and banks have already made decisive moves toward expanding ties, and the yearly trade turnover between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R. has almost doubled every year in the last three years, bringing it to over $1.5 billion for 1973. But there is always a time lag between international developments and their ideological digestion.

title: Turkey's Inonu Has Seizure
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 19 (UPI)Ismet Inonu, the first Premier of modern Turkey and for 12 years President of the republic, has suffered a serious heart attack, his physician said today, Mr. Inonu is 90 years old.

title: Knicks Beaten, 107 to 105
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 19Coach Red Holzman was platooning his Knicks like a crazed football coach tonight, but all his lineup changes were not enough to overcome a damaging personalfoul situation that allowed the Atlanta Hawks to post a 107105 victory before a crowd of 7,308 at the Omni.

title: EXGOVERNOR TOOK TAX CUT ON PAPERS
description: LANSING, Mich., Dec. 19 (AP)  G. Mennen Williams says he claimed a major tax deduction when he gave papers on his 12 years as Michigan Governor to a university library.

title: Payments Balance Shows Strong Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 The dramatic improvement the United States balance payments continued in the third quarter, with the basic balance showing a surplus of $2.5billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: CITY U. BUDGET UP BY $99,bMILLION
description: The Board of Higher Education yesterday submitted a $628million operating budget for 197475, an increase of $99.5million over the current year.

title: Outgoing Yonkers Mayor Offers $225Million Waterfront Plan
description: A $225million plan to develop the Hudson River waterfront in Yonkers along the lines of the terraced cities of the Italian Riviera was disclosed yesterday by the administration of the outgoing Mayor, Alfred, B. Del Bello.

title: The New Torture
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19With Judge Maximum John Sirica being talked about as the likely Man of the Year for 1973, with law and order no longer denounced as code words for repression or racism, and with widespread approval of the way society finally moved to protect itself against crime of all sorts, only a spoilsport would complain that the rights of the accused are being stolen away.

title: PRESIDENT FREES EDUCATION FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19President Nixon released today $1.1billion in education and health money that he had been refusing to spend in a major dispute with Congress over the level of funding.

title: HANUKKAH IS TIED TO MIDEAST CRISIS
description: Hanukkah, the eightday Jew ish festival of lights, began at sundown yesterday with ceremonies that in many cases drew a parallel between the current Middle East situation and the ancient event that the holiday commemorates.

title: Briton Arrested in Soviet In Leningrad Hotel Fire
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19 (Reuters) A British tourist has been charged by the Soviet authorities in a recent Leningrad Hotel fire which at least one person died, British officials said today,

title: AL Poll Finds 90% Back Federal Curb On Use of Energy
description: Nearly 90 per cent of all Americans support the current restrictions on the use of energy favored by the Federal Government, and also four out of 10 people would like to see even stricter controls, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: ASSURANCES GIVEN ON ISRAELI P.O.W'S
description: PARIS, Dec. 19President Hafez alAssad of Syria told Secretary of State Kissinger in Damascus on Saturday that he could inform Israel that all Israeli prisoners held by Syria were being welltreated, a senior American official said today.

title: The Tax Tale Thickens
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19The financial information released by President Nixon has raised one especially puzzling question among tax specialists. It relates to his $576,000 gift of papers, allegedly made in March, 1969, and used thereafter as the basis for large tax deductions.

title: Delaware Bridge Toll to Rise
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 19 (AP)The Delaware River Port Authority voted today to increase commuter bridge tolls on the Benjamin Franklin and Walt Whitman Bridges to 40 cents and create a special 25cent carpool rate. The new toll schedule calls for retaining the (10cent rate for a singlevehicle crossing on both bridges and will take effect Jan. 1 if approved by United Slates Highway Administrator Norbert Tieman.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Dec. 19Attorney General Kingsley Cheney of Vermont said today he believed that any refusal by gasoline station operators to sell fuel to outofstaters was illegal. He said he had learned of isolated cases where skiers from other states were denied gasoline. Cheney said Vermont's Consurrfer Protection Law and Federal regulations specify equitable distribution of all petroleum products.

title: 68 in City Dwellings Seen Assuring Fuel for January
description: The regional administrator of, the Federal Energy Office said yesterday that if all owners of New York City apartment buildings kept temperatures at 68 degrees, no one would be without fuel during January.

title: $1Million Modernization Due At Bellevue's Big, New Center
description: The new 25story, $160million Bellevue Hospital Center, which formally opened only a month ago and began treating outpatients, yesterday solicited, bids for a $1million modernization of portions of the building that have yet to be used.

title: Pro Track Expanding, Signs Smith
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 19 An expanded schedule of meets, increased funds and new blood, including Steve Smith, the pole vaulter, are signs of growth for the International Track Association, which begins its second pro season on Feb. 15 at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Milk Data Sealed Over Playing of Tape
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19A Federal judge agreed today to restrict the public disclosure of documents in a suit against the Nixon Administration for alleged favors to the milk industry after a lawyer for Ralph Nader acknowledged that he had played a subpoenaed White House tape recording at a cocktail party.

title: Mideast Parley in Geneva Beginning to Take Shape
description: GENEVA, Dec. 19  The muchdelayed Middle East peace conference finally began Ito take shape here today with the arrival of the Egyptian and Soviet Foreign Ministers.

title: U.S. PLANS SHIFT IN BUYING DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The Department of Health, Education and Welfare is planning a new policy under which it will pay for drugs covered by Medicare and Medicaid only at the lowest price for which the drugs are generally available, Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger said today.

title: ABRAHAM KRASNE, 88, FOUNDED FOOD CHAIN
description: Abraham Krasne, who founded in 1915 the wholesale grocery business that is now Krasdale Foods, Inc., died yesterday at his home, 11 Sound Road in Rye, N. Y. He was 88 years old.

title: Ervin, 77, to Retire
description: Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, the 77yearold chairman of the Senate Watergate committee, announced yesterday that he would not run for reelection next year because of his age. Page 35.

title: Byrne Picks Hyland As Attorney General To Fight Corruption
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne today nominated William F. Hyland, a former chairman of the State Commission of Investigation, to be Attorney General in the Democratic administration taking office here next month.

title: American Civilian Is Freed by Vietcong
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 19 (UPI)The only known American prisoner of the Vietcong was freed at a remote hamlet in the Mekong Delta today, two and a half months after he was captured in a Communist ambush.

title: G.M., Ford Acquitted
description: The General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company were found not guilty of charges that they conspired to fix prices in sales to fleet buyers. Page 61.

title: BANKRUPT ROADS TO BE REVAMPED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19A HouseSenate conference committee agreed today on legislation to restructure bankrupt railroads east of the Mississippi under a new Government rail corporation.

title: Gov. Gilligan Picks Metzenbaum To Finish Saxbe's Senate Term
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 19Howard M. Metzenbaum, a 56yearold Cleveland lawyer and businessman, was named today by Gov. John J. Gilligan to succeed Attorney Generaldesignate William B. Saxbe in the United States Senate.

title: ERVIN, CITING AGE, TO RETIRE IN '74
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., the 77yearold legal scholar and raconteur who gained national prominence this year as chairman of the Senate Watergate investigating committee, announced today that he would not run for reelection next year.

title: SIRICA SUPPORTS NIXON ON 3 TAPES; BARS THEIR USE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Judge John J. Sirica sided with President Nixon today and ruled that nearly all of two of the tapes sought in the Watergate case and part of a third were covered by executive privilege and thus would not be turned over to the special Watergate prosecution.

title: Mrs. Mandel to Leave Governor's Mansion
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 19 (AP)Barbara Mandel said tonight that she had given up for her marriage and would leave the Maryland Governor's mansion,

title: Personal Finance
description: When the Internal Revenue Service gives a taxpayer two years' grace to protest some action that it takes, it means precisely thattwo years. Not an instant more.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jerseys daily lottery number yester day was:

title: Pentagon May Cut Jet Fuel Use To Help Airlines OverHolidays
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) The Pentagon, which has reduced training flights to conserve jet fuel, said tonight that it might make further reductions in its fuel consumption in order to divert some fuel to the airlines for the holiday period.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: RUSSIANS CHANGE SPACECRAFT ORBIT
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19The Soviet Union issued tonight a delayed announcement that its manned Soyuz 13 spacecraft had shifted into a new, more circular orbit, similar to that used in the past for linking up with other spacecraft.

title: Influential Gaullists Demanding Premier's Removal
description: PARIS, Dec. 19  A sudden political thunderstorm has broken in France, with open demands from influential Gaullists for the removal of Premier Pierre Messmer.

title: Laird Quits, Urges Speed On Impeachment Question
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Melvin R. Laird resigned today as President Nixon's chief domestic adviser and said that he believed the House of Representatives should vote no later than March 15 on the question of impeaching the President.

title: FINANCIAL OFFICER AT TIMES RESIGNS
description: Francis A. Cox resigned yesterday as vice president and chief financial officer of The New York Times Company.

title: ADMINISTRATION TO ALLOW OIL AND GAS PRICE RISES; ASKS PROFITLIMITING TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 The Nixon Administration set in motion today a general increase in oil and gasoline prices and proposed that Congress levy a novel windfall profits tax on oil producers.

title: MAYORS IN MATE MEET WITH SIMON
description: EAST BRUNSWICK TOWNSHIP, Dec. 19  William E. Simon, the Federal energy director, called on the New Jersey Conference of Mayors to spearhead a nationwide effort by chief executives of municipalities to spur public cooperation in meeting the energy crisis.

title: When the Christmas Presently Alive, It's Hard to Hide It Around the House
description: Birds, the pet store owner was saying, go chirp, chirp, chirp.

title: End to U.S. Curbs On Prices of Steel Urged by Makers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)  Several leading steel companies appealed to the Cost of Living Council today for an end to price controls in their industry. The council is holding hearings on the requests of 32 steel makers for price increases.

title: Soviet Routs Finland Six
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19 (AP)The Soviet Union emerged as the only unbeaten team in the Izvestia hockey tournament today after a 70 victory over Finland. Sweden upsets previously unbeaten Czechoslovakia, 42.

title: Notes on People
description: Ask a probing question of Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Prime Minister of Canada, and you may get a flip answer. Newsmen learned that after Mr. Trudeau submitted to the House of Commons some recommendations on conflict of interest as it applies to public servants. Asked about his own assets, Mr. Trudeau said, Why don't you just assume I'm rich. How rich? Let's say $100million, Mr. Trudeau replied, then amended that figure to about $200million. Then Mr. Trudeau summed up: Let's say I'm a hell of a rich man, and the laws I make should be watched closely.

title: People and Business
description: A transcontinental management shift at R. H. Macy & Co. confirmed yesterday problems with the New York operations of the giant retail concern.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Opportunities for direct action by consumers on many important issues are not that frequent; often an event has passed before individuals and groups can make their voices felt. Now, recent changes in hospital accreditation procedures provide a chance to be heard on the state of hospital care in your community.

title: Advertising: A Lord, Geller Deal
description: Just a bit after nine yesterday morning, Dick Lord arrived in the all but deserted offices of Lord, Geller, Federico, Peterson. He's the president there. He's also the creative director. His ensemble, all muted browns and beige, leaned toward the creative rather than the corporate. But, he was neat, very neat, since he'd be pitching a prospective client later in the day.

title: Columbia to Name Campbell Head Football Coach Today
description: Bill Campbell an assistant football coach and an outstanding recruiter at Boston College for the last six years, is expected to be named head football coach at Columbia University today. The 33yearold bachelor will return to his alma mater where he captained Columbia's only Ivy League champion football team in 1961.

title: Gambling Jury Cut in Half; Few See Issue as Crime
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 19 (AP) Only six jurorshalf the normal numberwill hear a gambling case in United States District Court here this week.

title: SenateHouse Conference Approves Foreign Aid Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today on a compromise foreign aid appropriations bill, whose funds would include $2.2billion in emery ency military aid for Israel and $200million for Cambodia.

title: PRENTISS BROWN, EXSENATOR, DIES
description: ST. IGNACE, Mich., Dec. 19 (AP)Prentiss M. Brown, a former United States Senator who was regarded as the father of the Mackinac Bridge connecting Michigan's two peninsulas, died, today of a heart attack at his home here. He was 84 years old.

title: EGYPTIANS SEEK 200MILLION LOAN
description: Egypt will sell $200million of longterm securities in the Eurobond market, most likely within the next six weeks, to raise the money to pay its share of the SueztoAlexandria oil pipeline on which work is scheduled to start next year.

title: TEACHERS' HEAD REFUSES TO QUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19David Selden, president of the American Federation of Teachers, refused today to bow to a demand by the union's executive council that he resign.

title: Rare Breed, A Spinoni, Shows Up
description: Spinoni Italiani is neither an ice cream nor a vintage wine. It's a big, squarely built long ears. If a rare breed in the United States means one or two, this is it. However, a Spinoni can be seen almost any day trotting with her mistress, Annieta Kumpfbeck, on the streets of Dix Hills, L. I. I named her Anatra del Bianco. Spino, said Miss Kumpfbeck. In Italian, it means Duck of White Spino [a diminutive for Spinoni]. Although I don't hunt, friends have taken her duck hunting and they said she's an excellent etriever. Since she's mostly white, with just a touch of orange, and a good duck hunter, I thought the name appropriate.

title: Pacers Beat Stars, 104 to 88
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 19 (AP)Indiana's George McGinnis tallied 15 of hs gamehighl total of 31 points in the first quarter tonight and the Pacers rode their lead to a 10488 victory over the Utah Stars.

title: LABOR MILITANTS PUT OFF IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Dec. 19A proposal by union militants to call an emergency congress of the labor movement to organize opposition to the Government was turned down today by the General Council of the Trades Union Congress.

title: Rabbis' Board Gives Beame Maccabean Service Award
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame was presented yesterday with the Maccabean Service Award, a plaque given annually by the New York Board of Rabbis to public servants who have manifested outstanding public service.

title: Byrne Asked to Aid Offshore Oil Port
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19Industry spokesmen urged today that Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne actively cooperate in the development of a deepwater oil port off New Jersey and in the drilling for oil and gas in the Atlantic undersea shelf.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A jury of seven men and five women was chosen in Federal Court yesterday to serve in the second trial of Joanne D. Chesimard and Fred Hilton on bankrobbery charges. Almost 60 persons were excused as prospective jurors before the 12 were selected. The first trial ended last Friday in a hung jury.

title: SIRICA SUPPORTS NIXON ON 3 TAPES; BARS THEIR USE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Judge John J. Sirica sided with President Nixon today and ruled that nearly all of two of the tapes sought in the Watergate case and part of a third were covered by executive privilege and thus would not be turned over to the special Watergate prosecution.

title: New U.S. Ambassador to Moscow Walter John Stoessel Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19For a short time when he was a student at Stanford University in the late nineteenthirties, Walter John Stoessel Jr. played polo and rode in what he termed the last cavalry R.O.T.C. unit.

title: Notes on People
description: Ask a probing question of Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Prime Minister of Canada, and you may get a flip answer. Newsmen learned that after Mr. Trudeau submitted to the House of Commons some recommendations on conflict of interest as it applies to public servants. Asked about his own assets, Mr. Trudeau said, Why don't you just assume I'm rich. How rich? Let's say $100million, Mr. Trudeau replied, then amended that figure to about $200million. Then Mr. Trudeau summed up: Let's say I'm a hell of a rich man, and the laws I make should be watched closely.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On the same day, in a recent Philadelphia paper, were the following headlines: DowJones in Greatest Decline Since 1972 and Earnings of Publishing Firm Enjoy Sharp Increase. The stock market decline that day was attributed to herd instinct, which implies a psychological or mood reaction to current negative news.

title: Nyquist Urges an Overhaul for School Elections
description: Ewald B. Nyquist, the State Education Commissioner, said yesterday that he favored a complete overhaul of election procedures for the community school boards here, including the establishment of an independent commission to handle the school elections.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 20, 1973

title: High School Sports
description: They play basketball in Westchester, don't they? The answer is yes, and they play it better at Mount Vernon and Gorton than they do almost anywhere else in the county.

title: Swidler of P.S.C. to Head State U. Policy Institute
description: The chairman of the State Public Service Commission, Joseph C. Swidler, was named yesterday by the State University of New York to head its new Institute of Policy Alternatives, a research arm that is expected to draw on the resources of the 72campus university.

title: Poet Says He Guessed Right on Blanks
description: CLARENCE, N. Y., Dec. 19 Henry Kautz is fairly patient and straightforward with pesky strangers who wonder how you score 291 out of a possible 300 on the state Regents examination.

title: Atlanta Seeking Sugarman For CityManager Position
description: The Mayorelect of Atlanta has discussed appointing Jule M. Sugarman, New York City's Human Resources Administrator, as Atlanta's chief administrative officera citymanager type of post scheduled to be strengthened next year.

title: Gift to the Nation
description: If the United States Government wants to know what the chief problem will be in maintaining San Clemente, President and Mrs. Nixon's proposed bequest to the American people, it can ask the National Trust for Historic Preservationand the answer will be money.

title: Hill of Jets, 11 Dolphins In Pro Bowl
description: Winston Hill, the Jets' offensive tackle, was the only player from the two New York teams named yesterday by league coaches to the conference allstar squads that will meet in the annual Pro Bowl game at Kansas City on Jan. 20.

title: The A Rating
description: The city has won its long fight to have its bonds upgraded to A status by both of the country's major creditrating agencies. That certification is a welcome counterweight to the pessimists who wrongly see New. York City in a state of decline. It also helps put in better perspective the warning by Mayorelect Beame's budget advisers that the city faces a $1.3billion deficit in its operating budget for the fiscal year opening next July 1.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PACE CHANGERS Contrast is the watchword up at the New York Cultural Center, 2 Columbus Circle (5812311), where two exhibitions are in contrapuntal display. On the fifth floor, and flowing over into a mezzanine is a splashy, funny, greatforkids Ruckus World of Red Grooms, looking like a takeoff on the sort of lavish Christmas display in the toy departments of the big stores.

title: Cut in U.S. and Soviet Arsenals Urged in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19  An authoritative Soviet journal has indicated that Moscow's proposal for a new strategic arms agreement with Washington calls for reductions in some parts of both countries' strategic arsenals.

title: A PREGNANCY TEST HAILED AT PARLEY
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 19  A new blood test capable of diagnosing pregnancy even before a menstrual period has been missed was described here today.

title: Uncertainties Unsettle Holiday Shopping in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE  Perhaps more than the energy crisis, uncertainty and dismay over recent political and economic problems appear to have hurt the public's buying attitude during the Christmas shopping season here.

title: State Police Unions Urge Ouster Of Kelly From the Pension Fund
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)Two state police unions said today that they had urged Governor Cahill to order the expulsion Of the State Police Superintendent, Col. David B. Kelly, from the pension fund!

title: Stoessel Is Confirmed As U.S. Envoy to Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)  The Senate today confirmed the nomination of Walter J. Stoessel Jr. to be United States Ambassador to the Soviet Union.

title: Steam Train Trip Planned
description: BELLOWS FALLS, Vt., Dec. 19 (AP)  A steam train is scheduled to travel across the state Dec. 29 with some 600 railroad buffs aboard.

title: Kuwait Has No Plans Now to Try Five Arab Hijackers
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 19The Kuwaiti Government said today that it had no plans at the moment to bring to trial the five Arab hijackers of the Lufthansa jetliner that landed here last night.

title: Annemarie Proell Takes 10th Cup Downhill in Row
description: ZELL AM SEE, Austria, Dec. 19 (AP)Annemarie Proell won her 10th straight World Cup downhill ski race, took over the lead in the cup standings and was named Austrian athlete of the year today.

title: WILSON DISCLOSES DETAILS OF INCOME
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19Governor Wilson dealt with the issue of political probity today by calling for tighter election campaign controls and by disclosing several details of his income.

title: JURY HERE TOED OF TICKETFIXING
description: Norman A. Levy, former president of the City Tax Commission, ran a night court for political favorites in an apartment in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn to get their parking tickets fixed, an anticorruption state prosecutor charged yesterday.

title: CELLO DEBUT MADE BY VALTER DESPALJ
description: Valter Despalj, a 26yearold Yugoslav cellist who has studied here (with Leonard Rose at Juilliard) and in Moscow (with Galina Kozolupova at the Moscow Conservatory), made his New York debut at Carnegie, Recital Hall on Tuesday night in the Carnegie HallJeunesses Musicales series.

title: A WILDCAT STRIKE IN DETROIT ENDED
description: DETROIT, Dec. 19 (AP)  An agreement was reached to end a wildcat warehouse strike that had touched off heavy grocery shopping in the Detroit area, the food industry negotiating team said today.

title: Chess: Let the Offbeat Punishment Fit the Antipositional Crime
description: Alexander Alekhine, world champion from his victory over Jose Raul Capablanca in 1927 until his defeat by Max Euwe in 1935 and again from his victorious rematch with Euwe in 1937 until his death in 1946, expressed his romantic approach not only by his extraordinarily dazzling speculative attacking play, but also by his novel theoretical pronouncements.

title: Byrne Picks Hyland as Attorney General
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19  Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne today nominated William F. Hyland, a former chairman of the State Commission of Investigation, to be Attorney General in the Democratic administration taking office here next month.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Music
description: Newell Jenkins, music director of Clarion Concerts, has a passion for resurrecting the works of secondary composers that results in a roulette game for the listener: Some turn out to be winners, others are losers. His program on Tuesday night in Tully Hall fortunately turned up a winner.

title: Nixon's Reelection Panel Dies, But Finance Unit Is Remaining
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)The Committee for the ReElection of the President has gone out of existence without public notice, but its finance committee, which hat,died an estimated $60million in campaign funds, was still in operation today.

title: Market Defers Action on Plan By U.S. to Meet Energy Crisis
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 19The European Common Market, because, of its many internal problems, has deferred serious consideration of an American proposal for international collaboration to resolve the energy crisis. But the idea may become a major issue in the new year.

title: CONGRESS MOVES ON PENSION RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 With Congress pushing to adjourn by this weekend, the chairmen of the fiscal committees of the Senate and the House of Representatives agreed today to try to salvage an 11 per cent increase in Social Security benefits for 29 million retired Americans.

title: For Horses, Florida Trip Is Scratched
description: Nobody can say New York's racehorses aren't doing their part to conserve heating oil. Warmed by blankets, sunlamps and the equine equivalent of hot oatmeal, hundreds of thoroughbreds are digging in for a heatless winter at Belmont Park. With local flatracing action ending on Dec. 29 and resuming on Feb. 25, Belmont's stable area is being kept open for training purposes. About 1,000 horses are expected to spend the winter there in unheated stalls.

title: Campisi's $750,000 Bail Restored by High Court
description: TRENTON Dec. 19  The State Supreme Court today reinstated $750,000 bail for member of the Campisi family who has been indicted, along with seven relatives, on charges of committing five murders and more than 100 armed robberies.

title: The Senate Confirms Stern as U.S. Judge
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern, who gained a reputation by prosecuting corrupt public officials, was confirmed today by the Senate as a Federal judge.

title: Study Finds Americans Exposed To Excessive Monoxide Levels
description: A nationwide study of 29,000 blood donors by a team of Wisconsin researchers has led to the conclusion that Americans are regularly exposed to the potential dangers of excessive amounts of carbon monoxide.

title: Gas Stations Will Be Asked To Limit. Sale to 10 Gallons
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The Nixon Administration will announce tomorrow that gasoline stations will be asked to limit sales to 10 gallons.

title: EARNINGS RESULTS AT AIRLINES MIXED
description: American Airlines and Trans World Airlines showed improved results in November, according to their reports yesterday. At the same time, Eastern Air Lines plunged further into the red and National Airlines, which operates on a fiscalyear basis, showed slightly lower earnings for November.

title: Study Finds Americans Exposed To Excessive Monoxide Levels
description: A nationwide study of 29,000 blood donors by a team of Wisconsin researchers has led to the conclusion that Americans are regularly exposed to the potential dangers of excessive amounts of carbon monoxide.

title: Bengals, Grown Up at 6, Tackling Big Boys Now
description: Of the four teams in this weekend's American Conference playoffs, the Oakland Raiders are the most familiar with postseason play, the Miami Dolphins have been the most dominant and the Pittsburgh Steelers became the most exciting with their miracle finish last season. Then there are the Cincinnati Bengals.

title: Transit Tax Bill Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  Representative Jonathan B. Bingham, Democrat of the Bronx, said today that he had introduced legislation to allow masstransit riders to deduct up to $800 a year in commuting expenses from their taxes. Under the proposal, the masstransit rider could either take a tax credit of up to $200 a year or deduct the actual commuting expenses up to $800 annually.

title: Energy and Government
description: For most of our history, a plentiful supply of energy is something the American people have taken very much for granted. In the past twenty years alone, we have been able to double our consumption of energy without exhausting the supply. But the assumption that sufficient energy will always be readily available has been brought sharply into question within the last year.

title: Books of The Times
description: NICKEL MOUNTAIN. By John Gardner. 312 pages. Illustrated by Thomas O'Donohue. Knopf. $6.95.

title: At Least 9 Die Near London As Commuter Train Crashes
description: LONDON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)At least nine people were killed and 53 were injured when a commuter train crashed on the western outskirts of London tonight and four of the packed cars overturned.

title: Net Working Capital Rose At Corporations in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)The net working capital of United States corporations rose $4.1billion in the third quarter, the Securities and Exchange commission reported.

title: G.M., Ford Acquitted
description: The General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company were found not guilty of charges that they conspired to fix prices in sales to fleet buyers. Page 61.

title: PRESIDENT FREES EDUCATION FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19President Nixon released today $1.1billion in education and health money that he had been refusing to spend in a major dispute with Congress over the level of funding.

title: Guessed Right, A Young Poet Explains
description: CLARENCE, N. Y., Dec. 19 Henry Kautz is fairly patient and straightforward with pesky strangers who wonder how you score 291 out of a possible 300 on the state Regents examination.

title: A Trying Year
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 19The Texas Railroad Commission continued today for January the 100 per cent oil producing rate with expectations that actual production would be in the range of 3,450,000 barrels a day. Purchasers would like to get 4,131,810 barrels a day.

title: Shaheen Natural Resources Plans Ireland Oil Refinery
description: CORK, Ireland, Dec, 19 (AP) Shaheen Natural Resources, Inc., said today it planned to build a $225million oil refinery and petrochemical complex at Bantry on the Atlantic in southwest Ireland.

title: Wilson, Urging Political Probity, Details His Income
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19Governor Wilson dealt with the issues of political probity today by calling for tighter election campaign controls and by disclosing several details of his income.

title: Caso and Ribicoff Ask U. S. To Assist Stormnit Areas
description: Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff of Connecticut and County Executive Ralph G. Caso of Nassau appealed yesterday to President Nixon for emergency action to help ease the impact of the ice storm that has spread hazard and hardship through the tristate region.

title: FUMES DESTROY A CHURCH ON S.I.
description: A fivealarm fire engulfed the 76yearold Church of St. Joachim and St. Anne in a childcare compound on southern Staten Island early yesterday, destroying all but the granite and brick walls and 150  foot steeple.

title: Bomb Hits U.S. Agencies
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Dec. 19 (UPI)  A firebomb exploded early today in a Santa Cruz building that housed the Selective Service Board, the Internal Revenue Service and military recruiters.

title: Theater: Three Sisters
description: The beautiful agony of Chekhov's The Three Sisters, with all its humors and sighs, arrived at the Billy Rose Theater last night at the opening of a Christmas repertory season by the City Center Acting Company.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BERNARDSVILLE, Dec, 19Ed Mather is his name and crosscountry is his game as rivals of Bernards High School have learned over the past 10 years.

title: Cochran to Resign As U.S. Ski Coach
description: DENVER, Dec. 19. (AP)Mickey Cochran, head coach for the United States Ski Association's Alpine team, confirmed today he would resign the post following the 1974 International Ski Federation championships.

title: Bankruptcy Act Petition Is Filed by ParkviewGem
description: ParkviewGem, Inc., a discount department store chain, filed a petition yesterday in the United States District Court in Kansas City, under Chapter X of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. The company asked the court to appoint a trustee to reorganize the company owing to its inability to pay its debts as they mature.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Jones Heads Black AllAmericans
description: Even though there was more than the filet mignon for a coach to drool over when the 1973 black college allAmerica team was announced yesterday, Charley Winner of the Jets could relax and concentrate on his food.

title: Japanese Stir Anger in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 9  The giant neon signs atop Jakarta's new skyscrapers that used to beam Sanyo and Toyota and other Japanese messages into the Indonesian night have recently fallen dark, and it has nothing to do with any energy crisis, for there is no such crisis in oilrich Indonesia.

title: Gas Stations to Be Asked To Cut Sales to 10 Gallons
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The Nixon Administration will announce tomorrow that it will ask service stations to limit gasoline sales to 10 gallons a customer per purchase.

title: Ervin, 77, to Retire
description: Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, the 77yearold chairman of the Senate Watergate committee, announced yesterday that he would not run for reelection next year because of his age. Page 35.

title: 9 UTILITIES PLAN LARGE FUEL CELL
description: Nine major electric utilities and the Pratt & Whitney Aircraft division of the United Aircraft Corporation have embarked on a $42million program to develop a largescale fuel cell to generate electric power.

title: SHARES ON AMEX LOWER AT CLOSE
Small Gifts Add Up for Neediest
description: The axiom that it's the little things that count was amply illustrated by several of the smaller of the 192 individual contributions acknowledged yesterday by the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Beame Names Lawyer as Parks Chief
description: Mayor  elect Abraham D Beame yesterday appointed a new Administrator of Parks Recreation and Cultural Affairs who said he would demand that any museum receiving money from the city make detailed financial reports.

title: ADMINISTRATION TO ALLOW OIL AND GAS PRICE RISES; ASKS PROFITLIMITING TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 The Nixon Administration set in motion today a general increase in oil and gasoline prices and proposed that Congress levy a novel windfall profits tax on oil producers.

title: Transit Tax Bill Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  Representative Jonathan B. Bingham, Democrat of the Bronx, said today that he had introduced legislation to allow masstransit riders to deduct up to $800. a year in commuting expenses from their taxes. Under the proposal, the masstransit rider could either take a tax credit of up to $200 a year or deduct the actual commuting expenses up to $800 annually.

title: 109 Survive Delhi Air Crash
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Dec. 19 (AP)  A Lufthansa Boeing 707 jetliner crashed and burned today while landing at New Delhi airport, but the 109 persons aboard escaped, an airline spokesman announced. He said that 10 persons had been injured slightly and that the aircraft had been destroyed by fire.

title: SAMUEL D. DORN
description: Samuel D. Dorn, who in 1948 founded the Dorn Manufacturing Company, manufacturer of damps, and had been its president since then, died in Lenox, Hill Hospital yesterday. He was 75 years old and lived at 1050 Fifth Avenue.

title: New Bonds Given a Good Reception
description: New offerings in the corporate and taxexempt bond markets were generally well received yesterday in otherwise rather lackluster trading activity.

title: Maybe Your Life Is Puzzling Enough
description: During a visit to friends a year ago, Frank Bara began to doodle with their electric jigsaw. The result? An ingenious, if elementary, jigsaw puzzle that, when assembled a half hour later, spelled Mary, the first name of his hostess.

title: Xavier Is Dropping Varsity Football
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 19 (UPI) Xavier University officials announced tonight the school was dropping intercollegiate football because of the spiraling costs.

title: GROUP HEALTH BILL SENT TO PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) The Senate sent to President Nixon tonight a $375million bill designed to encourage group health plans.

title: Mrs. Wilson Plans Some Changes
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19Governor and Mrs, Wilson will give hack to former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller as soon as possible the dozens of pieces of modern painting and sculpture from his collection with which he had turned the Executive Mansion virtually into a modern art museum during his administration.

title: 2,300 THAIS CHOOSE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 19 (AP)  Nearly 2,300 Thais voted today to elect 299 of their number to a new national assembly.

title: COLOR TV PRICE RISE ANNOUNCED IN JAPAN
description: The Matshushita Electric Industrial Company, pointing in part to the oil crisis, disclosed in Japan yesterday that it would raise prices of color television sets by an average of 13 per cent and washing machines by an average of 20 per cent, both effective Jan. 1. Other Japanese appliance makers are expected to take similar action.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Rep. Melcher Is Said to Violate Rule by Leasing Federal Land
description: HELENA, Mont., Dec. 19 (AP)  Representative John Melcher, Montana Democrat who heads the House Subcommittee on Public Lands, apparently violated Federal regulations by leasing 90 acres of land from the Government, The Great Falls Tribune said yesterday.

title: ORGANIZED CRIME LINKED TO DRUGS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19  Witnesses at a hearing on hard drugs today linked organized crime to lucrative heroin and cocaine traffic in northern New Jersey and New York City.

title: In the Soviet Union, Some Are Attracted to Fashion and Some Are Worried By It
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19Soviet authorities have turned to shock tactics to curb the rising tide of interest in mod fashions, especially among Soviet young people.

title: Rebozo Explains Reason For Taking Hughes Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Charles G. Rebozo, President Nixon's friend, said in a television interview today that he had taken $100,000 from agents of Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire industrialist, because he didn't want it to get mixed up or lost.

title: Lindsay Urges City to Build On Labor Record He Set
description: Mayor Lindsay, in a speech yesterday reviewing his record in labor relations, said that it was important for the city to continue to build on the foundation he had established and to keep labor relations out of the back room.

title: F.B.I. Names Official
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 19 (UPI) William A, Sullivan, special agent in charge of the Philadelphia Federal Bureau of Investigation office, will be promoted to assistant director of the bureau and put in command of the Los Angeles office, the F.B.I. announced yesterday.

title: WILLIAM GREENE JR.
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19  Judge William Sherman Greene Jr., general counsel for United World Films in New York from 1945 to 1965, died Monday at the Boston University Medical Center. His age was 72 and he lived at Deer Isle, Me.

title: Few Arab Terrorists Are Punished for Hijackings and Killings
description: Although most Arab terrorists responsible for hijackings, kidnappings and the seizure and execution of hostages over the last few years have been captured or have given themselves up, few have suffered meaningful punishment. Following, in chronological order, is the eventual fateas best can be determinedof Arab terrorists who preceded those who surrendered Tuesday in Kuwait.

title: Indoor Soccer Put Off
description: Lagging ticket sales have forced the indefinite postponement of the professional indoor offthewall soccer tournament. The event, involving eight pro teams from the metropolitan area, was to have been played in Madison Square Garden on Saturday.

title: ACQUITTAL IS WON BY G.M. AND FORD
description: DETROIT, Dec. 19 (AP)A Federal jury found the General Motors Coporation and the Ford Motor Company today not guilty of criminal antitrust charges.

title: Brake for Mr. Whitlam
description: For Gough Whitlam, Australia's first Labor Prime Minister in twentythree years, there can be no doubt about it his Government, he is convinced, has been one of the most productive and constructive in Australian history. In closing the 1973 session of Parliament and his first year in office, Mr. Whitlam reported that the Government had passed 203 bills by keeping the House of Representatives sitting for 908 hours, a fiftyyear record.

title: Boyle Ordered to Enter Prison Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Despite a doctor's opinion that he is critically ill, W. A. Boyle. the deposed former president of the United Mine Workers of America, was ordered to Federal prison today for a threeyear term.

title: Opera: Manon Lescaut
description: Puccini's youthful and everattractive Manon Lescaut returned to the Metropolitan Opera on Tuesday night after an absence of some five years. This always has been one of the Metropolitan's nicer productionsmodest yet evocative, tasteful and smoothly directed.

title: 9 Communist Parties End Moscow Talks
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 19  Ranking ideological specialists from nine countries Communist parties today concluded a private meeting that signaled a more coordinated counterattack to Western pressures for freer human contacts and a freer flow of people and ideas as part of EastWest accommodation.

title: Exam Seemed Easy, Senior Recalls
description: MASSAPEQUA PARK, L. I., Dec. 19Susan Zwanger cannot hide the heredity. It radiates from her father, a doctor, and her mother, a lawyer.

title: Lanier Helps Pistons Beat Bulls, 8987
description: DETROIT, Dec. 19 (AP)Bob Lanier scored 30 points and the Detroit Pistons held off a secondhalf Chicago rally tonight in scoring an 8987 National Basketball Association triumph over the Bulls.

title: Exam Seemed Easy, Senior Recalls
description: MASSAPEQUA PARK, L. I., Dec. 19Susan Zwanger cannot hide the heredity. It radiates from her father, a doctor, and her mother, a lawyer.

title: It Wasn't an Authentic CassouletBut Then What Is?
description: The late Jimmy Cannon observed in a Christmas column, reprinted by The Village Voice last week, that reporters work on holidays, and celebrate them when and if they can. He would not have found it incongruous that one newsman's family ate Christmas dinner or rather the first of four Christmas dinners it will have eaten this yearon Dec. 7.

title: Two Killed in Lebanese City
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 19Shooting incidents erupted in the Lebanese city of Tripoli yesterday and today, leaving one soldier and one policeman dead and two eivilians seriousily wounded.

title: Brigde: Popular Bridge Expert Here, Bill Root, Moves to Florida
description: New York said farewell to its most popular bridge expert last week when Bill Root moved to Boca Raton, Fla. For the last 16 years he has taught thousands of bridge players of all levels in the metropolitan area, delivering lectures with style and wit while looking down on his students from a height of 6 feet 8 inches.

title: Pennsy Reassures Stockholders Of Outlook Under Federal Plan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 19 (AP)  A Penn Central Company lawyer voiced optimism today that the concern's stockholders would not be forgotten under a Federal plan to reorganize the Penn Central and five other bankrupt railroads.

title: Rodino Picks Republican For Impeachment Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)  Representative Peter W. Rodino, Democrat of New Jersey, chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, said today that he had selected a man with a Republican background as special counsel to head the panel's consideration of impeachment proceedings against President Nixon.

title: First Liquidation Payments On I.O.S. Seen in 6 Months
description: LUXEMBOURG, Dec. 19 (Reuters)The first liquidation payments on four main mutual funds of the Investors Overseas Services group could be within six months, Albert Dondelinger, Luxembourg's banking commissioner, said today.

title: People in Sports: Majors of Pitt Is Coach of the Year
description: Johnny Majors, who turned the Pitt Panthers into a respectable and exciting football team this season after a 110 wonlost mark a year ago, reaped his reward yesterday. He was named coach of the year by the Football Writers Association of America. The 38yearold Majors won by a close margin from Barry Switzer, Oklahoma's firstyear coach, 151130.

title: Tokyo Plans Novel Projects for Garbage Disposal
description: TOKYO, Dec. 19A giant incinerator disguised as a 60story skyscraper, the tallest building in Japan. A vast garbage dump turned into a children's playground. A swimming pool and a home for the aged heated by burning refuse.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)  The Senate completed Congressional action today on legislation to create a Federal financing bank to coordinate all direct Government borrowing in the private markets and sent the to Preisdent Nixon for his signature.

title: Witnesses Link Organized Crime and Drugs
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19  Witnesses at a hearing on hard drugs today linked organized, crime to lucrative heroin and cocaine traffic in northern New Jersey and New York City.

title: City Cautions Skaters Ponds Are Still Unsafe
description: The Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administration yesterday warned skaters not to skate on the city's ponds and lakes because the ice still was not thick enough. The agency said about a week of belowfreezing temperatures was needed to build up enough iceabout six inchesfor skating.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CARNIVAL Carnival time is a riotous interlude in springtime Brazil, but the spirit of noisy musical abandon is warming things up currently at the wintertime Top of the Village Gate, Bleecker and Thompson Streets (GR 55120). The source of this Carioca gaiety is a whitebearded Santa Claus of a musician named Sivuca, a Brazilian who plays guitar, accordion, piano and various Brazilian thingamabobs and leads an ensemble of five lively music makers.

title: 28 ARE INDICTED BY FEDERAL JURY IN RACING FIXES
description: Three of the nation's four top moneywinning harness drivers were among 28 persons indicted by Federal authorities yesterday on charges of fixing superfecta races at Roosevelt and Yonkers Raceways.

title: NORTHROP IS SUING CANADA OVER PLANE
description: The Northrop Corporation said in Los Angeles yesterday that it had filed suit against the Canadian Government for more than $17.5million in damages and payments in connection with the CF5 aircraft built in Canada under license from Northrop.

title: The Pop Life
description: Christmas in the record world simply isn't what it used to be. Time was when the disk companies, the music publishers, the singers and the song writers all got together and produced the Christmas records that would be smash sellers during the six or sevenweek preholiday period.

title: Ted Crosby Is Dead at 73; Was Entertainer's Brother
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Dec, 20 (AP)E. J. (Ted) Crosby, brother..of Bing Crosby, died in a Spokane hospital yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: ALLEGED HIT MAN KILLED IN BROOKLYN
description: A man accused as an underworld hit man was shot to death today in a hallway of the apartment building where he lived in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn.

title: Aggressive Rangers Defeat Wings, 52
description: The New York Rangers combined 45 shots on goal, a dozen or so crunching body checks and fundamental hockey last night to overpower the Detroit Red Wings, 52, at Madison Square Garden. To the delight of their fans, the Rangers played alertly to wipe out the awful impression they had made Sunday night, when they took a 6.1 battering from the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 21, 1973

title: Alistair Cooke's America Is a Gold Mine
description: The power of television, and perhaps the indirect influence of the Watergate scandals, have helped to make Alistair Cooke's America the No. 1 nonfiction bestseller, a number of book industry executives have concluded.

title: Knicks' LineUp
description: TVCHANNEL 9, 8 P.M.

title: League Ruling Bars YankWilliams Pact
description: Joe Cronin, the president of the American League, made two rulings yesterday that left the New York Yankees without a manager for 1974 and, in effect, increased pressure on them to pay whatever Charles O. Finley of the Oakland A's required to release Dick Williams.

title: Ice Assault on Trees in State Causes Millions Damage
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Dec. 20Heavy accumulation of ice have caused extensive damage to trees throughout New Jersey, particularly in the shore and southern regions, where the losses are apparently running into the millions of dollars.

title: Nixon Will Name Godley As Ambassador to Beirut
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (UPI) President Nixon said today that he would nominate G. McMurtrie Godley, former Ambassador to Laos, to be the United States Ambassador to Lebanon.

title: Associated Press Acts to Block Shift In A.T.&T. Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (AP)  The Associated Press moved today to block a tariff revision sought by the, American Telephone and Telegraph Company. The news service said that the proposal would discriminate against the press and would significantly impair the widespread dissemination of news.

title: Denver Put To Rout by Irish Five
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 20 (UPI)Adrian Dantley, a freshman, scored 21 points tonight in pacing Notre Dame to an easy 9959 victory over Denver University, the Irish used reserves for the last 11 minutes of the basketball game.

title: Jersey Turnpike Accidents Halved at Reduced Speed
description: There were only half as many accidents on the New Jersey Turnpike in November. when slower speed restrictions went into effect, as in October.

title: Firestone Recalls Tires
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 20 (AP) Firestone Tire & Rubber Co. has recalled 240 smalltrack tires, size 8.7616,5, built at its Memphis plant, it announced today. Firestone said that the tires had been made with 16inch diameter bead rings, instead of rings of 16.5 inches, and could not be inflated properly.

title: Simon Asks SelfRationing by Motorists
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20William E. Simon, the Federal energy chief, asked American motorists today to practice do ityourself gasoline rationing so the mandatory variety will not be necessary.

title: Connally Asks State To Construct Road Leading to Ranch
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 20 (AP)Former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally and two partners want the state to build a road to Lake Amistad that would open their ranch for real estate development.

title: Escaped Robber Seized
description: DALLAS, Dec. 20 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced today the arrest of an escaped bank robber and kidnapper, Barbara Lynn Cochran. J. Gordon Shanklin, agent in charge of the Dallas F.B.I., said Miss Cochran, 26 years old, who escaped from the California Institute for Women at Frontera, was apprehended without incident at a northeast Dallas residence.

title: Mideast Parley Begins Today; Early Accord Is Held Unlikely
description: GENEVA, Dec 20Israel and the Arabs open a conference here tomorrow designed to bring peace to the Middle East after four wars and 25 years of hostility.

title: JACOB ZUKERMAN, 66, FAMILY COURT JUDGE
description: Judge Jacob T. Zukerman of the Family Court, a prominent figure in Jewish labor union circles, died Wednesday at his home, 815 Avenue J, Brooklyn. He was 66 years old.

title: MOSCOW TO HONOR WESTERN OIL DEAL
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 20The Soviet Union today pledged to fulfill commitments to deliver oil and natural gas to Western countries but ruled out production increases to compensate for the fuel crisis.

title: 2 AIRLINES AGREE TO SWAP ROUTES
description: American Airlines and Pan American World Airways announced agreement yesterday, subject to Government approval, on the most farreaching exchange of routes ever proposed.

title: 182 Groups Proposed by H.E.W. For Monitoring of Medical Care
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20The quality of medical care given Medicare and Medicaid patients would he monitored by professional groups in 182 geographica1 areas covering the entire United States under a proposal published today by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Dr. Sigmund Wilens Dies; Columbia Pathologist, 68
description: Dr. Sigmund L. Wilens, professor of pathology at the College of Physicians and Surgeons, Columbia University, died yesterday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. His age was 68, and he lived at 100 Haven Avenue.

title: John J. Kenny and 2 Others Acquitted
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 20 (UPI) John J. Kenny, a former Hudson County Freeholder and Democratic leader, was acquitted along with two codefendants today of conspiracy to use county park land for a private garbage dump.

title: A Rights Bill for Homosexuals Rejected Again in City Council
description: In an unexpected turnabout, a City Council committee yesterday rejected in closed session a controversial bill to ban discrimination against homosexuals in housing, employment and public accommodations.

title: Conference on Peace
description: Israel and the Arab states today begin the task of negotiation, of finding a way together to terminate the hostility of a generation past. Not for a quarter of a centurythe entire history of modern Israel's existence have the belligerents of the Middle East entered upon a solemn and direct encounter such as is now about to open in Geneva.

title: EBB IS QUERIED ON CAMPAIGN ROLE
description: MIAMI, Dec. 20President Nixon's close friend, C. G. Rebozo, arrived in a driving rainstorm this afternoon to answer questions about political donations to the President's 1972 campaign.

title: Accountant Says a Tax Ruling Saved Nixon More Than $10,000
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 President Nixon's accountant said today that a ruling by the Treasury Department on the treatment of Mr. Nixon's annual $50,000 expense account had the apparently unintended effect of saving the President taxes during his first four years in office.

title: Finley Not Sure He'd Trade Williams
description: Charles O. Finley, elated over the good news, said yesterday he was proud of Joe Cronin for ruling that Dick Williams still belongs to Oakland. He also said he was no longer sure whether he would accept any compensation from the Yankees for his manager.

title: When Food Is Pedestrian, $4.12 Is a Lot for a Lunch
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quglity in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparableestablishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: DRUG INQUIRY ASKS POLICE BE AIDED
description: TRENTON, Dec. 20  The State Commission of Investigation said today that it had found an urgent need for improved law enforcement tools if traffic in hard drugs in the state were to be curtailed significantly.

title: Dire Prognosis Spurs St. Louis
description: ST. LOUISAn old story of this region tells of a boy who took a shortcut across a graveyard one dark night and fell into a freshly dug grave.

title: Public Relations Man Is Named Special Assistant to Governor
description: Governor Wilson yesterday named L. Richard Guylay, a public relations specialist for the Eisenhower, Goldwater and early Nixon campaigns, as his special assistant for policy planning.

title: Coal Men Hedge Hopes on Output
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20Top executives of the American coal industry said today that their mines could produce 50 million more tons of fuel for electricgenerating plants during 1974 than was earlier estiinated, freeing for other uses millions of barrels of oil now burned by the electric utilities.

title: 2 Lotteries Postpone Drawings Until Today
description: The New York State weekly lottery drawing scheduled for yesterday was postponed until today because of the beginning of the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah, a lottery spokesman said.

title: NI.T.A. HAILS PUN ON SUNDAY RIDING
description: There were spectacular increases in ridership on the subway system, city buses and the Long Island Rail Road during last Sunday's tworidesforthepriceofone experiment, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority reported yesterday.

title: Vatican Would Enliven Children's Mass
description: ROME, Dec. 20New guidelines for children's masses, issued by the Vatican today, establish that the central rite of the Roman Catholic faith may be shortened and enlivened with special songs, gesturing and pictures when celebrated for congregations made up mainly of preadolescents.

title: Hawley Rides Two More Winners
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 20  Sandy Hawley, the holder of the world racewinning record, ran his total number of victories for 1973 to 507 today when he brought home two winners at Laurel Race Course.

title: Greek Synod Accepts Archbishop's Resignation
description: ATHENS, Dec. 20 (AP)The resignation of Archbishop Ieronymos of Greece has been unanimously accepted by the Greek Orthodox Church's ruling Holy Synod, a church spokesman said today.

title: Squires' Game Is Off: Spurs Can't Suit Up
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 20 (AP)  The scheduled Amencan Basketball Association game between San Antonio and the Virginia Squires was postponed tonight because none of the Spurs' equipment arrived.

title: Joseph Rosentover Is Dead; Led Minor Football Leagues
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Dec. 20 (AP) Joseph Rosentover, who helped to form and served as Commissioner of the original American Football Association, the nation's oldest professional football minor league, died'yesterday at Passaic General Hospital. His age was 70.

title: Analyst Is Hoping to Extend Streak
description: Bud Goode, the noted sports computer analyst from Los Angeles who picked all seven of the National Football League's playoff games correctly last season including the point margin in the Super Bowl game, got his head together yesterday and made his decisions for this year. Working with the CalComp Corporation's computer in Anaheim, Calif., Goode chose the Redskins over the Vikings and the aRiders over the Steelers in tomorrow's games and the Dolhpins over the Bengals and the Rams over the Cowboys in Sunday's contests.

title: People in Sports: Thomas Sued by Chargers
description: Duane Thomas, a Washington Redskin running back, has been sued for $12,264 by the San Diego Chargers, who charged that the controversial star borrowed that amount from them between Oct. 27, 1972, and July 25, 1973, while he was with the club, agreeing to repay them out of his salary.

title: Fair Weather Railroad
description: At the moment when the public is being urged to abandon private cars for public transport, the Long Island Rail Road has put on one of its most impressive displays of incompetence in a long and bumbling history. While no one would fault the line for some delays in the winter's first storm last Monday, the chaotic breakdown of the L.I.R.R. would have been excessive for a railroad in a tropical jungle coping with its first blizzard.

title: Let's TestRun the Veep
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20Vice President Gerald Ford has conducted himself since his nomination and confirmation with dignity and amiable good sense, but he is not being given the sort of assignments that would prepare him for the Presidency.

title: Postal Motorization Is Said to Save Fuel
description: Neither snow, nor rain, nor heat, nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds  except if they run out of gas.

title: Stage: Candide Returns in Triumph
description: There are musicals that are it smash hits, musicals that are successes, musicals that are all manner of failure right down to abject and beyond, and musicals that are legends. Leonard Bernstein's Candide was a legend. Now the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklynit lives most vigorously in a handsome attic at the Brooklyn Academy of Musichas made the legend a reality.

title: Corporations' Pretax Net Seen Virtually Unchanged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (Reuters)The pretax book profits of United States corporations held virtually unchanged in the third quarter at a seasonally badjusted annual rate of $129billion, according to revised estimates published today by the Commerce Department.

title: Atlantic Richfield Gas Find
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 20 (UPI) The Atlantic Richfield Company has brought in a gas discovery well in the British water of the North Sea six miles northeast of the Leman Bank field. It flowed at calculated daily rate of 60 million cubic feet.

title: Westinghouse Sees Profit Problems
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation warned its stockholders yesterday that several persistent problems would cause lower earnings for 1973. The statement was issued after the close of trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Gen. Raffaele Cadorna, Led Italian Volunteers for Allies
description: ROME, Dec. 20Gen. Raffaele Cadorna, who commanded Italian volunteer troops fighting at the side of the Allied forces during the last stage of World War II, died today of a heart attack at his home in Pallanza in northwestern Italy, He was 84 years old and had been in the Army Reserve since 1947.

title: Man Shoots Up Top of the Park
description: A calmlooking man walked into the restaurant on the top floor of the Gulf & Western Building before it opened yesterday morning, asked the manager for a drink and then, for no apparent reason, began firing shots at the bar and at a large picture window overlooking Central Park.

title: 2 Lotteries Postpone Drawings Until Today
description: The New York State weekly lottery drawing scheduled for yesterday was postponed until today because of the beginning of the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah, a lottery spokesman said.

title: Kissinger and Tho Meet
description: Secretary of State Kissinger and Le Duc Tho, the North Vietnamese chief negotiator, met for four and a half hours in Paris yesterday. They exchanged complaints about the ineffective Vietnam ceasefire and agreed to keep in touch for possible meetings. Page 3.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Dec. 20Bill Raftery's cigar was annoying, but his smile, jokes and encouraging words about his Seton Hall basketball team were refreshing. Naturally he was happy with Chris Rzonca's selection by the New Jersey college basketball writers as the university player of the week, but more than that he was happy with the victory over San Francisco.

title: The Energy Squeeze: Either/Or
description: ESSEX, Conn.Unless drastic steps are taken soon the present chaos of the petroleum industry will bring our economy to a halt and, will ultimately erode the economic basis of our society. The following actions by the U.S. Government are, I believe, essential:

title: OFFICER ACQUITTED IN MARIJUANA TRIAL
description: A Brooklyn police officer was found not guilty yesterday of selling marijuana to a fellow policeman. The jury in State Supreme Court in Manhattan deliberated only an hour.

title: Ohio Woman, 115, Dies
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio, Dec. 20 (UPI)Mrs. Mary Silver, 115, believed to be the oldest per son in Ohio, died Wednesday at a daughter's home. Mrs. Silver founded the Little Zion Holiness Church here in the early nineteen hundreds and was honored at the Governor's Conference on Aging in Columbus as the oldest person in the state in 1969.

title: Two Holiday Meals
description: Below are menus suggested for a Hanukkah meal and the traditional French midnight supper served on Christmas Eve after mass. The Christmas pie, incidentally, is FrenchCanadian. Those dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Bobby Darin, Pop Singer, Dies at 37
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 20 (AP) Bobby Darin, whose combination of brashness, good looks and talent made him one of the nation's leading singers of popular songs, died today at the age of 37, the victim of heart ailments that had shadowed much of his life.

title: Alcoa Sets Stock Split
description: Directors of the Aluminum Company of America voted yesterday a threefortwo split of Alcoa's common stock to be distributed on Feb. 1, 1974, to holders of record Dec. 31, 1973.

title: Oldest Californian, 115, Dies.
description: PASO ROBLES Calif., Dec. 20 (UPI)Mike Cordova, California's, oldest native son, died last night at the age of 115. Born in 1858 at the Mission Assitencia in Santa Margarita, Mr. Cordova served as a guide for mission padres and spoke Indian dialects. Most of his life he was a vaquero, or cowboy,. in the Salinas Valley. Four years ago his home in Santa Marga ago was moved to the city park as a historic shrine.

title: Airline Pilots Cancel Holiday Strike Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (Reuters)United States airline pilots decided today not to strike over Christmas after receiving Nixon Administration asurances that increased supplies of aviation fuel were forthcoming.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Lawmaker Faces Charge of Assault On Airport Officer
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (AP)  Representative William V. Alexander Jr., Democrat of Arkansas, was arrested at National Airport today on charges of assault after what he described as a runin with an officer directing traffic.

title: Bruins Top Penguins on 4Goal Rally
description: BOSTON, Dec. 20 (UPI)The Boston Bruins, held scoreless for half the game by Jim Rutherford, the Penguin goalie, broke loose for four goals within four minutes in the second period and beat Pittsburgh, 65, tonight.

title: H.E.W. STUDY FINDS WELFARE ERRORS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20More than 30 per cent of families receiving cash assistance under the program providing aid to families with dependent children were ineligible or overpaid, according to a study made public today by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: SIHANOUK REPORTS INSURGENT SUPPORT
description: Prince Norodom Sihanouk the expatriate Cambodian lead er, contends that the insurgen movement in Cambodia ha affirmed to me energetically its confidence, its affection even, and insisted that I remai?? the uncontested leader of anti?? imperialist Cambodia.

title: American Motors Raises Prices on '74 Small Cars
description: DETROIT, Dec. 20 (UPI)The American Motors Corporation announced today specific retail prices increases, averaging $119, on its 1974 compact and subcompact cars.

title: Monsanto Held Up by 5
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 20 (AP)  Five armed holdup men escaped with an estimated $10,000 early today after striking a Monsanto Company, payroll supervisor with a night stick and disabling several employes with a spray chemical. The police said there were few clues in the 1:30 A.M. holdup at the Monsanto facility here.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: 2 City Aides Convicted in TicketFixing
description: Two city officials charged with scheming to fix 2,000 parking tickets for friends and political cronies were convicted last night on htree charges by a jury of 11 men and one woman in Brooklyn Supreme Court.

title: Nuptials Held for Coral Vange And William W. Scranton 3d
description: DALTON, Pa., Dec. 20Miss Coral Beverly Vange, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard W. Vange of Seoul, South Korea, was married here this afternoon to WitLiam Worthington Scranton 3d, son of William Worthington Scranton, former Governor of Pennsylvania, and Mrs. Scranton of Dalton.

title: Commodity Price Index Fell 2.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials slipped to 205.4 from 207.8 last week.

title: John J. Kenny and 2 Others Acquitted in ParkLand Case
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 20 (UPI) John J. Kenny, a former Hudson County Freeholder and Democratic leader, was acquitted along with two codefendants today of conspiracy to use county park land for a private garbage dump.

title: U.N. Refugee Commissioner Makes New Appeal on Chile
description: GENEVA, Dec. 20 (Reuters)  The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, made a new appeal today for nations to accept refugees from Chile.

title: Stack Prices on Amex Hit Lowest Level for Year
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange slipped yesterday to their lowest level for this year. However, prices in overthecounter trading advanced slightly.

title: Esprit de Postal Corp.
description: Is it possible that Manhattan's falering postal service would be imroved by a Christmas present from he Postal Corporation to itself? It would arrive long after Christmas, of course, but we're all used to that. The pesent would simply be a change of ??cene for Post Office personnel, and ??t might work wondersit did once before.

title: The Cathedral School To Admit Girls in Fall
description: The Cathedral School, a private elementary school that has admitted boys only since its founding in 1901, will become coeducational next September, according to Bishop Paul Moore, the school's board chairman.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: N.B.C. Sues F.C.C. on Fairness Issue
description: In what is considered a test case on the right of broadcasters to engage in investigative journalism, the National Broadcasting Company has gone to court to appeal a decision of the Federal Communications Commission that a documentary expos on private pension plans last fall was in violation of the F.C.C.'s fairness doetrine.

title: Kissinger and Tho Meet
description: Secretary of State Kissinger and Le Duc Tho, the North Vietnamese chief negotiator, met for four and a half hours In Paris yesterday. They exchanged complaints about the ineffective Vietnam ceasefire and agreed to keep in touch for possible meetings. Page 3.

title: SPAIN'S PREMIER IS KILLED AS ASSASSINS BOMB AUTO; APPARENT HEIR TO FRANCO
description: MADRID, Dec. 20Premier Luis Carrero Blanco, who was governing Spain in the name of the aging chief of state, Francisco Franco, was assassinated this morning.

title: 2 AIRLINES AGREE TO SWAP ROUTES
description: American Airlines and Pan American World Airways announced agreement yesterday, subject to Government approval, on the most farreaching exchange of routes ever proposed.

title: Close Call for Dibley at Tasmania Net
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Dec. 20 (AP)Colin Dibley of Australia won a secondset tiebreaker, 86, and held on today to beat John Feaver of Britain, 57, 76, 64, in the Tasmanian tennis tournament.

title: Cobalt Peril Halts Traffic
description: STROUDSBURG, Pa., Dec. 20 (AP)A truck hauling radioactive cobalt split open after it was sideswiped by two other tricks on an icy highway today, but officials said there was no danger of contaminaItion. The police halted traffic for a 20mile stretch, on Interstate 80 as a precautionary move.

title: G.M. IS RECALLING 843,000 VEHICLES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 20The General Motors Corporation announced today the recall of 843,000 of its automobiles and trucks of the 1974 model year because a key part of the suspension could work loose and cause tires to squeal and the steering to pull to the right or left.

title: 2 in J.D.L. Are Arrested At Egypt's Mission Here
description: Two members of the militant Jewish Defense League were arrested yesterday as they demonstrated at the Egyptian Mission to the United Nations at 36 East 67th Street, the Federal Bureau of Investigation announced.
