description: BOSTON, Dec. 23  How many Americans have remembered, at this seavon, what our country was doing at Christmas a year ago? We were carrying out the heaviest conventional bomytng campaign in the history of mankind, the B52 raids on Hanoi and Haiphong.

title: VICTOR REYNOLDS, 68, LED CORNELL PRESS
description: HANOVER, N. H., Dec. 23Victor G. F. Reynolds, formerly manager of the Cornell University Press, director of the University Press of Virginia and founding director of the University Press of New England, died yesterday at his home here. His age was 68.

title: The Mideast
description: In Washington, American officials said that they expected fairly rapid progress in talks between Egypt and Israel on separating their forces along the Suez Canal. Page 3.

title: Donald Birnbaum Weds judy Harelick
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Dec. 23  Miss Judy Ellen Harelick, a member of the faculty of the Wilson Elementary School here, and Donald Howard Birnbaum, an assistant district attorney in the Bronx and deputy chief of the Indictment Bureau, were married here today. The ceremony was performed in Temple B'nai Sholom, by Rabbi George B. Lieberman of the Central Synagogue.

title: State Warns Banks On Discrimination
description: The New York State Superintendent of Banks has sent a letter to all statechartered lending institutions warning them against discriminating against women in granting loans.

title: Desjardins Excels
description: UNIONDALE, LI., Dec. 23 Watching an IslanderCanadien hockey game, said a Nassau Coliseum observer tonight, is I like watching a Rocky Marciano fight: You sit back and wait for the knockout punch.

title: More Than a Mouthful
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 22 (AP)The public address announcer at the Jan, 19 Sunkist indoor track meet will have fun with the name of a Finnish distance runner who will make his American debut: Reino Paukkonen of the Jyvaskylan Kenttaurheilijat club.

title: SHORTAGES LEAD TO BLACK MARKET
description: The existence of a black market for materials in short supply was cited by business economists in a survey made by the National Association of Business Economists.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City's Controllerelect, Harrison J. Goldin, has been preceding with characteristic caution but promises changes down the road as he prepares to assume the most complex, unromantic and second most powerful job in the city.

title: OIL PRICE DOUBLED BY BIG PRODUCERS ON PERSIAN GULF
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 23A sharp increase in the price of Persian Gulf crude oil effective Jan. 1 was announced here today.

title: GEORGE E. MOEHRINGER
description: George E. Moehringer, who etired in 1971 as assistant general counsel of the Necs York State Labor Relations Board, died Saturday in Point. Pleasant (N.J.) Hospital of a heart attack. He was 67 years old and lived at 906A Dumbarton Drive, Lakewood, N. J.

title: OIL PRICE DOUBLED BY BIG PRODUCERS ON PERSIAN GULF
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 23A sharp increase in the price of Persian Gulf crude oil effective Jan. 1 was announced here today.

title: MISS NEELEY GIVES PIANO RECITAL HERE
description: It happens occasionally that a musician of considerable professional experience gives a performance that seems inconsistent with his or her reputation. That was the case with Marilyn Neeley, the pianist who gave a recital at Tully Hall on Wednesday night.

title: Lisbeth Fenton Marries Here
description: Miss Lisbeth Fenton and Robert S. Grossman, seniors at the University of Wisconsin, were married last evening at the St. Regis Roof by Lawrence Schwartz, rabbi emertus of the Jewish Community Center of White Plains.

title: Buenos Aires Power Failures
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 23 (AP) A brush fire that has been ravaging hundreds of square miles southwest of Buenos Aires caused power failures here today lasting up to three hours, officials reported. But the city's routine was not seriously affected.

title: Miss Evert, U.S. Lose To Aussies
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 23 (AP)Evonne Goolagong, a former Wimbledon champion, defeated Chris Evert, of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., 64, 63, today. Her triumph triggered an Australian sweep of three matches and gave them a 6.3 victory over the United States in the Bonne Bell Cup tennis competition.

title: Ens. Malcolm Poole Weds Ruth Wiggins
description: DEDHAM, Mass., Dec. 23  In the First Church Unitarian here this afternoon, Miss Ruth Baldwin Wiggins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Wesley Wiggins Jr., was married to Ens. Malcolm Frederic Poole, U.S.C.G., who is stationed at Governor's Island, New York. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Parker Poole Jr. of Portland, Me. The Rev. Jan Vickory Knost performed the ceremony.

title: Robin Lewinstein Is Wed
description: NORTH WOODMERE, L.I., Dec. 23In Temple OhrTorah here this afternoon Miss Robin Lewinstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Emanuel Lewinstein of North Woodmere and West Palm Beach, Fla., was married to Dr. Jack Leventhal, son of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert H. Leventhal of Brighton, Mass. Rabbi Theodore Jungreis performed the ceremony. The bride teaches children with learning disabilities in the Sacramento (Calif.) school system. Dr. Leventhal is a resident in internal medicine at the Sacramento Medical Center.

title: Learning to Cope on Half the Income
description: BLUE POINT, L. I.Richard (Rick) Croasdale and his wife, Jayne, had a good life.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DANCE Benjamin Britten's composition, A Ceremony of Carols is his musical setting of a number of medieval English carols, with the words still in the original Middle English. A Ceremony of Carols is almost always sung, but today it will not only be voiced but also danced.

title: Pilots Grounded by Layoffs Find a Jobless Life Hard
description: Jay Johnson of East Brunswick; N. J., who until recently looked forward to earning $60,000 a year by the time he was 45, applied for a job paying $2.20 an hour at a New Jersey lumberyard the other day, and was turned down.

title: Vatican Asks Troubled Priests Not to Abandon Their Ministry
description: ROME, Dec. 23The Vatican is urging Roman Catholic priests all over the world to remain in their ministry even though they may feel frustrated or are morally errant.

title: Economic Ills in Europe Stirring Fears of Portuguese Workers
description: LISBON, Dec. 19There are joyful family reunions at the Lisbon international airport and the main railroad station these days as thousands of Portuguese emigrant workers return from their jobs in France, West Germany and other Western European countries to spend the holidays.

title: Half Fares Lure Thousands to Manhattan
description: Sunny weather, reduced fares and the holiday season brought many thousands into Manhattan yesterday from the other boroughs and the suburbs.

description: WASHBURN, Me., Dec. 231 (AP)About 25 families were evacuated from their homes today when a sixmilelong ice jam caused flooding along the Aroostook River.

title: Foreman Hit With a Legal Jab Of $375,000 by Associates
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (AP)George Foreman's legal troubles have mounted with the filing of a $375,000 Federal court motion against the world heavyweight boxing champion.

title: STOCKHOLDER SUIT DUE AGAINST SIGNAL
description: A group of shareholders in the Signal Companies, Inc., will file suit today seeking to enjoin management from selling the company's oil and gas properties to the Burmah Oil Company, Ltd., of Britain.

title: OHIO POLICE FIND STOLEN PAINTING
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 23 (UPI) A stolen Rembrandt masterpiece was found under a country house early today, and more than half of the $100,000 ransom paid for it was recovered by the police.

title: Milling 200,000 Fill 5th Ave. Mall
description: The Fifth Avenue holiday mall, canceled for two Sundays by bad weather, looked in yesterday's sunshine like three Sundays rolled into one.

description: A holiday quiet is expected in the bond markets this week.

description: Oil industry spokesmen in this country did not seem surprised at the doubling of prices for Persian Gulf oil that was announced yesterday in Teheran, Iran.

title: Goldin Prepares for Controller's Job With Caution and Promises of Changes
description: In a suite of offices at Lexington Avenue, still cluttered with bullhorns, mimeograph machines and other memIorabilia from a victorious campaign, the desk of Controllerelect Harrison J. Goldin is covered with tiny yellow slips of paper.

title: RALPH H. FOX, 60 A MATHEMATICIAN
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 23Dr. Ralph H. Fox, professor of mathematics at Princeton University and a specialist in topology, died this morning in the University of Pennsylvania Graduate Hospital. He was 60 years old.

title: Her PrimitiveStyle Portraits Record All the Minute Details
description: Clearly, the party was about to begin.

title: Janice Himmel Is Bride
description: Miss Janice Faye Himmel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Himmel, was married here today to Seth Martin Black, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter B. Black. Both families are of Flushing, Queens. The ceremony at Temple Gates of Prayer in Flushing was performed by Rabbis Samuel Shaffler and Shalon Himmel, uncle of the bride. The bride is a prekindergarten teacher at Alphabetland in Jamaica, Queens. The bridegroom is doing graduate work at St. John's College. His father is vice president of the specialproducts division of Willcox & Gibbs, Inc.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec, 23You don't know how good it feels to have your mother paying attention to what you're doing, said Phil, Sellers. Always before she'd feed me and put clothes on me and say, go on, because she had five more to look after. I used to show her newspaper clippings of how good I was doing but she didn't understand what it meant. But now she understands what I can do for us, for the family. It's something I've got to do.

title: St. John's, a Sleeper Hit in New Haven, Awakens Holiday Festival Mood
description: On Nov. 30, Jacksonville, ranked 13th, and St. John's, unranked, were paired in the first round of the Clemson Tipoff tournament. St. John's won, 6964.

title: Miss Rattner Is Bride Here Of Peter Roth
description: Miss Andrea Rattner was married here last evening to Peter Alan Roth, general manager of The Proposition, an off Broadway improvisational troupe. Rabbi Andrew J. Robins performed the ceremony at the St. Moritz.

title: Marilyn R. Swist Connecticut Bride
description: WOODBRIDGE, Conn., Dec. 23Miss Marilyn R. Swist and Philip M. Isaacs, both of New York, were married here this morning at the Oak Lane Country Club. The bride's brother, the Rev. Martin S. Swist, of the Silent Temple of Peace (Universal Church) in Fairfield, performed the ceremony.

title: Court Openings: Bonus for Wilson
description: Presiding Judge Harold A. Stevens of the Appellate Division in Manhattan has been a strong contender for appointment to the state's highest court, the Court of Appeals, but he has been reluctant to leave his present post and spend considerable time in Albany, according to both Democratic and Republican sources. Governor Wilson reportedly is ready to appoint Judge Stevens, who is a Democrat and who would be the first black the Court of Appeals.

title: A Year Later in Managua: New Christmas Season Dawns on Rubble of the Last
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua Those are the Christmas lights of a year ago that hang forlorn and unlit on a twisted string across the side of the 15story Banco Central, miraculously still standing but too shattered for occupancy.

title: On the Winding Road to Jerusalem
description: WASHINGTON  David BenGurion died recently, during the very struggle which he foresaw in March, 1957 as Premier of Israel. With foresight, BenGurion believed in 1957 that the indefinite assurances and the vague compromise which formed the basis for Israel's withdrawal from the Sinai Peninsula at the end of the 1956 war would produce future conflict and still other wars.

title: LongTime Contributors Aid Neediest
description: Charity is an elusive thing and so are the motives of those who practice it.

title: Chicago's Council Passes Head Tax Proposed by Daley
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23The Chicago City Council approved Friday an employer expense tax that will require most large businesses here to pay the city $3 a month for each of their employes.

title: Energy Office Establishes 24Hour Inquiry Service
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  The Federal Energy Office has set up 24hour telephone systems in Washington and its 10 regional offices to handle public inquiries about the Administration's fuel allocation program.

title: About New York
description: A man and his daughter walked up Fifth Avenue yesterday, and thought of Christmas in their separate ways. This was to be the daughter's 11th Christmas, and while the man had no very clear recollection of her first one, he remembered the second one quite well. That was the time she had been stuffed into a blue snowsuit and big red boots, and he had carried her out and stood her up in the snow. She had looked at him reproachfully for just a moment and then, unable to move a step, she had toppled gracefully into the snow.

title: SAMUEL HILLMAN
description: Samuel Hillman, who retired a year ago as advertising room foreman of The New York Times composing room, died yesterday in the Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Big Six Towers, Woodside, Queens.

title: But Let the Potato Chips Fall Where They May
description: Hon. Leon Jaworski,

title: A Jetliner Crashes In Moroccan Hills, Killing 106 Aboard
description: TANGIER, Morocco, Dec. 23 A chartered airliner carrying 106 persons, many of them Moroccans going home for the holidays, crashed in the Rif mountains near the Mediterranean coast, airport officials said today.

title: Fundamentalists View Christmas Comet as a Sign
description: The comet Kohoutek, which promises to provide a holiday spectacle, has taken on special significance in conservative religious circles.

title: Meat Supply Is Viewed As Adequate for Winter
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23The nation's supply of beef, pork and poultry was still abundant last week, and if Government allocations of truck fuel are effective, market analysts believe that these supplies will remain adequate throughout the winter.

title: Woman Educator Resigns
description: BOSTON, Dec. 23 (AP) Dorothy Marshall, vice chancellor at the University of MassachusettsBoston, has resigned her post to resume teaching after a dispute with Chancellor Carlo Golino. She had been the highest ranking woman in the state university system.

title: Rupp Home From Hospital
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 23 (AP)Adolph Rupp, former University of Kentucky basketball coach, returned to his Lexington home today, after his release from an Orlando, Fla. hospital. Rupp, 72 years old, underwent surgery for al perforated ulcer at the hospital Dec. 14. Rupp's wife, Esther, said doctors ordered Rupp to remain in bed for a while.

title: Directions at Geneva
description: GENEVA, Dec. 23Although they both opened with intensive behindthescenes diplomacy and a fuss about tables, the Middle East peace negotiations that have just begun here are bound to be profoundly different from the Vietnam conference, which ended with an ineffectual ceasefire after more than four years of talks.

title: 12 Killed, 9 Hurt as Limousine Is Hit by Stolen Auto in Chase
description: While the case books of abnormal psychology abound with examples of pedophiliacs, many of whom escape detection for years, there are comparatively few instances in which this aberration is combined with murder.

title: E.R. BOSSANGE JR.
description: DALLAS, Dec. 23 (AP)E. R. Bossange Jr., senior vice president of Braniff International, died today at University Hospital in Madison, Wis. He was 57 years old.

title: Screen: That Man Bolt
description: It hasn't been much of a year for Jim Brown. First O. J. Simpson bettered his National Football League rushing record. And nowjudging by That Man Bolt, which opened last week at the DeMilleFred Williamson is expanding his inroads on Mr. Brown's hegemony over the black action genre that has become one of the giltedge Bonds of cinema in the seventies.

title: Michael Stroukoff Dead; Aircraft Designer Was 90
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 23 (AP)  Michael Stroukoff, an aircraft designer, died yesterday in St. Francis Hospital, Trenton. He was 90 years old.

title: Personal Finance: Investor Hedge in Broker Failure
description: When a brokerage firm as substantial as Weis Securities, Inc., goes under, the shock wave is so strong that small investors everywhere suddenly begin to question the strength of their own investment broker.

title: Father of Van'Arsdales Dies
description: GREENWOOD, Ind., Dec. 23 (UPI)Raymond Van Arsdale, father of the twin National Basketball Association stars Torn and Dick Van Arsdale, died yesterday in a hospital near here. He was 72 years old and lived here. Mr. Van Arsdale, who was retired, had been a highschool teacher and track coach. His twin sons played together at Indiana University. Tom plays for the Philadelphia Seventysixers, and Dick for the Phoenty Suns.

title: Hospitals in Sweden Cathedrals of Care
description: The corridors are spacious and quiet. You might see an employe whizzing along one marked Cardiology Street on a threewheeled scooter, stopping perhaps to remove a chart from a file, then going on to shop in a supermarket or cash a check in a hank in the lobby.

title: Flames 3, Rangers By JOHN S. RADOSTA
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 23The Atlanta Flames, who delight in cutting the Rangers down to size, made up a onegoal deficit tonight and humbled the New Yorkers, 31.

title: Revised Theory on Comets Offered
description: When the comet Kohoutek whips around the sun next Friday, the close approach to that star may tear the comet into fragments and vaporize parts of its possibly frozen core, making it a more spectacular sight in the weeks to come.

title: Suzanne Fogelson Bride of John Golden
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Dec. 23Miss Suzanne Fogelson, a counselor on the faculty of the City University of New York, and John Alan Golden, a lawyer with the New York firm of Hughes Rubbard & Reed, were married here today in Temple B'nai Abraham by Rabbi Joachim Prinz.

title: Ford Skis on Colorado Vacation
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 23 (UPI) Vice President Ford put Christmas wreath on the front door of his condominium here and went skiing today.

title: Miss Bonnie L. SingerBride of Hans Weltin
description: HEWLETT, L.I. Dec. 23 Miss Bonnie Lynn Singer, daughter of Mi. and Mrs. Myron Singer of Hewlett, was married here today to Hans Weltin, son of Dr. Eva Weltin of Wilmington, Del., and Dr. Erhart Weltin of Vienna. The noon ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents by Rabbi Martin Siegel.

title: Board of Falconry Named by State
description: The State Department of Environmental Conservation announced the appointment yesterday of a Falconry Advisory Board to draft regulations for the ancient sport.

title: Pupil Shows Teacher How It's Done
description: MIAMI, Dec. 23In 1930 when Paul Brown was teacher in Severn Prep near Annapolis instructing young Americans in their native tongue, he moonlighted as assistant football coach and thus discovered his mission in life. That same year Don Shula was born in Grand River, Ohio, a large, pink baby with a prominent chin. In 1946 when Brown made his first mark on professional football as coach of Cleveland in the AllAmerica Conference, Shula was a 16yearold high school student in Painesville, Ohio, and five years later Shula was a defensive back for Brown in Cleveland. This sunny, summery afternoon, master and pupil came to face to face on the ersatz grass of the Orange Bowl. They shook hands solemnly.

title: Spain at a Crossroads
description: If Generalissimo Franco had been able to attend the funeral for Spain's murdered Premier Carrero Blanco, he would have witnessed the incredible spectacle of an ultrarightist mob shouting Assassin! at the Cardinal Archbishop of Madrid. This dramatic evidence of the accelerating polarization of Spain provides one measure of the formidable task Admiral Carrero's successor will have in maintaining political stability and a semblance of national unity, especially after General Franco's departure.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following Is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Washington Palace
description: They're changing guard at Washington PalaceChristopher Robin went down with Alice. Nursery fables have wearied the two. Washington stories are better than Pooh!

description: ACROSS

title: NEW HEART TESTS FOR SKYLAB CREW SEEK VITAL DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 The Skylab 3 astronauts, preparing for a busy holiday week in their orbiting laboratory, are engaged in a study to determine the effects of prolonged space flight on the human heart.

title: U.S. Aides Expect Disengagement Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Senior American officials said today that they expected fairly rapid progress in talks between Egypt and Israel in Geneva on separating their forces along the Suez Canalwith an agreement possible by the end of next month or early February.

title: Vermont Ski Areas Plan to Provide Gas
description: MOUNT SNOW, Vt., Dec. 23  Well aware that the energy crisis can lead to much red ink in their accounts if they don't take action, ski area operators in this southern Green Mountain country are meeting the problem headon. The operators are concerned chiefly with the reluctance of skiers to drive here without assurances that they will have fuel enough to drive home in time for their Monday morning responsibilities. The sticky issue, of course, is President Nixon's request for closing of gasoline stations Saturday night and Sunday.

Her triumph triggered an Australian sweep of three matches and gave them a 63 victory over the United States in the Bonne Bell Cup tennis competition.

description: Presiding Judge. Harold A. Stevens of the Appellate Division in Manhattan has been a strong contender for appointment to the state's highest court, the Court of Appeals, but he has been reluctant to leave his present post and spend considerable time in Albany, according to both Democratic and Republican sources. description: TEHRAN, Iran, Dec. 23 (AP)Following is the text of the communiqud issued by oil ministers Sunday:

title: Advertising: Spirit of Christmas
description: 'Tis the day before Christmas and the gnomes of adland, having labored long and hard to move the merchandise off Santa's shelves, are taking the day off and doing whatever it is that nonworking gnomes do. From here on out it's up to Dancer, Prancer and the rest of the distribution team to deliver the goods.

Leventhal of Brighton, Mass. Rabbi Theodore Jungreis performed the ceremony. The bride teaches children with learning disabilities in the Sacramento (Calif.) school system. Dr. Leventhal is a resident in internal medicine at the Sacramento Medical Center.

title: Thais Back Credits In Northrop Airport; Resentment Stirred
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 23  The Government of Thailand has made an important concession to the Northrop Airport Development Corporation of a controversial, new $100million airport for Bangkok.

title: A Shepherd
description: The host of heaven and the angel of the Lord had filled the sky with radiance. Now the glory of God was gone and the shepherds and the sheep stood under dim starlight. The men were shaken by the wonders they had seen and heard and, like the animals, they huddled close.

description: Phi Beta Kappa has awarded prizes of $2,500 each to the authors of three books published in 197273 that represent what it considers significant contributions to learning in humanistic scholarship.

description: TRENTON, Dec. 23  New Jersey's new no fault automobileinsurance law seems to be fulfilling expectations.

title: 45 Truce Violations in Day, U.N. Reports
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23  Egyptian and Israeli troops clashed intermittently for seven hours south of the Suez Canal in a day that saw 45 violations of the ceasefire, the United Nations reported today.

title: Miss Rattner Is Bride Here Of Peter Roth

title: Fuller Resignation Follows Year of Unrest at Fairleigh
description: RUTHERFORD, Dec. 23A year of unrest at Fairleigh Dickinson University, New Jersey's largest private university, reached a climax over the weekend with the resignation of its president, Dr. J. Osborn Fuller. Dr. Fuller charged that faculty members had created an adversary climate.

title: Hell Up in Harlem Tracks Crime Czar
description: Hell Up in Harlem has the right title as a slaughter pileup, with Fred Williamson as the superduper black Caesar of the underworld. He finally adds the most corrupt man in town, a fictional District Attorney of New York County, to his personal pyramid of corpses. The D. A, gets his, along with most of the other whites in the picture who dare to open their mouths.

title: Stress on Oil Alternates
description: PARIS, Dec. 23The doubling of the price of crude oil produced in the Persian Gulf announced today in Teheran means the industrialized nonCommunist countries will be paying many billions of extra dollars for their petroleum importsbut it should also intensify the search both for new oil and for alternate sources of energy.

description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: U.S. HEARING SET ON AGENCY HIRING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The Senate Commerce Committee is trying to find out what, if anything, can be done to insulate Federal regulatory agencies from political influence.

title: Coach Landry Pushes Button Marked Bomb
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 23 The 83yard touchdown pass that turned today's playoff game in favor of the Cowboys originated on the sidelines, where Tom Landry, the Dallas coach, stands in solid fashion and decides which plays to call.

title: Jane E. Seitel Has Nuptials
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 23Miss Jane Ellen Seitel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Seitel of Englewood, N. J., was married here this evening to Eric Joel Mellencamp, a student at the Medical College of Wisconsin in Milwaukee. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Mellencamp of Ann Arbor and Islamorada, Fla. The ceremony was performed at the Mariott Hotel by Circuit Court Judge Robert V. Fink.

title: Kuwait Will Turn 5 Hijackers Over To the Guerrillas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec.23A Kuwaiti minister said today that the five Palestinian gunmen who attacked the Rome airport last week and then hijacked a Lufthansa airliner to Kuwait were still in Kuwaiti custody, but confirmed that the men would be handed over to the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Wittenberg Coach Cited
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 23 (AP)Dave Maurer of Wittenberg University has been named 1973 Kodak college division football coach of the year, officials announced today. Nearly 3,000 voting members of the American Football Coaches Association chose Maurer from a group of nine regional winners.

title: Stage: John Gay's Beggar's Opera
description: There is a special pleasure to repertory companiesthat of seeing the same actors in a diversity of roles. You seem to get to know them personally, to sympathize with their strengths and weaknesses. An actor in one role carries with him or her reverberations from his portrayals elsewhere in the repertory. Repertory combines all the possible pleasures of watching friends and relatives in amateur theater, with none of the concomitant esthetic heartburns.

title: Bridge: Crocodile Coup Valuable As a Defensive Stratagem
description: One of the rarest defensive plays in the game is known as the Crocodile Coup. A defender with two nontouching honors must play secondhand high to swallow his partner's honor and insure himself of the lead. When the opportunity for this arises, as it did on the diagramed deal from a recent Swiss team championship here, it is usually missed.
