Alexander, McKinsey associate, charged that state banking laws make it easier to buy a suburban home than a coop apartment in the city.

title: New Year
description: The old year comes to its close and we face the new year as though it were an entity, new as tomorrow. Yet any year is a cycle, a circle, You can start anywhere and, by following that circle, come again to that starting point. The year we know happens to be a cycle of the seasons, the times of sprouting, of growth, of ripeness and of rest. It is a part of the earth, and of the stars.

title: Good, Bad and Other...
description: In a striking article in the new quarterly Civil Liberties Review, Prof. Howard Zinn of Boston University points out that the Supreme Court and the Constitution do not, in fact, protect our liberties nearly to the extent that power and money constantly endanger them.

title: Poking around the myth factories
description: A vision of paradise that includes sipping CocaCola in the Muzakmurmurous lounge of an orbital Hilton while flipping through a galactic edition of Reader's Digest may unnerve some, depress others and, no doubt, reassure the rest, but in Anthony HadenGuest inspires a very English detachment.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Burger Urging Legal Reforms That Few Seem to Want
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Unlike some of his precedessors, Chief Justice Warren E. Burger does not believe that the nation's highest judicial officer should preside over its courts and lawyers in lofty silence from a vantage point of austere isolation.

title: To fall, hit, mimic, fool, trickand surprise
description: WHEN I was 4, I fell in love with a clown. He had a huge smilebig as a mud puddle. He had a huge nosered as an apple. His hair stuck out from the sides of his head like sunset  colored cotton candy. His eyebrows went up and up. His head was skinny, and he had a little hat that sat on top of the skin. I didn't know his name. I didn't know that clowns had names when I was 4. If I wanted a clown to come to me, I just clapped my hands and pointed impolitely and called out: Hey, Clown!

title: Important Work Is Done During The Recess
description: Washington is empty, politically speaking, the President and the Congress both gone. Yet both, in an important sense, are hard at work. President Nixon, spending a postChristmas vacation in San Clemente, is probably pondering his next moves in the political and economic crises besetting him. Congressmen, back in their home districts for the holiday recess, are inquiring into their constituents' opinions on the same matters. The following reports by New York Times correspondents in four regions of the country give a random sampling of what the Congressmen are doing.

title: Laughing All the Way to Armageddon
description: THE Museum of the City of New York, which is located on Fifth Avenue between 103d and 104th Streets, is dedicated to the proposition that New York is a wonderful town, which is not at all a bad proposition, just an incomplete one. Poverty and other urban ills, when the exhibits are concerned with them at all, are presented as picturesque or humorous aspects of the metropolitan scene. Still, you can't hold this against the artists whose paintings are exhibited as records. Art has been that way ever since Hellenistic sculptors discovered that beggars are a lot more interesting than the kind of emperors they were getting those days.

title: Notes: Gas or No Gets, Expo '74 Is Hopeful
description: WITH its major construction 80 per cent complete, Expo '74 in Spokane, Wash., plans to open on schedule May 4 as the only world's fair in this decade on the North American continent. But officials are staying up nights trying to figure out how to get visitors to Spokane in face of the gasoline shortage.

title: The Fools Of Chelm
description: Using the city of Chelm as his locale this famous Yiddish storyteller recounts a series of anecdotes about government by fools. The book is at once funny and notsofunny, for as the people of Chelm and their ignoble leaders stumble from one debacle to another it becomes apparent that the author has in mind a kind of civics lesson, and that the fools of Chelm and the citizens of the world have much in common.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: Jan. 4K9 Obedience Training Club of Essex County obedience course, National Guard Armory, 261 William Street, Orange, N.J. 8 P.M.; 9 weeks, $25, no dogs on registration night; information, Mrs. Joan Oravetz (201)8875345.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: News Summary and Index
What causes it really? Is Scotch worse than vodka? Will voodoo help?
description: The hangover, when it happens to strike me, comes as a complete surprise. The misery of the morning after, like an insult from a close friend. is not something I really expect to have happen. There is injustice inherent in the situation. I am, for one thing, a light and circumspect drinker; and, for another, my liquor consumption is altruistically motivated. Like Jackie Gleason, who once said, I drink to remove warts and pimples from the people I'm looking at, I drink to render those I don't like likable, and those I do care for even more lovable than they naturally are. Why should such socially constructive behavior to be punished, on occasion, by my awakening to the ravages of the four horsemen of the inner apocalypseHeadache, Heartburn, Thirst and Stomach Distress?

title: Cooper Village Fire Kills 1
description: An unidentified man was killed in an apartment fire at Peter Cooper Village yesterday afternoon, the police said. The victim was pronounced dead at the scene.

title: Arts Center Aiding Disturbed Youths
description: GREAT NECK, L. I.Professionals, business persons, housewives and students have studied and performed for 25 years at the North Shore Community Arts Center. Now a group of emotionally disturbed young people is participating alongside them, working their way back into the community.

title: Israeli Vote WillBe Felt in Geneva
description: The people of Israel vote tomorrow in a national election whose outcome will decide the tone, and perhaps the outcome, of negotiations with the Arabs in Geneva.

title: The Gears Of Dynasty Turn Today
description: DALLAS, Dec. 29The concept that the Dallas Cowboys represent a dynasty in professional football, like a family of Chinese emperors, began innocently enough in a motel press room two days prior to the Super Bowl game two seasons ago at New Orleans, the one in which the Cowboys and Duane Thomas ran over the Miami Dolphins, 243.

title: Courts Here, in Shift, Take Vacation
description: In the interests of courtroom efficiency, the State Supreme Court in Manhattan and the Bronx has ordered its judges and staff members to take vacations during this holiday period.

title: 57th Spaniel Show Gets A Record Entry of 637
description: The American Spaniel Club holds an unusual position in the dog show world. It takes place the first weekend of January and opens the season in the East. This year's fixture, the 57th News to be held by the 82yearold organization ganization (it is Dogs three years older than the American Kennel Club) takes place at the StatlerHilton next Saturday and Sunday and it has drawn record 637.

title: ExWar Prisoner Honored
description: LEMOORE NAVAL AIR STATION, Calif., Dec. 29 (AP)The family housing area at this Central California Navy base has been renamed Alva??ez Village in honor of the fighter Ipilot held captive in North Vietnam for almost nine years.

title: Home Improvement
description: ATHOUGH accidents and injuries caused while working with tools in and around the home are sometimes directly attributable to poorly designed or shoddily constructed power tools or hand tools, the vast majority of these accidents are actually caused by careless or improper handling or working techniquesor failure to observe a few commonsense safety precautions.

title: BURR HARRISON
description: WINCHESTER, Va., Dec. 29 (UPI)  Former Representative Burr P. Harrison died today, apparently of a heart attack, in Winchester Memorial Hospital. He was 69 years old.

title: Recordings
description: BEVERLY SILLS may have put Donizetti's three Tudor queens behind her for the moment, but she is not yet through with bel canto England, For the upcoming New York City Opera spring season she shifts the scene to Plymouth in the Cromvel (sic) era as cavalier battles roundhead in Bellini's I Puritani. The new production has already been staged in Los Angeles, during the company's recent westcoast visit, and as was the case with the three Donizetti operas, ABCDunhill has made a complete recording available prior to the New York performances (ATS 20016/3, three kids)

title: Mrs. Virginia S. Freels Married in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 29  Mrs. Virginia Schaal Freels and Harry G. Huberth Jr., board chairman of James FeltHuberth & Huberth, Inc., a realestate concern in New York, were married here this afternoon in the Round Hill Community Church by the Rev. Arnold C. Miller. The couple were attended by their five children by previous marriages, which ended in divorces.

title: Christine Monagan Bride of R. E. Ryan
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Dec. 29  Miss Christine Monagan, an administrative assistant on the staff of the Mayor's Office of the Lower Manhattan Development in New York, was married here this afternoon to Robert Emmet Ryan, a counselor in the methadone program of the Bernstein Institute of Beth Israel Medical Center in New York.

title: New Zealand Plans To Compensate All Who Suffer Injuries
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 29  At the end of the 19th century New Zealand had a worldwide reputation as laboratory of social reform. She is making a bid to regain that standing in 1974 with an accident compensation plan of radical new form.

title: Sally Hamlin Bride on L.I.
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., Dec. 29St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Sally Anne Hamlin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis B. Hamlin Jr. of Locust. Valley, to Cullen Walter Coates Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Coates of San Francisco. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Howard M. Lowell, rector, and the Rev. James Diamond, chaplain of the Episcopal Center at the University of Minnesota.

title: Hoffmans Have Child
description: BERKELEY HEIGHTS, N.J., Dec. 29  A daughter was born Dec. 5 to Mr. and Mrs. Barry M. Hoffman in St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston.

title: Miss Edelstein to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harold Edelstein of Flushing, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marion Edelstein, to Thomas G. Finkbinder, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Finkbinder of Lutherville, Md. Miss Edelstein and her fianc are seniors at American University and Washington College, respectively.

title: Prof. Joseph C. Aub Dies at 83; Cancer Researcher at Harvard
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30Dr. Joseph C. Aub, emeritus professor of medical research at Harvard University, where his work in metabolism laid foundations for more recent cancer research, died here today. He was 83 years old and lived in Belmont.

title: Lindsay in Retrospect: An Eloquent Spokesman for the Cities
description: Eight years ago this evefling, Mayor Lindsay moved into City Hall. Here, as prepares to leave, is a retrospective look at his two terms. It was written by Maurice Carroll on the basis of reporting by David Bird, Leonand Buder, David Burnham, Joseph P. Fried, Frank Lynn, Murray Schumach, Damon Stetson and Martin Tolchin.

title: Marina Owner Shoots and Kills 1 Intruder and Wounds Another
description: LINDENHURST, L.I., Dec. 30 The owner of a marina here last night shot two men he said were breaking into his storage facilities, critically wounding one and killing the second, the Suffolk County police said today.

title: Fayetteville Wins in Tourney Here
description: Alton Cogdell scored 29 points to lead Fayetteville (N.C.) State to a 9686 victory over Lincoln University yesterday to win the B. Section of the Freedom tournament at City College Mahoney Gym.

title: PAYMENT OF $21,000 TO A NIXON REPORTED
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30 (AP) President Nixon's brother Edward was paid at least $21,000 in consultant fees by a taxexempt foundation formed to build a Presidential library, The Los Angeles Times said in its Monday editions.

title: Green Berets Back in Action in Philippine Aid Project
description: BOHOL, the Philippines, Dec. 30 (AP)Americans are here on this island in the Mindanao Sea helping to build country schools, handing out birthconItrol devices, making well water safe to drink, putting up suspension bridges and giving dogs shots against rabies.

title: Garrert a Cowboy?
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30  Jim Garrett, defensive coordinator of the New York Giants, may be rejoining the Dallas Cowboys' organization.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's biggest collection of master points got even bigger during 1973. Barry Crane of Los Angeles, in scoring his fourth victory in the McKenney Trophy contest, which depends on the number of master points won in a calendar year, set two new marks.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Future Dim for Black Colleges As Students and Funds Decline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The new year offers black colleges little hope that their mounting financial problems will soon be overcome. Some leaders even fear that many of the schools will be dismantled or merged with white universities.

title: Peking and Taiwan
description: The progress made in American relations with China since 1971 has been dramatic and it has led to repeated speculation about the possibility of completing the process by establishing full diplomatic relations, clearly a desirable aim. The only real obstacle has been inability, to agree about Taiwan.

title: SLOW WEEK IN BONDS, BUT BUSY MONTH DUE
description: This holidayshortened week promises little in the way of new offerings in the corporate and taxexempt bond markets.

title: Hogan's Condition Serious
description: Frank S. Hogan, the farmer Manhattan District Attorney, remained in serious condition last night at St. Luke's Hospital, a hospital spokesman said. Mr. Hogan, who is 71 years old, was readmitted to the hospital last Thursday to undergo a series of tests, a day after he resigned as prosecutor. He was first admitted Aug. 10 suffering from a stroke, and on Sept. 7 he underwent surgery for a lung tumor.

title: Abortions, Legal for Year, Performed for Thousands
description: A 30yearold divorcee who was eight weeks pregnant entered the brightly colored offices of Women's Health Seryices, an abortion clinic in downtown Pittsburgh, and withir three hours had had an abortion, rested in the clinic's recovery room, paid the $150 fee and gone home.

title: Oil Economists Are Split On Some Energy Issues
description: Four of the nation's leading academic oil economists shared a platform but little else at a session on the international energy situation at the annual meeting of the Allied Social Science Association over the weekend.

title: Shula Clicks on 2 FourthDown Decisions
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30  Two fourthdown plays, with Larry Csonka smashing to a first down at the 1yard line on one and Dick Anderson forcing Mary Hubbard to fumble near midfield an the other, symbolized the Miami Dolphins' 2710 domination of the Oakland Raiders in today's American Conference championship game.

title: Charles L. Culbertson Marries Elyse Finger
description: BETHESDA, Md., Dec 30Miss Elyse Sue Finger, a senior at CarnegieMellon University, was married here this morning to Charles Lawrence Culbertson, a CarnegieMellon graduate and an architect with the Pittsburgh firm of Joel Kranich & Associates.

title: Events Today
description: VIENNA CHOIR BOYS, Avery Fisher Bell, 2.

title: Israeli Vote Projections Are Expected Tonight
description: Although final, official results of the election today in Israel may not he announced for two or three days, early trends and projections are expected by tonight, New York time.

title: Storm Rakes City in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 30 (Reuters)  Several persons were feared dead and about 100 homes were believed flattened by a windstorm last night in the city of Juanjui, 520 miles northeast of here, the police here said today. The city has about 10,000 inhabitants.

title: MRS. HARRY WEINBERG
description: Mrs. Minnie Greenspun Weinberg, widow of Harry Weinberg, who founded the Weinberg News Company, newspaper [distributors in Brooklyn, died Sunday at her home in Miami Beach. She was 86 years old.

title: Wet Weather and Dry Tanks May Cool Welcome to 1974
description: A dimmer cityscape and halfempty gas tanks may keep many New Year's revelers closer to home tonight, their spirits further dampened by rain clouds that threaten to drench the metropolitan area today and into the evening.

title: Csonka Scores 3 as Miami Rushes for 266 Yards
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30With the machinelike efficiency that has become routine and has matked them as the Green Bay Packers of the 70's, the Miami Dolphins wiped out the Oakland Raiders, 2710, today in the American Conference championship game.

title: Franco Says Assassination United Spain
description: MADRID, Dec. 30Generalissimo Francisco Franco, addressing the nation for the first time since the assassination of Premier Luis Carrero Blanco 1,0 days ago, declared tonight that the attack had strengthened the country's institutions and had united Spaniards.

title: Equal Rights Bracelet
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) The league of Women Voters reports it has sold more than 55,000 bracelets market ERA in favor of the Equal Rights Amendment. Money from the bracelets, which cost $2, will to toward helping ratification activities in the 20 states that have not ratified the constitutional amendment.

title: D. W. MacKelcari Jr. Weds Miss Garber
description: GARDEN. CITY, L. L, Dec. 30The marriage of Miss Deborah Joy Garber, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Douglas Gather, to Douglas Walker MacKelcan Jr., director of admissions and an instructor in history at the UniversityLiggett School in Grosse Pointe, Mich., took place here yesterday.

title: Landmark Moon for the Misbegotten
Sirica Named by Time As Its Man of the Year
description: Time magazine announced yesterday that it had selected Chief Judge John J. Sirica, of the Federal District Court in the District of Columbia, as its Man of the Year. The magazine described his as a symbol of the American judiciary's insistence on the priority of law throughout the sordid Watergate saga of 1973.

title: British Union Group Asks Rewriting of Mart Treaties
description: LONDON, Monday, Dec. 31 (Reuters) The British Trades Union Congress today called for a renegotiation of the nation's Common Market treaties and asserted that membership in the market had drained Britain of capital.

title: Moore Gains Lead In Frostbite Racing
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L,I., Dec. 30James B. Moore Jr. moved into the Inter Club class lead today by finishing third in the 43d annual frostbite regatta on Manhasset Bay. The one race held was won by Randy Bartholomew.

title: Knicks Turn Back Kings by 10285
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 30With the Kansas CityOmaha Kings providing almost no real opposition, the New York Knicks chalked up their easiest victory of the National Basketball Association season tonight, a 10285 triumph before 6,018 fans at Municipal Auditorium.

title: Solzhenitsyn and Soviet's Risks
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 30The publication of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's searing new account of the Stalinist prison camp system has posed an acute dilemma for the Kremlin with broad implications for the future course of accommodation with the West and for So viet security and cultural controls at home.

title: Highlights of Byrne Interview
description: Following are highlights from the transcript of an inter view of Governorelect Brenden T. Byrne by editors and reporters of The New York Times.

title: Surgery for Buoniconti
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30 (UPI)Nick Buoniconti, middle linebacker of the Miami Dolphins, will undergo surgery tomorrow for removal of bone chips in his elbow but will be ready to join the club when it resumes practice sessions Wednesday for its Jan. 13 Super Bowl meeting with the Minnesota Vikings.

title: 150 Stores Near Seoul Burn
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 30 (AP)One person was killed and seven were missing today. after a fire that destroyed half of 300 stores in an underground market on the eastern outskirts of Seoul, the police reported.

title: Elizabeth P. Culver Bride of John Sass
description: Elizabeth P. Culver Bride of John Sass Special to The New York Times SIMSBURY, Conn., Dec. 30 Miss Elizabeth Pendleton Culver, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Farnum Culver, was married here this afternoon, to John Frederick Sass, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis C. Sass of Miami.

title: Screen: Hill's 'Portrait':Charming Swan Song of Experimentalist
description: Jerome Hill"s "Film Portrait," a 90-minute recapitulation of his early years and subsequent career as a movie maker, is an utterly charming swan song by the screen experimentalist who died in 1972 at the age of 67. The film, using old home movie footage, covers his childhood in a happy, wealthy Minnesota home and then shifts to his later avant-garde filming.There is an endearing freshness to all this. A director, composer and painter, Mr. Hill outlines the course of his career in a simple, crystal-clear narrative. He loved the camera, we sense, as a wonderful toy of unlimited possibilities.In spite of the acclaim his more conventional documentaries on Albert Schweitzer and Grandma Moses have received, this last work of his may turn out to be the most impressive of his efforts. Everything here flows steadily, skillfully and pointedly, starting with his evocative chapter on his early life in St. Paul, which imaginatively blends photographs, animated stills and color that has the quality of Tiffany glass.Then as a wealthy young American roaming Europe in the nineteen-twenties, Mr. Hill slips behind the camera and remains therea determined independent movie-maker, influenced by Dreyer, Melies and other pioneers. The Cocteau influence is obvious as we see in a runoff of his 1930 short, "Fortune Teller," in a flickering print.Toward the end, the film dissolves kaleidoscopically within the image of a movie-ola as the spry, aging Mr. Hill demonstrates the vital role of editing ("alchemy") in his laboratory. These scenes were made shortly before his death."Every artist lends his own eyes to the audience," he muses, splicing a strip of negative. As an art form taking advantage of the machine, Mr. Hill tells us, "cinema was born just in time." He adds his credo: "A miracle is around every corner." Released by Anthology Film Archive, it was shown yesterday at the First Avenue Screening Room and will be repeated on Friday and Saturday.

title: Pittsburgh Press Price Up
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Press has announced an increase in the price of its Sunday edition from 35 to 40 cents, effective Jan. 6. The newspaper said the price increase, first in three and a half years, had been made necessary by rising costs of newsprint, other materials and labor.

title: Common Denominators, High and Low
description: WASHINGTONPolitics is not only a matter of government. It is the conversation of a society: about its government, and ultimately about itself. In this conversation, the people come to know each other, and arrive at the shared understanding of their common life that in the end matters much more than their agreements or disagreements on any particular issue.

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, DECEMBER 31, 1973
description: International

title: New Jersey Sports
description: CLIFFSIDE PARK, Dec. 30When the Ohio State football coach, Woody Hayes, lost his starting fullback, Champ Henson, in the third game of the past season, there was reason to mourn in Columbus. Henson had been the national scoring champion in 1972. But Hayes dipped into his deep reserve of talent and replaced the injured Henson with Bruce Elia, who had carried the ball only twice for Ohio State. Elia, a 217pound junior, wound up leading the Big Ten conference in scoring with 11 touchdowns. On Tuesday he will be pounding against Southern Cal's line and blocking for an allAmerica tailback, Archie Griffin, in the Rose Bowl.

title: Traffic in Wildlife
description: If the Department of the Interior puts into effect a proposal to curtail drastically the list of animals that may be imported without permit, one of the worst of the cruel and degrading features of the petshop business might yet be curbed.

title: Gasoline Siphoner Leaves $5 Payment on the Tank
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Dec. 30 (UPI) John Taylor filled his car with gasoline Friday in anticipation of service station closing over the New Year's weekend.

title: Negev City Regains Fragile Normality
description: BEERSHEBA, Israel, Dec. 30This capital of the Negev is beginning to come out of the shock of war, although everyone is all too aware of the fragility of the ceasefire.

title: Holiday Closings Set
description: The major United States and Canadian stock exchanges will operate on normal schedules today, but will be closed tomorrow, New Year's Day. The Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange will be open until noon today and closed tomorrow. Banks in New York State will be open today and closed tomorrow.

title: U.S. ENERGY OFFICE MOVES TO PREVENT HOARDING OF FUEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Federal Energy Office moved today to demonstrate that the complex new rules for fuel allocations will be enforced.

title: Endgame: 2
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30The turn of this year is marked, for many of us, by the strange sensation of living on two quite distinct levels of consciousness. We go on about our daily business; we talk about politics, about possessions, about travel and food and football. And all the while it becomes harder to avoid awareness that the ground upon which our society rests is shifting.

title: Dr. Theodore Brown Dies; Taught Business at Harvard
description: Theodore H. Brown, professor emeritus of business statistics at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration, died yesterday in a Venice, Fla., hospital. He was 85 years old and had been living in Englewood, Fla.

title: Astronauts Debate Work Schedules With Controllers
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)The Skylab 3 astronauts and Mission Control officials had a hearttoheart talk today about problems that have caused accomplishments on the mission to fall below expectations. One official termed the talk a soulbaring session, but it ended in apparent harmony.

title: Levels for Italy Off 40 to 60% in 2 Months
description: ROME, Dec. 30  Carless Sundays and public holidays and a call by Parliament for, early gasoline rationing are painfully causing Italians to reappraise the role of the auto industry as the flywheel of this nation's economy.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Colombian Bridge Collapses
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Civil defense authorities said today that 28 people were ?? dead in the collapse of a new bridge in eastern Colombia. Five bodies have been recovered and 23 are still missing. Hundreds of people had gathered on the suspension bridge near the town of Arauca about 300 miles northeast of Bogota for inauguration ceremonies when the bridge collapsed. The accident occurred at 11 A.M. yesterday, but word of it reached Bogota only today.

title: 16 Christian and Jewish Groups Form Abortion Rights Coalition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Sixteen Christian and Jewish religious organizations have formed a National Religious Coalition for Abortion Rights to safeguard the right of women to use individual freedom of conscience in deciding whether to seek an abortion.

title: Oil Crisis Could Halt Poor Nations' Growth
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 30In India, Government officials face the gloomy prospect that higher oil prices could doom the country's $71billion fiveyear development plan before it begins in 1974.

title: Court Curbs a Station Overcharging for Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)A gasoline station that charged $10.05 for five gallons of gasoline, a rabbit's foot and a blank form for a last will and testament has been closed by Federal court order, the Justice. Department said today. A spokesman said the temporary restraining order served on McBride's Shell Service on the outskirts of Chicago was the first such order.

title: Manhattan Prosecutor Studies Alleged Vote Siphoning on L.I.
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office is investigating the alleged votesiphoning scheme involving the chairman of the Nassau Democratic Committee and a former Conservative candidate for the Assembly.

title: For Many, New Year's Eve Isn't the Gala It Used
description: The big bands played Auld Lang Syne, the carefullycoiffed heads balanced funny hats, the noisemakers screeched and the lips puckered to kiss friends and strangers alike. It was New Year's Eve, once the epitome of organized hilarity.

title: Maryland Takes Tourney Final
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 30 (AP)Tom McMillen, playing one day after the death of his father, scored 18 points as secondranked Maryland, which sank 17 of its first 25 shots, beat Boston College, 5837, tonight to win the Maryland invitation tournament.

title: Advertising: Panel Hits Schick
description: Although it found no fault with the testing methods involved, a panel of the National Advertising Review Board has judged the comparative advertising campaign for the Schick Flexamatic electric shaver false in some details and misleading in its overall implications:.

title: Y.W.C.A. IN BATTLE OVER GUN CONTROLS
description: The Young Women's Christian Association has become embroiled in a dispute with representatives of the country's gun enthusiasts.

title: BROOKLYN MAN HELD IN DETROIT MURDER
description: A 32yearold Brooklyn man was seized by the police in his Some last night and charged with the fatal shooting of his exwife's husband in Detroit on Saturday, the police said.

title: Office Pool
description: WASHINGTONPresidential speechwriter Pat Buchanan and I used to make a series of bets on predictions at yearend, opening the envelope the following year to see who had been the more Delphic of oracles.

title: Tarkenton and Co. Have Dizzying Effect on Cowboys
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 30Cornell Green was so dizzy that he didn't know what defense the Dallas Cowboys were playing when Fran Tarkenton completed a crucial 54yard touchdown pass play to John Gilliam today.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: Horses & Equipment 3985

title: Rangers 43 Victors Over Stars
description: It was a topsyturvy game at Madison Square Garden last night, with New York Ranger defensemen outshooting the forwards, a substitute goaltender playing his heart out hoping to find a regular job somewhere, and forward lines playing with mixedup combinations.

title: The Gulag Archipelago, 19181956
description: What would things have been like every security operations man when he set out at night to make arrests was uncertain whether he would return alive and would have to say his goodbys to his own family?

title: Pipeline Company Formed
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30 (Reuters)Five Arab states yesterday formed a $400million company to build a 207mile oil pipeline from Suez to Alexandria. The company was set up by Egypt, which will contribute half of the cost, and the oilproducing states of Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Abu Dhabi and Qatar. The line will be built by the Bechtel Corporation of the United States.

title: Egypt's Forces Continue Pressure at the Front
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30  Egypt's (military pressure against Israeli troops, apparently intended in part to exert some influence in the crucial Israeli elections tomorrow, was continuing at an intense level, according to reports today by the United Nations Emergency Force.

title: City Police Cut Car Duty As Gasoline Runs Low
description: Virtually every police, precinct in the city reduced the number of radio cars on patrol last night anywhere from 30 to 80 per cent as the department's gasoline supply for the month neared exhaustion.

title: U.S. ENERGY OFFICE MOVES TO PREVENT HOARDING OF FUEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 The Federal Energy Office moved today to demonstrate that the complex new rules for fuel allocations will be enforced.

title: RICHARD G. CROFT, WHITNEY PARTNER
description: NORFOLK, Conn., Dec. 30Richard G. Croft, a partner in J. H. Whitney & Co. from 1946 to 1958 and chairman of the board of the Great Northern Paper Company from 1950 to 1966, died yesterday at his home here. He was 72 years old.

title: Red Smith
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 30The keynote was struck with the kickoff starting the third period. As the Dallas Cowboys' Austrian sidewinder, Toni Fritsch, swung his foot against the ball, an official noticed a little mound of foreign matter on the synthetic carpet of Texas Stadium. It had been left there by a horse .during a bareback riding exhibition between halves. The official blew his whistle, a man, with a shovel did a quick house cleaning job, and Fritsch kicked off again. Considering what horrors were in store for the second half, the opening was marvelously appropriate.

title: Adirondack Conditions GoodExcept for Skiing
description: WILMINGTON, N. Y. Dec. 30  New York's Adirondack Mountains, host to an estimated 50,000 visitors today, had many favorable factorsit was snowing, temperatures were well below freezing and the forecast for tonight and tomorrow was the same  but still skiing conditions weren't good.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Assembly Committee Heads Named

title: Part of West Side Highway To Be Closed for Repairs
description: The West Side Highway between 46th Street and the Battery will be closed to traffic in both directions for an indefinite period beginning today, Highways Commissioner Manuel Carballo announced yesterday.

title: A DEAN'S OUSTER IS UNDER INQUIRY
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 30After a semester that saw an upsurge of concern over allegations of racism at Amherst College, members of the school's Black Steering Committee are using their sixweek interterm recess to investigate the dismissal of Dean Richard O'Daniel, a black. Disclosure of its findings is expected during the second semester.

title: Navy Trying to Clean Up Oil Spilled in Ship Collision,
description: MONTEREY, Calif, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Efforts were made today to clean up a 12mile trail of oil spilled in the collision of a Navy cargo ship and a Liberian freighter off California's coast.

title: Aides for Landmarks, Budget And Taxis Appointed by Beame
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame announced yesterday the appointments of Moses L. Kove, a trial lawyer and longtime friend, as chairman of the Taxi and Limousine Commission, and Beverly Moss Spatt, a former maverick member of the City Planning Commission, as chairman of the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with great interest (Dec. 24) of the appointment of Roger Starr by Mayorelect Beame as temporary city housing administrator who will dismantle the Housing and Development Administration into four separate departments and then continue on as Commissioner of Development. [Editorial Dec. 28.]

title: Some Success Cited On a Negative Tax
description: University of Wisconsin economists reported yesterday that a sixyear experiment with the negative income tax has been a qualified success. Hundreds of poor workers in New Jersey and Pennsylvania who were given direct cash grants in the experiment, did not cut back their individual work efforts significantly. Instead, they used the government grant to supplement their own low earnings and kept on working.

title: Executive Training Program Tailored for the TeenAger
description: Miguel Morales, in his bigwindowed private office at the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, has been evaluating the different indices of the poor put out by various government agencies; A.T.&T.'s Community Relations Office wants the evaluation. Miguel is 16 years old.

title: 2 Warring Gangs Seek to Revitalize A Section of Detroit
description: DETROIT, Dec. 30 (AP)The Bishops and the Chains have been warring over the turf near Van Dyke Road on Detroit's East Side for five years.

title: Park Rejects a Campaign For Korean Liberalization
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 31 (Reuters) President of South Korea, Park Chung Hee, rejected today mounting pressure from intellectuals for liberalization and urged them to follow the course of national revitalization he has set.

title: Books of The Times
description: SWEET DREAMS. By Michael Frayn. 173 pages. Viking. $5.95.

title: Out of Horsepower, Police Use Leg Power
description: In the 25th Precinct in East Harlem last night, 18 policemen walked instead of riding on patrols.

title: More Iranian Troops Reported Fighting in Oman
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 30Iran is reported to have sent additional forces to the Oman to help Sultan Qabus binSaid against Marxist rebels in the district of Dhofar. The report was from rebel sources and independent Western diplomatic sources here.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Egypt's Forces Continue Pressure at the Front
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30  Egypt's military pressure against Israeli troops, apparently intended in Part to exert some influence in the crucial Israeli elections tomorrow, was continuing at an intense level, according to reports today by the United Nations Emergency Force.

title: Oil and Poor Nations
description: The world's lessdeveloped countries are beginning to feel damage from the rising price of oil and its derivatives, The eventual impact will be staggering for many of the 70 to 80 countries that must import petroleum, according to United Nations experts. Page 2.

title: Miss McDermott Bride of James Harker
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 30Miss Christine Margaret McDermott, an assistant city solicitor of Wilmington, was married here this afternoon to James Frank Harker, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward W. Harker of Bayonne, N. J. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Gregory McDermott of Newark, Del.

title: Angered Julie Heldman And Chris Evert Triumph
description: MELBOURNE, Dec. 30 (AP) Chris Evert and her fiance, Jimmy Connors, moved closer to the top singles prizes today in the $74,500 Australian open tennis championship.

title: Woman Attacked And Robbed by 3 In a Car in Bronx
description: A 55yearold woman seized by three men in her own car in the Bronx and then beaten and robbed of the car, a fur coat and $1,600 worth of jewelry later identified two of her attackers last night after they were arrested by two detectives who spotted the stolen car, the police reported.

title: Highlights From Interview With Byrne
description: Following are highlights from the transcript of an interview of Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne by editors and reporters of The New York Times.

title: The Gulag Archipelago, 19181956
description: What would things have been like every security operations man when he set out at night to make arrests was uncertain whether he would return alive and would have to say his goodbys to his own family?

title: Hogan's Condition Serious
description: Frank S. Hogan, the former Manhattan District Attorney, remained in serious condition last night at St. Luke's Hospital, a hospital spokesman said. Mr. Hogan, who is 71 years old, was readmitted to the hospital last Thursday to undergo a series of tests, a day after he resigned as prosecutor. He was first admitted Aug. 10 suffering from a stroke, and on Sept. 7 he underwent surgery for a lung tumor.

title: BID TO BAN GULAG IN U.S IS DOUBTED
description: American experts in United StatesSoviet copyright relations said yesterday that it was unlikely that Moscow would take legal action to keep Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's latest book, The Gulag Archipelago, from being published in the United States.

title: Energy Crisis: How One City in New. England Copes
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass.  The people of this small industrial city nestled into the purple Berkshire Hills are facing up to the energy crisis like much of the rest of America: with belttightening measures to nibble savings of electricity and oil, little preparation, seme selfishness, and not much real idea of what may be in store.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A reader, Sandra Fee, offers one explanation for the slump In American food standards:

title: Housing Boom Turns to Bust and Threatens a Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The home building boom is collapsing.

title: Church in Revere's Ride Has 250th Anniversary
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30The church whose steeple displayed the lanterns that sent Paul Revere on his ride celebrated its 250th anniversary today.

title: Pope Discusses Parent Role
description: ROME, Dec. 30 (UPI)Pope Paul VI urged parents today to take an active role in the education of their children in school as well as in the home. The Pontiff addressed a crowd of about 5,000 pilgrims gathered in St. Peter's Square in mild but cloudy weather on the last Sunday of the year.

title: Mayor Collects Garbage Piled Up in Labor Dispute
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 30  Mayor Thomas Maloney got aboard a garbage truck today and, with the help of most of his administrative staff, began collecting refuse piled up during 10 days of a labor dispute with the city's trashmen.

title: ANGRY PROTESTANTS ATTACK ULSTER SITES
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 300 (AP)Mobs of Protestant demonstrators, angered by the death in ambush of a Protestant policeman, attacked a police station, damaged a convent with bombs, burned vehicles and fired at a British Army patrol in violence that ended early today.

title: Flyers Beat Sabres, 54, On Late Goal by Bladon
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 30 (UPI)Tom Bladon scored from the right point late in the final period tonight helping the Philadelphia Flyers beat the Buffalo Sabres, 5.4, in a National Hockey League game.

title: British Retail Executive, Backer Of Israel, Is Shot by Intruder
description: LONDON, Dec. 30  Joseph Edward Sieff, a prominent retail executive and a strong supporter of the Israel cause, was shot and seriously injured at his home here tonight.

title: Miss Watrous, Ralph Abelow Marry Upstate
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Dec. 30  Miss Eleanor Williams Watrous and Ralph Lewis Abelow, seniors at Western State College of Colorado, were married here this afternoon in the Monday Afternoon Club by Broome County Court Judge Stephen Smyk.

title: Wood Alcohol Studied as Gas Additive To Raise Mileage and Cut Pollutants
description: Methanol, or wood alcohol, the poisonous bane of unwary drinkers during Prohibition, is receiving serious scientific attention as a versatile energy source for a nation short of fuel.

title: Wreck Attributed to Switch
description: ANDERSON, Calif., Dec. 30 (UPI)A faulty switch probably caused the wreck Friday of a SeattleLos Angeles train in which three sleeping cars overturned and 80 passengers were injured, an Amtrak official said yesterday.

title: New Drinking Age Gets Good Report
description: EDGEWATER, Dec. 30Last New Year's Eve 400,000 young New Jerseyans became legally entitled to belly up to the bar as the minimum drinking age was reduced from 21 to 18 at the stroke of midnight. They also became entitled to marry without parental consent, enter into contracts, become adoptive parents, incorporate themselves, serve as policemen and firemen, hold public office, sue and be sued and serve on grand juries.

title: Bancorp on Coast Reveals Problems
description: Beverly Hills Bancorp, a holding company based in Beverly Hills, Calif., whose affiliates in elude the Beverly Hills National Bank and Golden State Thrift and Loan, announced yesterday that it had ceased to issue commercial paper and was unable to immediately retire its outstanding shortterm commercialpaper obligations.

title: Voodoo Colony Home For Harlem Dropouts
description: SHELDON, S. C., Dec. 29 Crooked as a cottonmouth moccasin and mired with dank mud, the road wends forbiddingly into a swampy thicket of stubby myrtle bushes and stunted oaks weighted down with the hanging gray moss that is the flora trademark of the low country of coastal South Carolina and Georgia.

title: Avalanches at Utah Resort Injure One and Bury Cars
description: ALTA, Utah, Dec, 30Two avalanches rumbled into the Alta ski resort today, burying some skiers' cars and smashing into the Alta lodge, One man was seriously injured.

title: Even a Governor Has Trouble Buying Fuel
description: LINCOLN CITY, Ore., Dec. 30 (UPI)I'm sorry, sir, said a Union 76 station manager, Hugh Grondin, to a man in a blue Contipental, we're only selling gas to our regular customers.

title: BYRNE PLANNING A SPECIAL SESSION
description: New Jersey's Governorelect, Brendan T. Byrne, plans to call a special session of the Legislature immediately following the Legislature's usual spring session to deal with school financing and tax reform.

title: Steak or Lobster Meal for $2.10 Offered to Admirals at Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (UM The Pentagon may not quite provide caviar to its generals but it does offer a steak dinner or lobster lunch to its admirals for $2.10,

title: EDMUND GILLIGAN, NOVELIST, 75, DIES
description: BEARSVILLE, N.Y., Dec. 30 Edmund Gilligan, a newspaperman and novelist who wrote sagas of the sea, particularly about the fishermen of Gloucester, Mass., died yesterday of a heart attack in Kingston City Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived here.

title: GERALD M. TIERNEY
description: Gerald M. Tierney, who retired last year as vice president of DudleyAndersonYutzy Public Relations Inc., died Saturday of a heart ailment in East Hampton, L. I. He was 56 years old and lived at 2063 Baldwin Court, Merrick, L. I.

title: Dave Mason Spins Songs With Everyday Appeal
description: Dave Mason has been one of rock's wandering minstrels. He came from England and now lives in America and has worked with top rock groupsincluding a brief, unlikely alliance with Mama Cassand he also has become a compulsive sitterin, showing up in clubs across the country to jam with the onstage ensemble.

title: INSURGENTS' ROCKETS KILL 7 IN PHNOM PENH
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 30 (AP)Insurgent troops fired four Sovietbuilt rockets today into the heart of Phnom Penh, sending one into an American official's villa and another into President Lon Nol's palace compound, police sources reported.

title: Rally in 2d Period Helps Knights Win
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Dec. 30Wayne Rivers, Andre Ladroix and Gene Peacosh scored secondperiod goals today to lead the Jersey Knights to a 62 World Hockey Association victory over the Cleveland Crusaders.

title: Schwartz Proves Commanding Pianist
description: If the piano recitals Joseph Schwartz gives during a forthcoming European tour are as successful as the one he gave in Carnegie Recital Hall on Saturday night, he might be hailed there as new American star.

title: Tarkenton's Attach, Revamped Offense Confuse Dallas
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 30 Our whole philosophy with these playoff games, said Fran Tarkenton, is not to try to keep from losing them, but to win them. I've seen an awful lot of these games, on television, and usually teams go into them tight with the idea not losing, rather than winning. So we attacked.

title: Greece Reportedly Reopening a Prison
description: ATHENS, Dec. 30Families of Greek political prisoners contended today that the new Government had reopened the concentration camp on Gyaros, a waterless, uninhabited island of seven square miles in the Aegean Sea.

title: John Novello Weds Laura E. Shapiro
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 30Miss Laura Emma Shapiro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jonas M. Shapiro of Stamford, was married here this afternoon to John Novello, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul W. Novello of Elizabeth, N.J. The ceremony was performed at Waveny Castle by the Rev. David Lonergan, a Roman Catholic priest, and by Rabbi Samuel Silver.

title: Gas Shortage and Rein on Money Cited
description: COLOGNE, West GermanyWest German automobileindustry officials say that, because of a combination of anxiety over gasoline shortages and the Government's tight money policies in recent months, sales of new cars in December were down to less than half what they were at the same time last year.

title: GAINS ARE FOUND FOR WOMEN'S PAY
description: Half a dozen research papers presented here at academic meetings in the last few days added further detail to the portrait of an economy in which more than half of all adult women now work in paid jobs.

title: Poets Finding No Safety in Numbers
description: Of all human events, perhaps, the publication of a first volume of verses is the most insignificant, Herman Melville wrote wistfully in 1860 as he woreied about getting his own poetry published, but ... it is still of some concern to the author.

title: NIXON SIGNS 7 BILLS AND WATCHES GAMES
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif. Dec. 30 (AP)  President Nixon signed into law seven pieces of legislation today and then watched the professional football playoff games on television.

title: Frostbite Regatta Paced by Calman
description: RYE, N, Y., Dec. 30 Michael Calman of the Mamaroneck Frostbite Association sailed into a 21point lead today as the American Yacht Club's 10th annual New Year's Frostbite regatta got off to a belated start.

title: Marie Powers, Contralto, Dies; Noted for Menotti Opera Roles
description: Marie Powers, the contralto who achieved popular as well as critical acclaim in the operas of Gian Carlo Menotti, died Friday, apparently of heart failure, at the home of a friend with whom she had been staying here since returning from France. She was believed to be in her 60's.

title: FUND FOR NEEDY HAS ITS BEST DA
description: The New York Times Needle Cases Fund yesterday chalks up its best day since the cu rent campaign got under wa on Dec. 9.

title: MRS. EDWARD J. NOBLE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 30  Mrs. Ethel Tinkham Noble, widow of Edward J, Noble, chairman of the board of BeechnutLife Savers Cc. poration and chairman of the American Broadcasting Company, died in her home here today. She lived also in Alexandria Bay, N.Y.

title: Amoco to Join Italian Company In Drilling for Oil Off Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania. Dec. 30The American Oil Company and AGIP, an Italian concern, have joined in a partnership to drill for oil off the Tanzanian coast.

title: Dolphins 6Point Pick
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30 (AP)Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder established the Miami Dolphins as a 6point favorite tonight to win Super Bowl VIII and become the first team to successfully defend its title since Vince Lombardi's Green Bay Packers won the first two world championships of pro football.

title: A DEAN'S OUSTER IS UNDER INQUIRY
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 30After a semester that saw an upsurge of concern over allegations of racism at Amherst College, members of the school's Black Steering Committee are using their sixweek interterm recess to investigate the dismissal of Dean Richard O'Daniel, a black. Disclosure of its findings is expected during the second semester.

title: Lindsay Marks Last Sunday in Office Amid Thousands Strolling on the Mall
description: Dodging roller skaters and volleyball players in the middle of Fifth Avenue, Mayor Lindsay loped the 23block length of the holiday promenade again yesterday with a sizable group of his soontobeformer constituency at his heels.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following Is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflcots prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Music
description: No one can accuse Lukas Foss and the Brooklyn Philharmonia of staging a dull or stingy show at the Academy of Music Saturday night,

title: Spain's New Premier Carlos Arias Navarro
description: MADRID, Dec. 30Carlos Arias Navarro, Spain's first civilian Premier since the civil war, is expected to be sworn in tomorrow. On his knees, with his left hand on a Bible and his right hand raised, he will express fidelity to the Chief of State, Generalissimo Francisco Franco, and to the institutions of the realm.

title: DAVID M. DAYNARD
description: David M. Daynard, a business broker specializing in properties in publishing, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 55 Central Park West.

title: Woman, 61, Dies in Plunge From Park Ave. Apartment
description: A 61yearold woman who had reportedly been suffering from depression apparently jumped to her death early yesterday from her Park Avenue apartment, the police said.

title: Lindsay SelfCritical About Decentralization
description: One area may have pushed too hard on, too fast, was decentralization of our school system, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday. He spoke on the nationally televised Meet the Press show on N,B.C. in another of several interviews accompanying his impending departure from City Hall.

title: The Transformation of Solzhenitsyn: From Dedicated Communist to Critic
description: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's autobiography is the story of a dedicated young patriot and Communist who emerged from the Gulag Archipelagothe Soviet labor camp networka profound critic and opponent of what he had come to regard as the terrorbased Soviet system.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's biggest collection of master points got even bigger during 1973. Barry Crane of Los Angeles, in scoring his fourth victory in the McKenney Trophy contest, which depends on the number of master points won in a calendar year, set two new marks.

title: Daredevil Crew Quenches Another Blaze at Oil Well
description: CASPER, Wyo., Dec. 30  said Tom Popp, the Chaparral Jimmy Adair is a rugged working man who does his job only where oil and natural gas erupt uncontrollably out of the ground. Sometimes the job takes him into devouring flames. At other times oil is falling all around hima spark away from ignition.

title: Angered Julie Heldman And Chris Evert Triumph
description: MELBOURNE, Dec. 30 (AP) Chris Evert and her fiance, Jimmy Connors, moved closer to the top singles prizes today in the $74,500 Australian open tennis championship.

title: Peru Takes Over Big U.S.Owned Mining Concern
description: LIMA, Peru, Monday, Dec. 31 (Reuters)Peru will take over the giant Americanowned Cerro de Pasco mining corporation today under a Government decree issued here late last night.

title: Fire Damages Dining Room
description: SHELBURNE, N.H., Dec. 30 (AP)A fire burned out the lounge and dining room of the Town and Country Motor Inn, here last night, causing an estimated $500,000 worth of damage, the officials said.

title: Power Rate Rise Fought
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.30 (AP)Student publicinterest groups organized by Ralph Nader have opened a national campaign to fight increases in electrical rates for household needs. The plan, called Lifeline Service, was announced by leaders of studentfunded Public Interest Research Groups, which operate in 21 states, Washington and Ontario, Canada.

title: Concert
description: The tug of war between jazz and classical music that has gone on just beneath the surface of the Modern Jazz Quartet's performances for the last 20 years came out in the open Friday evening at the Quartet's Christmas concert in Carnegie Hall.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the author's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: A NURSE IS STABBED BY WOMEN MUGGERS
description: A nurse who had just come off duty at Mount Sinai Hospital was stabbed shortly after midnight yesterday in thwarting the attempt of two young women to rob her.

title: Progress Expected Alto National Election Today
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 30  A promising momentum has been established in the first week of military negotiations in Geneva on the disengagement of Israeli and Egyptian forces along the Suez Canal, in the opinion of senior Israeli officials.

title: Future Dim for Black Colleges As Students and Funds Decline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The new year offers black colleges little hope that their mounting financial problems will soon be overcome. Some leaders even fear that many of the schools will be dismantled or merged with white universities.

title: A Mayor of Vision
description: John V. Lindsay, a Mayor of vision who dared to raise the sights of his fellow citizens, leaves office tonight after an unprecedented eightyear effort to reinvigorate and reshape this great metropolis. Despite all the setbacks and difficulties, this leader of verve and imagination achieved far more than he was generally given credit for. We are confident that in the perspective of time his record of accomplishment will place him securely among the outstanding Mayors of New York.

title: Abortions, Legal for Year, Performed for Thousands
description: A 30yearold divorcee who was eight weeks pregnant entered the brightly colored offices of Women's Health Services, an abortion clinic in downtown Pittsburgh, and within three hours had had an abortidn, rested in the clinic's recovery room, paid the $150 fee and gone home.

title: Oil Lost in Tanker Collision
description: Up to 100 barrels of oil were spilled early yesterday when a small American coastal tanker collided with a barge in Buttermilk Channel, between Brooklyn and Governors Island, the Coast Guard reported. Officials said the 158foot tanker Sam Berman, reportedly carrying 6,000 barrels of No. 2 fuel oil, smashed into the Esso barge Manhasset, which was being assisted by a tugboat, at almost 14 A.M.

title: Baker Says Nixon Has Failed To End Doubt About Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Senator Howard H. Baker Jr., Republican of Tennessee, said today that President Nixon had thus far failed to remove public doubt about his role in Watergate. But, he said, as of this moment, the odds would favor the President continuing his term.

title: MassTransit Bargain Day Is the Busiest One to Date
description: Brisk holiday weather and dry gasoline pumps made the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's third bargain Sunday the busiest yet as riders crowded onto buses, subways and trains to do their visiting at half the usual fare.

title: Drawbridge Automation Urged to Cut Strike Effect
description: Automation of the city's 25 lrawbridges was proposed yeserday by Highways Commisioner Manuel Carballo, partly o minimize the effects of trike such as the one that toduced chaos on the roads eading to the bridges in June 971.

title: Diversion to Dutch Of Oil Is Suspected In the Netherlands
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 28 Many diplomats, journalists and oil experts in the Netherlands believe that oil companies are diverting cargoes at sea to thwart the Arab embargo of shipments to this country.

title: Holiday Tournaments a Mixed Blessing
description: And now to conference play.

title: Classic Match: Notre DameBama
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 30Tim Sullivan, a linebacker accustomed to pouncing on ballcarriers, jumped in the barrel and started rowing with his hands. Greg Collins, another linebacker, flopped like a fish out of water.

title: Taft Loses Battle, Wins War, 4443
description: Taft lost a battle of strategy yesterday, but still defeated Dewitt Clinton, 4443, in the final of the ElmCor high school Christmas basketball tournament. Taft was led by Anthony Price with 15 points, while Hector Olivencia led Clinton with 14.

title: Boston U. Surgery Head
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Dr. John A. Mannick has been appointed chairman of the Division of Surgery at Boston University Schad of Medicine and surgeon in chief of University Hospital. Dr. Mannick, 45 years old is a vascular and transplant surgeon. He succeeds Dr. Richlard H. Egdahl, the new director of Boston University Medical Center.

title: Manhattan Prosecutor Studies Alleged Vote Siphoning on L. I.
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office is investigating the alleged votesiphoning scheme involving the chairman of the Nassau Democratic Committee and a former Conservative candidate for the Assembly.

title: 4 SEIZED IN NEWARK IN HOLDUPS OF 5 BARS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 30 (UPI) Three men and a woman were arrested today and charged with the robbery of $5,000 from Ave Newark taverns and dozens of bar patrons in the last three weeks.

title: Personal Finance: Shifts On Car Pool Insuring Due
description: Automobile insurers love to sell insurance but so far as many as 800,000 New Yorkers have been turned away as bad risks.

title: Raiders: Ball Control Decisive
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30We couldn't seem to get the damn thing [football] from them.

title: Progress Expected After National Election Today
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 30  A promising momentum has been established in the first week of military negotiations in Geneva on the disengagement of Israeli and Egyptian forces along the Suez Canal, in the opinion of senior Israeli officials.

title: New York's Destiny Tied To Federal Aid Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30On the eve of a new administration in New York City, some top members of Mayor Lindsay's cabinet have warned that the impact of Federal policies on the life and destiny of the city is equal to, and possibly greater than, that of City Hall.

title: Trudeau Says Canadians Won't Have Oil Shortage
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 30 (UPI)Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau expressed confidence today that Canadians would not experience serious oil shortages and that the energy crisis would not lead to an economic slowdown next year.

title: Prices Expected to Rise On Pennsylvania Crude
description: TITUSVILLE, Pa.Harold W. Seifert, a transplanted Oklahoman, jumped out of his car and walked over the snowcovered ground to a barrel into which reddishgreen crude oil was slowly dripping.

title: Soap Operas' Plots Thicken Nicely For Writer of Summaries for Fans
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 30Down here 30 miles south of San Francisco in the land of endless suburbs. there is a lowslung green house on a side street near a freeway amid dozens of other green houses, and it has seven television sets.

title: BYRNE PLANNING A SPECIAL SESSION
description: New Jersey's Governorelect, Brendan T. Byrne, plans to call a special session of the Legislature immediately following the Legislature's usual spring session to deal with school financing and tax reform.

title: City Police Cut Car Duty As Gasoline Runs Low
description: Virtually every police precinct in the city reduced the number of radio cars on patrol last night anywhere from 30 to 80 per cent as the department's gasoline supply for the month neared exhaustion.

title: Edward Tomlinson, 82, Is Dead; Wrote on LatinAmerican News
description: FAIRFAX, Va., Dec. 30 (AP) Edward Tomlinson, a prominent reporter of LatinAmerican affairs since 1921, died last night at the age of 82.

title: Australian Blast Hurts 20
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 30 (Reuters)An explosion ripped through a shopping center here today, injuring 20 people and flattening four shops. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

title: Church in Revere's Ride Has 250th Anniversary
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30The church whose steeple displayed the lanterns that sent Paul Revere on his ride celebrated its 250th anniversary today.

title: New York's Destiny Tied To Federal Aid Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30On the eve of a new administration in New York City, some top members of Mayor Lindsay's cabinet have warned that the impact of Federal policies on the life and destiny of the city is equal to, and possibly greater tharl, that of City Hall.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 30 (AP)The veterinarian for Secretariat and his stablemate, Riva Ridge, said the Meadow Stable colts were never given any medication that might hamper their fertility as breeding stallions.

title: Oil and Poor Nations
description: The world's lessdeveloped countries are beginning to feel damage from the rising price of oil and its derivatives. The eventual impact will be staggering for many of the 70 to 80 countries that must import petroleum, according to United Nations experts. Page 2.

title: Marina Owner Shoots and Kills 1 Intruder and Wounds Another
description: LINDENHURST, L.I., Dec. 30 The owner of a marina here last night shot two men he said were breaking into his storage facilities, critically wounding one and killing the second, the Suffolk County police said today.

title: Multiple Checks Are Run On Beame's Appointees
description: Mayorelect Abraham D Beame's appointees are being run through a gantlet that in eludes a 10member talent screening committee, the City Commissioner of Investigation and the counsel to the city's Board of Ethics.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Because New York State motorvehicle offices closed for fourday weekends over Christmas and New Year's, all drivers' licenses and vehicle registrations scheduled to expire in December have been extended through Jan. 4. But the state says, motorists must maintain all required insurance on their vehicles for the extensions to be valid.

title: Fire Damages Dining Room
description: SHELBURNE, N.H., Dec. 30 (AP)A fire burned out the lounge and dining room of the Town and Country Motor Inn, here last night, causing an estimated $500,000 worth of damage, the officials said.

title: Minnesota and Miami Win Titles
GOING OUT Guide
description: TAKING LEAVE EVE So you're not a funnyhat type, a partyprowler, an elbowbender. You don't want to sit home all alone on New Year's Eve looking at TV. Here's something that blends an unhysterical good time with a bit of company. Go up to Riverside Church on Riverside Drive and 120th Street (7497000), not one of the more populated neighborhoods, tonight a hit before 11. There's an organ concert by Frederick Swann. It's a tribute to the tradition of the turn of the century, when live music was a rare treat in most communities, and people went to church or concert hall to hear music on the organs, which were built to imitate a symphony orchestra and were chockfull of reverberating effects on favorite pieces.

title: STATE MOVING 200 AT WILLOWBROOK
description: In an effort to reduce the population of Willowbrook State School on Staten Island to a more manageable figure, the State Department of Mental Hygiene said yesterday that it would move at least 200 patients to Kings Park State Hospital in Suffolk County.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Automation of New York City's 25 drawbridges was proposed yesterday by Highways Commissioner Manuel Carballo, who said a request for a pilot automation program to begin with two bridges in Brooklyn would be made this week to the City Planning Commission.

title: About New York
description: The fuel shortage grows, and its shadow lengthens in small ways. The Rev. George H. MacMurray stood in the pulpit of St. Philip's Church in Brooklyn yesterday, and after reflecting on the news he said that it all sounded disturbing, disheartening and perhaps discouraging. The mood on us now, he said, was a little like the one he remembered from the Depression.

title: PAUL GOLDMAN, 69, LEADER IN ZIONISM
description: Paul L. Goldman, a lawyer land Labor Zionist leader, died Saturday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 2160 Caton Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Aid to Dentistry Branded Costly by. Michigan Professor
description: A health economist who has analyzed the sixYear, $310million Federal program to increase the availability of dental care. has concluded that the Government could have attained the same result at onetenth the cost by subsidizing the cost of hiring dental technicians, or auxiliaries, rather than subsidizing dental schools.
